member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.FormData
member.summary: XMLHttpRequest Level 2 adds support for the new FormData interface. FormData objects provide a way to easily construct a set of key/value pairs representing form fields and their values, which can then be easily sent using the XMLHttpRequest send() method. It uses the same format a form would use if the encoding type were set to "multipart/form-data".

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.FormData.#ctor(Bridge.Html5.HTMLFormElement)
member.param: HTML Form Element to send for keys/values. It will also encode file input content.

member.summary: Appends a key/value pair to the FormData object.
member.param: The name of the field whose data is contained in value.
The field's value. Can be a Blob, File, or a string, if neither, the value is converted to a string.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.XMLHttpRequest
member.summary: XMLHttpRequest is a JavaScript object that was designed by Microsoft and adopted by Mozilla, Apple, and Google. It's now being standardized in the W3C. It provides an easy way to retrieve data from a URL without having to do a full page refresh. A Web page can update just a part of the page without disrupting what the user is doing. XMLHttpRequest is used heavily in AJAX programming. Despite its name, XMLHttpRequest can be used to retrieve any type of data, not just XML, and it supports protocols other than HTTP (including file and ftp).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.XMLHttpRequest.OnReadyStateChange
member.summary: A JavaScript function object that is called whenever the readyState attribute changes. The callback is called from the user interface thread.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.XMLHttpRequest.Response
member.summary: The response entity body according to responseType, as an ArrayBuffer, Blob, Document, JavaScript object (for "json"), or string. This is null if the request is not complete or was not successful.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.XMLHttpRequest.ResponseText
member.summary: The response to the request as text, or null if the request was unsuccessful or has not yet been sent.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.XMLHttpRequest.Status
member.summary: The status of the response to the request. This is the HTTP result code (for example, status is 200 for a successful request).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.XMLHttpRequest.StatusText
member.summary: The response string returned by the HTTP server. Unlike status, this includes the entire text of the response message ("200 OK", for example).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.XMLHttpRequest.Timeout
member.summary: The number of milliseconds a request can take before automatically being terminated. A value of 0 (which is the default) means there is no timeout.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.XMLHttpRequest.WithCredentials
member.summary: Indicates whether or not cross-site Access-Control requests should be made using credentials such as cookies or authorization headers. The default is false.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.XMLHttpRequest.Abort
member.summary: Aborts the request if it has already been sent.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.XMLHttpRequest.GetAllResponseHeaders
member.summary: Returns all the response headers as a string, or null if no response has been received. Note: For multipart requests, this returns the headers from the current part of the request, not from the original channel.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.XMLHttpRequest.GetResponseHeader(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the string containing the text of the specified header, or null if either the response has not yet been received or the header doesn't exist in the response.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.XMLHttpRequest.Open(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a request. This method is to be used from JavaScript code; to initialize a request from native code, use openRequest()instead.
member.param: The HTTP method to use, such as "GET", "POST", "PUT", "DELETE", etc. Ignored for non-HTTP(S) URLs.
The URL to send the request to.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.XMLHttpRequest.Open(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a request. This method is to be used from JavaScript code; to initialize a request from native code, use openRequest()instead.
member.param: The HTTP method to use, such as "GET", "POST", "PUT", "DELETE", etc. Ignored for non-HTTP(S) URLs.
The URL to send the request to.

An optional boolean parameter, defaulting to true, indicating whether or not to perform the operation asynchronously. If this value is false, the send()method does not return until the response is received. If true, notification of a completed transaction is provided using event listeners. This must be true if the multipart attribute is true, or an exception will be thrown.

This must be true if the multipart attribute is true, or an exception will be thrown.
The optional user name to use for authentication purposes; by default, this is an empty string.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.XMLHttpRequest.OverrideMimeType(System.String)
member.summary: Overrides the MIME type returned by the server. This may be used, for example, to force a stream to be treated and parsed as text/xml, even if the server does not report it as such. This method must be called before send().

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.XMLHttpRequest.Send
member.summary: Sends the request. If the request is asynchronous (which is the default), this method returns as soon as the request is sent. If the request is synchronous, this method doesn't return until the response has arrived.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.XMLHttpRequest.Send(System.String)

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.XMLHttpRequest.SetRequestHeader(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the value of an HTTP request header. You must call setRequestHeader() after open(), but before send(). If this method is called several times with the same header, the values are merged into one single request header.
member.param: The name of the header whose value is to be set.
The value to set as the body of the header.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.XMLHttpRequest.ResponseType
member.summary: Is an enumerated value that defines the response type. For possible values refer to enum Bridge.Html5.XMLHttpRequestResponseType.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.XMLHttpRequest.ResponseXML
member.summary: The response to the request as a DOM Document object, or null if the request was unsuccessful, has not yet been sent, or cannot be parsed as XML or HTML. The response is parsed as if it were a text/xml stream. When the responseType is set to "document" and the request has been made asynchronously, the response is parsed as a text/html stream.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.XMLHttpRequestEventTarget
member.summary: XMLHttpRequestEventTarget is the interface that describes the event handlers you can implement in an object that will handle events for an XMLHttpRequest.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.XMLHttpRequestEventTarget.OnAbort
member.summary: The function to call when a request is aborted.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.XMLHttpRequestEventTarget.OnError
member.summary: The function to call when a request encounters an error.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.XMLHttpRequestEventTarget.OnLoad
member.summary: The function to call when an HTTP request returns after successfully loading content.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.XMLHttpRequestEventTarget.OnLoadStart
member.summary: A function that gets called when the HTTP request first begins loading data.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.XMLHttpRequestEventTarget.OnProgress
member.summary: A function that is called periodically with information about the progress of the request.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.XMLHttpRequestEventTarget.OnTimeout
member.summary: A function that is called if the event times out; this only happens if a timeout has been previously established by setting the value of the XMLHttpRequest object's timeout attribute.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.XMLHttpRequestEventTarget.OnLoadEnd
member.summary: A function that is called when the load is completed, even if the request failed.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.Date
member.summary: JavaScript Date instances inherit from Date.prototype. You can modify the constructor's prototype object to affect properties and methods inherited by JavaScript Date instances.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Date.Now
member.summary: The Date.now() method returns the number of milliseconds elapsed since 1 January 1970 00:00:00 UTC.
member.remarks: Because now() is a static method of Date, you always use it as Date.now().
member.returns: A Number representing the milliseconds elapsed since the UNIX epoch.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Date.UTC(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: The Date.UTC() method accepts the same parameters as the longest form of the constructor, and returns the number of milliseconds in a Date object since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00, universal time.
member.remarks:
UTC() takes comma-delimited date parameters and returns the number of milliseconds between January 1, 1970, 00:00:00, universal time and the time you specified.
You should specify a full year for the year; for example, 1998. If a year between 0 and 99 is specified, the method converts the year to a year in the 20th century(1900 + year); for example, if you specify 95, the year 1995 is used.
member.param: A year after 1900.
An integer between 0 and 11 representing the month.
member.returns: A number representing the number of milliseconds in the given Date object since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00, universal time.

member.param: A year after 1900.
An integer between 0 and 11 representing the month.
An integer between 1 and 31 representing the day of the month.
member.returns: A number representing the number of milliseconds in the given Date object since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00, universal time.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Date.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: The Date.parse() method parses a string representation of a date, and returns the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC or NaN if the string is unrecognised or, in some cases, contains illegal date values (e.g. 2015-02-31).
member.param: A string representing an RFC2822 or ISO 8601 date (other formats may be used, but results may be unexpected).
member.returns: A number representing the milliseconds elapsed since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC and the date obtained by parsing the given string representation of a date. If the argument doesn't represent a valid date, NaN is returned.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Date.ToLocaleDateString
member.summary: The toLocaleDateString() method returns a string with a language sensitive representation of the date portion of this date. The new locales and options arguments let applications specify the language whose formatting conventions should be used and allow to customize the behavior of the function. In older implementations, which ignore the locales and options arguments, the locale used and the form of the string returned are entirely implementation dependent.
member.returns: A string representing the date portion of the given Date instance according to language-specific conventions.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Date.ToLocaleDateString(Bridge.Union{System.String,System.String[]})

In older implementations, which ignore the locales and options arguments, the locale used and the form of the string returned are entirely implementation dependent.
member.param: A string with a BCP 47 language tag, or an array of such strings.
member.returns: A string representing the date portion of the given Date instance according to language-specific conventions.

The new locales and options arguments let applications specify the language whose formatting conventions should be used and customize the behavior of the function. In older implementations, which ignore the locales and options arguments, the locale used and the form of the string returned are entirely implementation dependent.
member.returns: A string representing the time portion of the given Date instance according to language-specific conventions.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Date.ToLocaleTimeString(Bridge.Union{System.String,System.String[]})
member.summary: The toLocaleTimeString() method returns a string with a language sensitive representation of the time portion of this date. The new locales and options arguments let applications specify the language whose formatting conventions should be used and customize the behavior of the function. In older implementations, which ignore the locales and options arguments, the locale used and the form of the string returned are entirely implementation dependent.
member.param: A string with a BCP 47 language tag, or an array of such strings.
member.returns: A string representing the time portion of the given Date instance according to language-specific conventions.

member.summary: The toLocaleTimeString() method returns a string with a language sensitive representation of the time portion of this date. The new locales and options arguments let applications specify the language whose formatting conventions should be used and customize the behavior of the function. In older implementations, which ignore the locales and options arguments, the locale used and the form of the string returned are entirely implementation dependent.
member.param: A string with a BCP 47 language tag, or an array of such strings.
An object with some or all of the following properties:
member.returns: A string representing the time portion of the given Date instance according to language-specific conventions.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.Date.ToLocaleStringOptions
member.summary: An object with some or all of the following properties:
member.remarks: The default value for each date-time component property is undefined, but if the weekday, year, month, day properties are all undefined, then year, month, and day are assumed to be "numeric".

member.name: P:Bridge.Html5.Date.ToLocaleStringOptions.LocaleMatcher
member.summary: The locale matching algorithm to use. Possible values are "lookup" and "best fit"; the default is "best fit". For information about this option, see the Intl page.

member.name: P:Bridge.Html5.Date.ToLocaleStringOptions.TimeZone
member.summary: The time zone to use. The only value implementations must recognize is "UTC"; the default is the runtime's default time zone. Implementations may also recognize the time zone names of the IANA time zone database, such as "Asia/Shanghai", "Asia/Kolkata", "America/New_York".

member.name: P:Bridge.Html5.Date.ToLocaleStringOptions.Hour12
member.summary: Whether to use 12-hour time (as opposed to 24-hour time). Possible values are true and false; the default is locale dependent.

member.name: P:Bridge.Html5.Date.ToLocaleStringOptions.FormatMatcher
member.summary: The format matching algorithm to use. Possible values are "basic" and "best fit"; the default is "best fit". See the following paragraphs for information about the use of this property.

member.name: P:Bridge.Html5.Date.ToLocaleStringOptions.Weekday
member.summary: The representation of the weekday. Possible values are "narrow", "short", "long".

member.name: P:Bridge.Html5.Date.ToLocaleStringOptions.Era
member.summary: The representation of the era. Possible values are "narrow", "short", "long".

member.name: P:Bridge.Html5.Date.ToLocaleStringOptions.Year
member.summary: The representation of the year. Possible values are "numeric", "2-digit".

member.name: P:Bridge.Html5.Date.ToLocaleStringOptions.Month
member.summary: The representation of the month. Possible values are "numeric", "2-digit", "narrow", "short", "long".

member.name: P:Bridge.Html5.Date.ToLocaleStringOptions.Day
member.summary: The representation of the day. Possible values are "numeric", "2-digit".

member.name: P:Bridge.Html5.Date.ToLocaleStringOptions.Hour
member.summary: The representation of the hour. Possible values are "numeric", "2-digit".

member.name: P:Bridge.Html5.Date.ToLocaleStringOptions.Minute
member.summary: The representation of the minute. Possible values are "numeric", "2-digit".

member.name: P:Bridge.Html5.Date.ToLocaleStringOptions.Second
member.summary: The representation of the second. Possible values are "numeric", "2-digit".

member.name: P:Bridge.Html5.Date.ToLocaleStringOptions.TimeZoneName
member.summary: The representation of the time zone name. Possible values are "short", "long".

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Date.ValueOf
member.summary: The valueOf() method returns the primitive value of a Date object.
member.remarks: The valueOf() method returns the primitive value of a Date object as a number data type, the number of milliseconds since midnight 01 January, 1970 UTC.
member.returns: The number of milliseconds between 1 January 1970 00:00:00 UTC and the given date.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Date.ToISOString
member.summary: The toISOString() method returns a string in simplified extended ISO format (ISO 8601), which is always 24 or 27 characters long (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sssZ or Â±YYYYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sssZ, respectively). The timezone is always zero UTC offset, as denoted by the suffix "Z".
member.returns: A string representing the given date in the ISO 8601 format according to universal time.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Date.ToUTCString
member.summary: The toUTCString() method converts a date to a string, using the UTC time zone.
member.returns: A string representing the given date using the UTC time zone.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Date.GetTime
member.summary: The getTime() method returns the numeric value corresponding to the time for the specified date according to universal time. You can use this method to help assign a date and time to another Date object. This method is functionally equivalent to the valueOf() method.
member.returns: A number representing the milliseconds elapsed between 1 January 1970 00:00:00 UTC and the given date.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Date.SetTime(System.Double)
member.summary: The setTime() method sets the Date object to the time represented by a number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC.
member.param: The number of milliseconds between 1 January 1970 00:00:00 UTC and the updated date (effectively, the value of the argument).

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Date.GetTimezoneOffset
member.summary: The getTimezoneOffset() method returns the time zone difference, in minutes, from current locale (host system settings) to UTC.
member.returns: A number representing the time-zone offset from UTC, in minutes, for the date based on current host system settings.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Date.GetFullYear
member.summary: The getFullYear() method returns the year of the specified date according to local time. Use this method instead of the getYear() method.
member.returns: A number corresponding to the year of the given date, according to local time.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Date.GetUTCFullYear
member.summary: The getUTCFullYear() method returns the year in the specified date according to universal time.
member.returns: A number representing the year in the given date according to universal time.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Date.GetMonth
member.summary: The getMonth() method returns the month in the specified date according to local time, as a zero-based value (where zero indicates the first month of the year).
member.returns: An integer number, between 0 and 11, representing the month in the given date according to local time. 0 corresponds to January, 1 to February, and so on.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Date.GetUTCMonth
member.summary: The getUTCMonth() returns the month of the specified date according to universal time, as a zero-based value (where zero indicates the first month of the year).
member.returns: An integer number, between 0 and 11, corresponding to the month of the given date according to universal time. 0 for January, 1 for February, 2 for March, and so on.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Date.GetDate

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.DataTransfer.ClearData(System.String)

member.param: A string representing the type of data to remove. (Optional)

Data to add to the drag object.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.Element
member.summary:
The Element interface represents an object of a Document. This interface describes methods and properties common to all kinds of elements. Specific behaviors are described in interfaces which inherit from Element but add additional functionality. For example, the HTMLElement interface is the base interface for HTML elements, while the SVGElement interface is the basis for all SVG elements.
Languages outside the realm of the Web platform, like XUL through the XULElement interface, also implement it.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Element.Attributes
member.summary: Collection of all attribute nodes registered to the specified node.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Element.ChildElementCount
member.summary: The number of child nodes that are elements.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Element.Children
member.summary: All child elements of an element as a collection.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Element.ClassList
member.summary: Token list of class attribute

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Element.ClassName
member.summary: gets and sets the value of the class attribute of the specified element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Element.ClientHeight
member.summary: The Element.clientHeight read-only property returns the inner height of an element in pixels, including padding but not the horizontal scrollbar height, border, or margin.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Element.ClientLeft
member.summary: The width of the left border of an element in pixels. It includes the width of the vertical scrollbar if the text direction of the element is rightâtoâleft and if there is an overflow causing a left vertical scrollbar to be rendered. clientLeft does not include the left margin or the left padding. clientLeft is read-only.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Element.ClientTop
member.summary: The width of the top border of an element in pixels. It does not include the top margin or padding. clientTop is read-only.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Element.ClientWidth
member.summary: The Element.clientWidth property is the inner width of an element in pixels. It includes padding but not the vertical scrollbar (if present, if rendered), border or margin.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Element.FirstElementChild
member.summary: The ParentNode.firstElementChild read-only property returns the object's first child Element, or null if there are no child elements.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Element.Hidden
member.summary: The hidden global attribute is a Boolean attribute indicating that the element is not yet, or is no longer, relevant.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Element.Id
member.summary: Gets or sets the element's identifier (attribute id).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Element.InnerHTML
member.summary: The innerHTML sets or gets the HTML syntax describing the element's descendants.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Element.LastElementChild
member.summary: The ParentNode.lastElementChild read-only method returns the object's last child Element or null if there are no child elements.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Element.PreviousElementSibling
member.summary: Returns the Element immediately prior to this ChildNode in its parent's children list, or null if there is no Element in the list prior to this ChildNode.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Element.NextElementSibling
member.summary: Returns the Element immediately following this ChildNode in its parent's children list, or null if there is no Element in the list following this ChildNode.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Element.OuterHTML
member.summary: The outerHTML attribute of the element DOM interface gets the serialized HTML fragment describing the element including its descendants. It can be set to replace the element with nodes parsed from the given string.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Element.ScrollHeight
member.summary: The Element.scrollHeight read-only attribute is a measurement of the height of an element's content including content not visible on the screen due to overflow. The scrollHeight value is equal to the minimum clientHeight the element would require in order to fit all the content in the viewpoint without using a vertical scrollbar. It includes the element padding but not its margin.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Element.ScrollLeft
member.summary: The Element.scrollLeft property gets or sets the number of pixels that an element's content is scrolled to the left.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Element.ScrollTop
member.summary: The Element.scrollTop property gets or sets the number of pixels that the content of an element is scrolled upward. An element's scrollTop is a measurement of the distance of an element's top to its topmost visible content. When an element content does not generate a vertical scrollbar, then its scrollTop value defaults to 0.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Element.ScrollWidth
member.summary: The Element.scrollWidth readâonly property returns either the width in pixels of the content of an element or the width of the element itself, whichever is greater. If the element is wider than its content area (for example, if there are scroll bars for scrolling through the content), the scrollWidth is larger than the clientWidth.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Element.InsertAdjacentHTML(Bridge.Html5.InsertPosition,System.String)
member.summary: Parses the specified text as HTML or XML and inserts the resulting nodes into the DOM tree at a specified position. It does not reparse the element it is being used on and thus it does not corrupt the existing elements inside the element. This, and avoiding the extra step of serialization make it much faster than direct innerHTML manipulation.
member.param: The position relative to the element
String to be parsed as HTML or XML and inserted into the tree.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.DragEvent.DataTransfer
member.summary: The data that is transferred during a drag and drop interaction.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.DragEvent`1
member.summary: A generic version of the DragEvent class. The type parameter is a type of CurrentTarget.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.DragEvent`1.CurrentTarget
member.summary: Identifies the current target for the event, as the event traverses the DOM. It always refers to the element the event handler has been attached to as opposed to event.target which identifies the element on which the event occurred. On Internet Explorer 6 through 8, the event model is different. Event listeners are attached with the non-standard element.attachEvent method. In this model, there is no equivalent to event.currentTarget and this is the global object.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.DragEvent`1.Target
member.summary: This property of event objects is the object the event was dispatched on. It is different than event.currentTarget when the event handler is called in bubbling or capturing phase of the event. On IE6-8, the event model is different. Event listeners are attached with the non-standard element.attachEvent method. In this model, the event object is not passed as an argument to the event handler function but is the window.event object. This object has an srcElement property which has the same semantics than event.target.

member.summary: Creates a new CloseEvent

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CloseEvent.Code
member.summary: Close code sent by the server.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CloseEvent.Reason
member.summary: Reason the server closed the connection. This is specific to the particular server and sub-protocol.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CloseEvent.WasClean
member.summary: Indicates whether or not the connection was cleanly closed.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CloseEvent.StatusCode.CLOSE_NORMAL
member.summary: Normal closure; the connection successfully completed whatever purpose for which it was created.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CloseEvent.StatusCode.CLOSE_GOING_AWAY
member.summary: The endpoint is going away, either because of a server failure or because the browser is navigating away from the page that opened the connection.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CloseEvent.StatusCode.CLOSE_PROTOCOL_ERROR
member.summary: // The endpoint is terminating the connection due to a protocol error.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CloseEvent.StatusCode.CLOSE_UNSUPPORTED
member.summary: The connection is being terminated because the endpoint received data of a type it cannot accept (for example, a text-only endpoint received binary data).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CloseEvent.StatusCode.CLOSE_NO_STATUS
member.summary: Reserved. Indicates that no status code was provided even though one was expected.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CloseEvent.StatusCode.CLOSE_ABNORMAL
member.summary: Reserved. Used to indicate that a connection was closed abnormally (that is, with no close frame being sent) when a status code is expected.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CloseEvent.StatusCode.UNSUPPORTED_DATA
member.summary: The endpoint is terminating the connection because a message was received that contained inconsistent data (e.g., non-UTF-8 data within a text message).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CloseEvent.StatusCode.POLICY_VIOLATION
member.summary: The endpoint is terminating the connection because it received a message that violates its policy. This is a generic status code, used when codes 1003 and 1009 are not suitable.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CloseEvent.StatusCode.CLOSE_TOO_LARGE
member.summary: The endpoint is terminating the connection because a data frame was received that is too large.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CloseEvent.StatusCode.MISSIN_EXTENTION
member.summary: The client is terminating the connection because it expected the server to negotiate one or more extension, but the server didn't.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CloseEvent.StatusCode.INTERNAL_ERROR
member.summary: The server is terminating the connection because it encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CloseEvent.StatusCode.SERVICE_RESTART
member.summary: The server is terminating the connection because it is restarting. [Ref]

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CloseEvent.StatusCode.TRY_AGAIN_LATER
member.summary: The server is terminating the connection due to a temporary condition, e.g. it is overloaded and is casting off some of its clients. [Ref]

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CloseEvent.StatusCode.TLS_HANDSHAKE
member.summary: Reserved. Indicates that the connection was closed due to a failure to perform a TLS handshake (e.g., the server certificate can't be verified).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CloseEventInit.Code
member.summary: Indicates the Close code.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CloseEventInit.Reason
member.summary: Indicates the Reason the server closed the connection. This is specific to the particular server and sub-protocol.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CloseEventInit.WasClean
member.summary: Indicates whether or not the connection was cleanly closed.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Gamepad.DisplayId
member.summary: Returns the VRDisplay.displayId of the associated VRDisplay â the VRDisplay that the gamepad is controlling the displayed scene of.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Gamepad.Id
member.summary: An identification string for the gamepad. This string identifies the brand or style of connected gamepad device. Typically, this will include the USB vendor and a product ID.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Gamepad.Index
member.summary: The index of the gamepad in the Navigator. When multiple gamepads are connected to a user agent, indices must be assigned on a first-come, first-serve basis, starting at zero. If a gamepad is disconnected, previously assigned indices must not be reassigned to gamepads that continue to be connected. However, if a gamepad is disconnected, and subsequently the same or a different gamepad is then connected, index entries must be reused.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Gamepad.Connected
member.summary: Indicates whether the physical device represented by this object is still connected to the system. When a gamepad becomes unavailable, whether by being physically disconnected, powered off or otherwise unusable, the connected attribute must be set to false.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Gamepad.Timestamp
member.summary: Last time the data for this gamepad was updated. Timestamp is a monotonically increasing value that allows the author to determine if the axes and button data have been updated from the hardware. The value must be relative to the navigationStart attribute of the PerformanceTiming interface. Since values are monotonically increasing they can be compared to determine the ordering of updates, as newer values will always be greater than or equal to older values. If no data has been received from the hardware, the value of the timestamp attribute should be the time relative to navigationStart when the Gamepad object was first made available to script.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Gamepad.Mapping
member.summary: The mapping in use for this device. If the user agent has knowledge of the layout of the device, then it should indicate that a mapping is in use by setting this property to a known mapping name. Currently the only known mapping is "standard", which corresponds to the Standard Gamepad layout. If the user agent does not have knowledge of the device layout and is simply providing the controls as represented by the driver in use, then it must set the mapping property to an empty string.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Gamepad.Axes
member.summary: Array of values for all axes of the gamepad. All axis values must be linearly normalized to the range [-1.0 .. 1.0]. As appropriate, -1.0 should correspond to "up" or "left", and 1.0 should correspond to "down" or "right". Axes that are drawn from a 2D input device should appear next to each other in the axes array, X then Y. It is recommended that axes appear in decreasing order of importance, such that element 0 and 1 typically represent the X and Y axis of a directional stick.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Gamepad.Buttons
member.summary: Array of button states for all buttons of the gamepad. It is recommended that buttons appear in decreasing importance such that the primary button, secondary button, tertiary button, and so on appear as elements 0, 1, 2, ... in the buttons array.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.GamepadButton.Pressed
member.summary: The pressed state of the button. This property must be true if the button is currently pressed, and false if it is not pressed. For buttons which do not have a digital switch to indicate a pure pressed or released state, the user agent must choose a threshold value to indicate the button as pressed when its value is above a certain amount. If the platform API gives a recommended value, the user agent should use that. In other cases, the user agent should choose some other reasonable value.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.GamepadButton.Value
member.summary: For buttons that have an analog sensor, this property must represent the amount which the button has been pressed. All button values must be linearly normalized to the range [0.0 .. 1.0]. 0.0 must mean fully unpressed, and 1.0 must mean fully pressed. For buttons without an analog sensor, only the values 0.0 and 1.0 for fully unpressed and fully pressed must be provided.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Touch.Identifier
member.summary: Returns a unique identifier for this object. A given touch point (say, by a finger) will have the same identifier for the duration of its movement around the surface. This lets you ensure that you're tracking the same touch all the time.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Touch.ScreenX
member.summary: Returns the X coordinate of the touch point relative to the left edge of the screen.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Touch.ScreenY
member.summary: Returns the Y coordinate of the touch point relative to the top edge of the screen.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Touch.ClientX
member.summary: Returns the X coordinate of the touch point relative to the left edge of the browser viewport, not including any scroll offset.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Touch.ClientY
member.summary: Returns the Y coordinate of the touch point relative to the top edge of the browser viewport, not including any scroll offset.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Touch.PageX
member.summary: Returns the X coordinate of the touch point relative to the left edge of the document. Unlike clientX, this value includes the horizontal scroll offset, if any.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Touch.PageY
member.summary: Returns the Y coordinate of the touch point relative to the top of the document. Unlike clientY, this value includes the vertical scroll offset, if any.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Touch.Target
member.summary: Returns the on which the touch point started when it was first placed on the surface, even if the touch point has since moved outside the interactive area of that element or even been removed from the document.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Touch.RadiusX
member.summary: Returns the X radius of the ellipse that most closely circumscribes the area of contact with the screen. The value is in pixels of the same scale as screenX.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Touch.RadiusY
member.summary: Returns the Y radius of the ellipse that most closely circumscribes the area of contact with the screen. The value is in pixels of the same scale as screenY.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Touch.RotationAngle
member.summary: Returns the angle (in degrees) that the ellipse described by radiusX and radiusY must be rotated, clockwise, to most accurately cover the area of contact between the user and the surface.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Touch.Force
member.summary: Returns the amount of pressure being applied to the surface by the user, as a float between 0.0 (no pressure) and 1.0 (maximum pressure).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TouchList.Length
member.summary: The number of objects in the TouchList.

member.name: P:Bridge.Html5.TouchList.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the object at the specified index in the list.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.TouchList.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns enumerator of objects in the TouchList

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.LocaleOptions
member.summary: A representaion of the options used in https://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/toLocaleDateString

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.LocaleOptions.LocaleMatcher
member.summary: The locale matching algorithm to use. Possible values are "lookup" and "best fit"; the default is "best fit". For information about this option, see the Intl page.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.LocaleOptions.Usage
member.summary: Whether the comparison is for sorting or for searching for matching strings. Possible values are "sort" and "search"; the default is "sort".

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.LocaleOptions.Sensitivity
member.summary: Which differences in the strings should lead to non-zero result values.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.LocaleOptions.IgnorePunctuation
member.summary: Whether punctuation should be ignored. Possible values are true and false; the default is false.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.LocaleOptions.Numeric
member.summary: Whether numeric collation should be used, such that "1" < "2" < "10". Possible values are true and false; the default is false. This option can be set through an options property or through a Unicode extension key; if both are provided, the options property takes precedence. Implementations are not required to support this property.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.LocaleOptions.CaseFirst
member.summary: Whether upper case or lower case should sort first. Possible values are "upper", "lower", or "false" (use the locale's default); the default is "false". This option can be set through an options property or through a Unicode extension key; if both are provided, the options property takes precedence. Implementations are not required to support this property.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.CaseFirst
member.summary: Whether upper case or lower case should sort first. Possible values are "upper", "lower", or "false" (use the locale's default); the default is "false". This option can be set through an options property or through a Unicode extension key; if both are provided, the options property takes precedence. Implementations are not required to support this property.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.Sensitivity
member.summary: Which differences in the strings should lead to non-zero result values.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Sensitivity.Base
member.summary: Only strings that differ in base letters compare as unequal. Examples: a â b, a = Ã¡, a = A.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Sensitivity.Accent
member.summary: Only strings that differ in base letters or accents and other diacritic marks compare as unequal. Examples: a â b, a â Ã¡, a = A.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Sensitivity.Case
member.summary: Only strings that differ in base letters or case compare as unequal. Examples: a â b, a = Ã¡, a â A.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Sensitivity.Variant
member.summary: Strings that differ in base letters, accents and other diacritic marks, or case compare as unequal. Other differences may also be taken into consideration. Examples: a â b, a â Ã¡, a â A.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.Usage
member.summary: Whether the comparison is for sorting or for searching for matching strings. Possible values are "sort" and "search"; the default is "sort".

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.LocaleMatcher
member.summary: The locale matching algorithm to use. Possible values are "lookup" and "best fit"; the default is "best fit". For information about this option, see the Intl page.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.MutationRecord
member.summary: see MDN

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.MutationObserverInit
member.summary: see MDN

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.MutationObserver
member.summary: Provides developers a way to react to changes in a DOM. It is designed as a replacement for Mutation Events defined in the DOM3 Events specification. see MDN

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.MutationObserver.#ctor(System.Action{Bridge.Html5.MutationRecord[],Bridge.Html5.MutationObserver})
member.summary: Constructor for instantiating new DOM mutation observers.
member.param: The function which will be called on each DOM mutation. The observer will call this function with two arguments. The first is an array of objects, each of type MutationRecord. The second is this MutationObserver instance.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.MutationObserver.Observe(Bridge.Html5.Node,Bridge.Html5.MutationObserverInit)
member.summary: Registers the MutationObserver instance to receive notifications of DOM mutations on the specified node.
member.param: The Node on which to observe DOM mutations.
A MutationObserverInit object, specifies which DOM mutations should be reported.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.MutationObserver.Disconnect
member.summary: Stops the MutationObserver instance from receiving notifications of DOM mutations. Until the observe() method is used again, observer's callback will not be invoked.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.MutationObserver.TakeRecords
member.summary: Empties the MutationObserver instance's record queue and returns what was in there.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.StringPrototype.Replace(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The replace() method returns a new string with some or all matches of a pattern replaced by a replacement. The pattern can be a string or a RegExp, and the replacement can be a string or a function to be called for each match.
member.param: A string instance
A String that is to be replaced by newSubStr. It is treated as a verbatim string and is not interpreted as a regular expression. Only the first occurrence will be replaced.

The String that replaces the substring specified by the specified regexp or substr parameter. A number of special replacement patterns are supported; see the "Specifying a string as a parameter" section below.
member.returns: A new string with some or all matches of a pattern replaced by a replacement.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.StringPrototype.Slice(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: The slice() method extracts a section of a string and returns a new string.
member.param: A string instance

The zero-based index at which to begin extraction. If negative, it is treated as strLength + beginIndex where strLength is the length of the string (for example, if beginIndex is -3 it is treated as strLength - 3). If beginIndex is greater than or equal to the length of the string, slice() returns an empty string.
member.returns: A new string containing the extracted section of the string.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.StringPrototype.Slice(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: The slice() method extracts a section of a string and returns a new string.
member.param: A string instance

The zero-based index at which to begin extraction. If negative, it is treated as strLength + beginIndex where strLength is the length of the string (for example, if beginIndex is -3 it is treated as strLength - 3). If beginIndex is greater than or equal to the length of the string, slice() returns an empty string.

The zero-based index before which to end extraction. The character at this index will not be included. If endIndex is omitted, slice() extracts to the end of the string. If negative, it is treated as strLength + endIndex where strLength is the length of the string (for example, if endIndex is -3 it is treated as strLength - 3).
member.returns: A new string containing the extracted section of the string.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.StringPrototype.Split(System.String,System.Char)
member.summary: Splits a String object into an array of strings by separating the string into substrings.
member.param: A string instance

Specifies the character to use for separating the string. The separator is treated as a string or a regular expression. If separator is omitted or does not occur in str, the array returned contains one element consisting of the entire string. If separator is an empty string, str is converted to an array of characters.
member.returns: An array of strings split at each point where the separator occurs in the given string.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.StringPrototype.Split(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Splits a String object into an array of strings by separating the string into substrings.
member.param: A string instance

Integer specifying a limit on the number of splits to be found. The split() method still splits on every match of separator, until the number of split items match the limit or the string falls short of separator.
member.returns: An array of strings split at each point where the separator occurs in the given string.

member.summary: The substr() method returns the characters in a string beginning at the specified location through the specified number of characters.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.StringPrototype.CharAt(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: The charAt() method returns the specified character from a string.
member.param: A string instance
An integer between 0 and 1-less-than the length of the string. If no index is provided, charAt() will use 0.
member.returns: A string representing the character at the specified index; empty string if index is out of range.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.StringPrototype.CharCodeAt(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: The charCodeAt() method returns an integer between 0 and 65535 representing the UTF-16 code unit at the given index (the UTF-16 code unit matches the Unicode code point for code points representable in a single UTF-16 code unit, but might also be the first code unit of a surrogate pair for code points not representable in a single UTF-16 code unit, e.g. Unicode code points > 0x10000). If you want the entire code point value, use codePointAt().
member.param: A string instance
An integer greater than or equal to 0 and less than the length of the string; if it is not a number, it defaults to 0.
member.returns: A number representing the UTF-16 code unit value of the character at the given index; NaN if index is out of range.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.Float32Array
member.summary: Represents an array of 32-bit floating point numbers (corresponding to the C 'float' data type) in the platform byte order. If control over byte order is needed, use DataView instead. The contents are initialized to 0. Once established, you can reference elements in the array using the object's methods, or using standard array index syntax (that is, using bracket notation).

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.Int16Array

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.CanvasGradient
member.summary: The CanvasGradient interface represents an opaque object describing a gradient. It is returned by the methods CanvasRenderingContext2D.createLinearGradient() or CanvasRenderingContext2D.createRadialGradient().

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.CanvasGradient.AddColorStop(System.Double,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new stop, defined by an offset and a color, to the gradient. If the offset is not between 0 and 1 an INDEX_SIZE_ERR is raised, if the color can't be parsed as a CSS <color>, a SYNTAX_ERR is raised.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.CanvasPattern
member.summary: The CanvasPattern interface represents an opaque object describing a pattern, based on a image, a canvas or a video, created by the CanvasRenderingContext2D.createPattern() method.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.CanvasPattern.SetTransform(Bridge.Html5.SVGMatrix)
member.summary: This method uses an SVGMatrix object as the pattern's transformation matrix and invokes it on the pattern.
member.remarks: This is experimental API that should not be used in production code.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.ImageData
member.summary: The ImageData interface represents the underlying pixel data of an area of a <canvas> element. It is created using the ImageData() constructor or creator methods on the CanvasRenderingContext2D object associated with a canvas: createImageData() and getImageData(). It can also be used to set a part of the canvas by using putImageData().

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.ImageData.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an ImageData object.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.ImageData.#ctor(Bridge.Html5.Uint8ClampedArray,System.UInt32,System.Nullable{System.UInt32})
member.summary: Creates an ImageData object from a given Uint8ClampedArray and the size of the image it contains. Note that this is the most common way to create such an object in workers as createImageData() is not available there.
member.param: A Uint8ClampedArray containing the underlying pixel representation of theimage.
An unsigned number representing the width of the represented image.
An unsigned number representing the height of the represented image. This value is optional if an array is given: it will be inferred from its size and the given width.
member.remarks: This is experimental API that should not be used in production code.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.ImageData.#ctor(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Creates an ImageData object from the size of the image. Without specifying the array, an image of a black rectangle is created. Note that this is the most common way to create such an object in workers as createImageData() is not available there.
member.param: An unsigned number representing the width of the represented image.
An unsigned number representing the height of the represented image.
member.remarks: This is experimental API that should not be used in production code.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.ImageData.Data
member.summary: A Uint8ClampedArray representing a one-dimensional array containing the data in the RGBA order, with integer values between 0 and 255 (included).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.ImageData.Height
member.summary: An unsigned number representing the actual height, in pixels, of the ImageData.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.ImageData.Width
member.summary: An unsigned number representing the actual width, in pixels, of the ImageData.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.Path2D
member.summary: The Path2D interface of the Canvas 2D API is used to declare paths that are then later used on CanvasRenderingContext2D objects. The path methods of the CanvasRenderingContext2D interface are present on this interface as well and are allowing you to create paths that you can retain and replay as required on a canvas.
member.remarks: This is experimental API that should not be used in production code.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Path2D.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new Path2D object.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Path2D.#ctor(Bridge.Html5.Path2D)
member.summary: Creates a new Path2D object from an specified Path2D object.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Path2D.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new Path2D object from an specified string consisting of SVG path data.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Path2D.AddPath(Bridge.Html5.Path2D,Bridge.Html5.SVGMatrix)
member.summary: Adds a path to the current path.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.SVGMatrix
member.summary: Many of SVG's graphics operations utilize 2x3 matrices which can be expanded into a 3x3 matrix for the purposes of matrix arithmetic. An SVGMatrix object can be designated as read only, which means that attempts to modify the object will result in an exception being thrown.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.SVGMatrix.a
member.summary: SVGMatrix component.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.SVGMatrix.b
member.summary: SVGMatrix component.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.SVGMatrix.c
member.summary: SVGMatrix component.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.SVGMatrix.d
member.summary: SVGMatrix component.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.SVGMatrix.e
member.summary: SVGMatrix component.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.SVGMatrix.f
member.summary: SVGMatrix component.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.SVGMatrix.Multiply(Bridge.Html5.SVGMatrix)
member.summary: Performs matrix multiplication. This matrix is post-multiplied by another matrix, returning the resulting new matrix.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.SVGMatrix.Translate(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Post-multiplies a translation transformation on the current matrix and returns the resulting matrix.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.SVGMatrix.Scale(System.Single)
member.summary: Post-multiplies a uniform scale transformation on the current matrix and returns the resulting matrix.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.SVGMatrix.ScaleNonUniform(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Post-multiplies a non-uniform scale transformation on the current matrix and returns the resulting matrix.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.SVGMatrix.Rotate(System.Single)
member.summary: Post-multiplies a rotation transformation on the current matrix and returns the resulting matrix. (angle is measures in degrees.)

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.SVGMatrix.RotateFromVector(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Post-multiplies a rotation transformation on the current matrix and returns the resulting matrix. The rotation angle is determined by taking (+/-) atan(y/x). The direction of the vector (x, y) determines whether the positive or negative angle value is used. A DOMException with code SVG_INVALID_VALUE_ERR is raised if one of the parameters has an invalid value.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.SVGMatrix.FlipX
member.summary: Post-multiplies the transformation [-1 0 0 1 0 0] and returns the resulting matrix.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.SVGMatrix.FlipY
member.summary: Post-multiplies the transformation [1 0 0 -1 0 0] and returns the resulting matrix.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.SVGMatrix.SkewX(System.Single)
member.summary: Post-multiplies a skewX transformation on the current matrix and returns the resulting matrix.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.SVGMatrix.SkewY(System.Single)
member.summary: Post-multiplies a skewY transformation on the current matrix and returns the resulting matrix.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.SVGOperations
member.summary: This interface was written so that both Path2D and CanvasRenderingContext2D could inherit their methods (which are the exact same).

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.SVGOperations.ClosePath
member.summary: Causes the point of the pen to move back to the start of the current sub-path. It tries to draw a straight line from the current point to the start. If the shape has already been closed or has only one point, this function does nothing.

member.param: The x axis of the coordinate for the arc's center.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasCompositeOperationType
member.summary: Indicates the desired type of compositing operation among the existing ones. See example effects in https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/globalCompositeOperation

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasCompositeOperationType.SourceOver
member.summary: Default. Draws new shapes on top of the existing canvas content.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasCompositeOperationType.SourceIn
member.summary: The new shape is drawn only where both the new shape and the destination canvas overlap. Everything else is made transparent.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasCompositeOperationType.SourceOut
member.summary: The new shape is drawn where it doesn't overlap the existing canvas content.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasCompositeOperationType.SourceAtop
member.summary: The new shape is only drawn where it overlaps the existing canvas content.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasCompositeOperationType.DestinationOver
member.summary: New shapes are drawn behind the existing canvas content.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasCompositeOperationType.DestinationIn
member.summary: The existing canvas content is kept where both the new shape and existing canvas content overlap. Everything else is made transparent.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasCompositeOperationType.DestinationOut
member.summary: The existing content is kept where it doesn't overlap the new shape.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasCompositeOperationType.DestinationAtop
member.summary: The existing canvas is only kept where it overlaps the new shape. The new shape is drawn behind the canvas content.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasCompositeOperationType.Lighter
member.summary: Where both shapes overlap the color is determined by adding color values.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasCompositeOperationType.Copy
member.summary: Only the existing canvas is present.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasCompositeOperationType.XOr
member.summary: Shapes are made transparent where both overlap and drawn normal everywhere else.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasCompositeOperationType.Multiply
member.summary: The pixels are of the top layer are multiplied with the corresponding pixel of the bottom layer. A darker picture is the result.
member.remarks: Does not work on all browsers

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasCompositeOperationType.Screen
member.summary: The pixels are inverted, multiplied, and inverted again. A lighter picture is the result (opposite of multiply)
member.remarks: Does not work on all browsers

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasCompositeOperationType.Overlay
member.summary: A combination of multiply and screen. Dark parts on the base layer become darker, and light parts become lighter.
member.remarks: Does not work on all browsers

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasCompositeOperationType.Darken
member.summary: Retains the darkest pixels of both layers.
member.remarks: Does not work on all browsers

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasCompositeOperationType.Lighten
member.summary: Retains the lightest pixels of both layers.
member.remarks: Does not work on all browsers

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasCompositeOperationType.ColorDodge
member.summary: Divides the bottom layer by the inverted top layer.
member.remarks: Does not work on all browsers

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasCompositeOperationType.ColorBurn
member.summary: Divides the inverted bottom layer by the top layer, and then inverts the result.
member.remarks: Does not work on all browsers

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasCompositeOperationType.HardLight
member.summary: A combination of multiply and screen like overlay, but with top and bottom layer swapped.
member.remarks: Does not work on all browsers

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasCompositeOperationType.SoftLight
member.summary: A softer version of hard-light. Pure black or white does not result in pure black or white.
member.remarks: Does not work on all browsers

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasCompositeOperationType.Difference
member.summary: Subtracts the bottom layer from the top layer or the other way round to always get a positive value.
member.remarks: Does not work on all browsers

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasCompositeOperationType.Exclusion
member.summary: Like difference, but with lower contrast.
member.remarks: Does not work on all browsers

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasCompositeOperationType.Hue
member.summary: Preserves the luma and chroma of the bottom layer, while adopting the hue of the top layer.
member.remarks: Does not work on all browsers

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasCompositeOperationType.Saturation
member.summary: Preserves the luma and hue of the bottom layer, while adopting the chroma of the top layer.
member.remarks: Does not work on all browsers

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasCompositeOperationType.Color
member.summary: Preserves the luma of the bottom layer, while adopting the hue and chroma of the top layer.
member.remarks: Does not work on all browsers

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasCompositeOperationType.Luminosity
member.summary: Preserves the hue and chroma of the bottom layer, while adopting the luma of the top layer.
member.remarks: Does not work on all browsers

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasCompositeOperationType.Null
member.summary: Clear the value, to revert back to browser's default.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasContext2DType
member.summary: Indicates the 2D context on CanvaslElement.GetContext().

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasContext2DType.CanvasRenderingContext2D
member.summary: 2d: Two-dimensional rendering context: CanvasRenderingContext2D

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasContextWebGLType
member.summary: Indicates the WebGL (OpenGL ES 2.0) context on CanvaslElement.GetContext().

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasContextWebGLType.WebGL
member.summary: WebGL -- available only on browsers that implement WebGL version 1 (OpenGL ES 2.0)

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasContextWebGLType.Experimental_WebGL
member.summary: Experimental WebGL -- available only on browsers that implement WebGL version 1 (OpenGL ES 2.0)

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasLineCapType
member.summary: There are three possible values for this property and those are: butt, round and square. By default this property is set to butt.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasLineCapType.Butt
member.summary: Default. The ends of lines are squared off at the endpoints.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasLineCapType.Round
member.summary: The ends of lines are rounded.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasLineCapType.Square
member.summary: The ends of lines are squared off by adding a box with an equal width and half the height of the line's thickness.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasLineCapType.Null
member.summary: Clear the value, to revert back to browser's default.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasLineJoinType
member.summary: There are three possible values for this property: round, bevel and miter. By default this property is set to miter. Note that the lineJoin setting has no effect if the two connected segments have the same direction, because no joining area will be added in this case.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasLineJoinType.Round
member.summary: Rounds off the corners of a shape by filling an additional sector of disc centered at the common endpoint of connected segments. The radius for these rounded corners is equal to the line width.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasLineJoinType.Bevel
member.summary: Fills an additional triangular area between the common endpoint of connected segments, and the separate outside rectangular corners of each segment.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasLineJoinType.Miter
member.summary: Default. Connected segments are joined by extending their outside edges to connect at a single point, with the effect of filling an additional lozenge-shaped area. This setting is effected by the miterLimit property.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasLineJoinType.Null
member.summary: Clear the value, to revert back to browser's default.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasTextAlign.Left
member.summary: The text is left-aligned.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasTextAlign.Right
member.summary: The text is right-aligned.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasTextAlign.Center
member.summary: The text is centered.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasTextAlign.Start
member.summary: Default. The text is aligned at the normal start of the line (left-aligned for left-to-right locales, right-aligned for right-to-left locales).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasTextAlign.End
member.summary: The text is aligned at the normal end of the line (right-aligned for left-to-right locales, left-aligned for right-to-left locales).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasTextAlign.Null
member.summary: Clear the value, to revert back to browser's default.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasTextBaselineAlign.Top
member.summary: The text baseline is the top of the em square.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasTextBaselineAlign.Hanging
member.summary: The text baseline is the hanging baseline.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasTextBaselineAlign.Middle
member.summary: The text baseline is the middle of the em square.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasTextBaselineAlign.Alphabetic
member.summary: Default. The text baseline is the normal alphabetic baseline.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasTextBaselineAlign.Ideographic
member.summary: The text baseline is the ideographic baseline; this is the bottom of the body of the characters, if the main body of characters protrudes beneath the alphabetic baseline.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasTextBaselineAlign.Bottom
member.summary: The text baseline is the bottom of the bounding box. This differs from the ideographic baseline in that the ideographic baseline doesn't consider descenders.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasTextBaselineAlign.Null
member.summary: Clear the value, to revert back to browser's default.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasTextDirection.LtR
member.summary: The text direction is left-to-right.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasTextDirection.RtL
member.summary: The text direction is right-to-left.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasTextDirection.Inherit
member.summary: Default. The text direction is inherited from the <canvas> element or the Document as appropriate.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasTextDirection.Null
member.summary: Clear the value, to revert back to browser's default.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasRepetitionTypes.Repeat
member.summary: Default. Repeat in both directions.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasRepetitionTypes.RepeatX
member.summary: Repeat in horizontal direction only.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasRepetitionTypes.Inherit
member.summary: Repeat in vertical direction only.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasRepetitionTypes.NoRepeat
member.summary: Do not repeat neither horizontally nor vertically.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasRepetitionTypes.Null
member.summary: Clear the value, to revert back to browser's default.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasFillRule.NonZero
member.summary: Default. The non-zero winding rule.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasFillRule.EvenOdd
member.summary: The even-odd winding rule.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D
member.summary: The CanvasRenderingContext2D interface provides the 2D rendering context for the drawing surface of a <canvas> element. To get an object of this interface, call getContext() on a <canvas>, supplying "CanvasContext2DType.CanvasRenderingContext2D" as the argument.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D.FillText(System.String,Bridge.Union{System.UInt32,System.Int32},Bridge.Union{System.UInt32,System.Int32},Bridge.Union{System.Nullable{System.UInt32},System.Nullable{System.Int32}})
member.summary: Draws (fills) a given text at the given (x,y) position.
member.param: The text to render using the current font, textAlign, textBaseline, and direction values.
The x axis of the coordinate for the text starting point.
The y axis of the coordinate for the text starting point.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D.LineWidth
member.summary: Width of lines. Default 1.0

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D.LineCap
member.summary: Type of endings on the end of lines. Possible values: butt (default), round, square.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D.LineJoin
member.summary: Defines the type of corners where two lines meet. Possible values: round, bevel, miter (default).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D.MiterLimit
member.summary: Miter limit ratio. Default 10.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D.GetLineDash
member.summary: Gets the current line dash pattern.
member.returns: An Array. A list of numbers that specifies distances to alternately draw a line and a gap (in coordinate space units). If the number, when setting the elements, was odd, the elements of the array get copied and concatenated. For example, setting the line dash to [5, 15, 25] will result in getting back [5, 15, 25, 5, 15, 25].

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D.SetLineDash(Bridge.Union{System.Double[],System.UInt32[],System.Int32[],System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Bridge.Union{System.Double,System.UInt32,System.Int32}}})
member.summary: Sets the current line dash pattern.
member.param: An Array. A list of numbers that specifies distances to alternately draw a line and a gap (in coordinate space units). If the number of elements in the array is odd, the elements of the array get copied and concatenated. For example, [5, 15, 25] will become [5, 15, 25, 5, 15, 25].

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D.LineDashOffset
member.summary: Specifies where to start a dash array on a line.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D.Font
member.summary: Font setting. Default value 10px sans-serif.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D.TextAlign
member.summary: Text alignment setting. Possible values: start (default), end, left, right or center.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D.TextBaseline
member.summary: Baseline alignment setting. Possible values: top, hanging, middle, alphabetic (default), ideographic, bottom.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D.Direction
member.summary: Directionality. Possible values: ltr, rtl, inherit (default).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D.FillStyle
member.summary: Color or style to use inside shapes. Default #000 (black).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D.StrokeStyle
member.summary: Color or style to use for the lines around shapes. Default #000 (black).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D.GlobalAlpha

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D.ImageSmoothingEnabled
member.summary: Image smoothing mode; if disabled, images will not be smoothed if scaled.
member.remarks: This is experimental API that should not be used in production code.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D.Save
member.summary: Saves the current drawing style state using a stack so you can revert any change you make to it using Restore().

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D.Restore
member.summary: Restores the drawing style state to the last element on the 'state stack' saved by save().

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D.Canvas
member.summary: A read-only back-reference to the HTMLCanvasElement. Might be null if it is not associated with a <canvas> element.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D.AddHitRegion
member.summary: Adds a hit region to the canvas.
member.remarks: This is experimental API that should not be used in production code.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D.AddHitRegion(Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D.CanvasHitRegionOptions)
member.summary: Adds a hit region to the canvas.
member.param: The options argument is optional. When provided, it is an CanvasHitRegionOptions object with one or more of its properties set.
member.remarks: This is experimental API that should not be used in production code.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D.RemoveHitRegion(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the hit region with the specified id from the canvas.
member.param: A DOMString representing the id of the region that is to be removed.
member.remarks: This is experimental API that should not be used in production code.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D.ClearHitRegions
member.summary: Removes all hit regions from the canvas.
member.remarks: This is experimental API that should not be used in production code.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D.CanvasHitRegionOptions
member.summary: Most of these APIs are deprecated and will be removed in the future.

member.name: P:Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D.CanvasHitRegionOptions.Path
member.summary: A Path2D object describing the area of the hit region. If not provided, the current path is used.

member.name: P:Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D.CanvasHitRegionOptions.fillRule
member.summary: The fill rule to use (defaults to "nonzero").

member.name: P:Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D.CanvasHitRegionOptions.Id
member.summary: The ID for this hit region to reference it for later use in events, for example.

member.name: P:Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D.CanvasHitRegionOptions.ParentID
member.summary: The ID of the parent region for cursor fallback and navigation by accessibility tools.

member.name: P:Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D.CanvasHitRegionOptions.Cursor
member.summary: The cursor to use when the mouse is over this region (defaults to "inherit"). Inherits the cursor of the parent hit region, if any, or the canvas element's cursor.

member.name: P:Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D.CanvasHitRegionOptions.Control
member.summary: An element (descendant of the canvas) to which events are to be routed. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D.CanvasHitRegionOptions.Label
member.summary: A text label for accessibility tools to use as a description of the region, if there is no control. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:Bridge.Html5.CanvasRenderingContext2D.CanvasHitRegionOptions.role
member.summary: An ARIA role for accessibility tools to determine how to represent this region, if there is no control. Defaults to null.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.ReadyAttribute
member.summary: Makes the method to be called once the page is loaded. If using jQuery2, triggers jQuery's event, otherwise, uses DOMContentReady event from HTML5.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.TextMetrics
member.summary: The TextMetrics interface represents the dimension of a text in the canvas, as created by the CanvasRenderingContext2D.measureText() method.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextMetrics.Width
member.summary: A double giving the calculated width of a segment of inline text in CSS pixels. It takes into account the current font of the context.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextMetrics.ActualBoundingBoxLeft
member.summary: A double giving the distance parallel to the baseline from the alignment point given by the CanvasRenderingContext2D.textAlign property to the left side of the bounding rectangle of the given text, in CSS pixels.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextMetrics.ActualBoundingBoxRight
member.summary: A double giving the distance parallel to the baseline from the alignment point given by the CanvasRenderingContext2D.textAlign property to the right side of the bounding rectangle of the given text, in CSS pixels.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextMetrics.FontBoundingBoxAscent
member.summary: A double giving the distance from the horizontal line indicated by the CanvasRenderingContext2D.textBaseline attribute to the top of the highest bounding rectangle of all the fonts used to render the text, in CSS pixels.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextMetrics.FontBoundingBoxDescent
member.summary: A double giving the distance from the horizontal line indicated by the CanvasRenderingContext2D.textBaseline attribute to the top of the bounding rectangle of all the fonts used to render the text, in CSS pixels.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextMetrics.ActualBoundingBoxAscent
member.summary: A double giving the distance from the horizontal line indicated by the CanvasRenderingContext2D.textBaseline attribute to the top of the bounding rectangle used to render the text, in CSS pixels.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextMetrics.ActualBoundingBoxDescent
member.summary: A double giving the distance from the horizontal line indicated by the CanvasRenderingContext2D.textBaseline attribute to the bottom of the bounding rectangle used to render the text, in CSS pixels.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextMetrics.EmHeightAscent
member.summary: A double giving the distance from the horizontal line indicated by the CanvasRenderingContext2D.textBaseline property to the top of the em square in the line box, in CSS pixels.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextMetrics.EmHeightDescent
member.summary: A double giving the distance from the horizontal line indicated by the CanvasRenderingContext2D.textBaseline property to the bottom of the em square in the line box, in CSS pixels.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextMetrics.HangingBaseLine
member.summary: A double giving the distance from the horizontal line indicated by the CanvasRenderingContext2D.textBaseline property to the hanging baseline of the line box, in CSS pixels.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextMetrics.AlphabeticBaseline
member.summary: A double giving the distance from the horizontal line indicated by the CanvasRenderingContext2D.textBaseline property to the alphabetic baseline of the line box, in CSS pixels.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextMetrics.IdeographicBaseline
member.summary: A double giving the distance from the horizontal line indicated by the CanvasRenderingContext2D.textBaseline property to the ideographic baseline of the line box, in CSS pixels.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.AlignContent
