member.summary: The word-wrap CSS property is used to specify whether or not the browser may break lines within words in order to prevent overflow (in other words, force wrapping) when an otherwise unbreakable string is too long to fit in its containing box.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CSSStyleDeclaration.WritingMode
member.summary: CSS Writing Modes Level 3 defines CSS features to support various international script modes, such as left-to-right (e.g., Latin and Indic), right-to-left (e.g., Hebrew and Arabic), bidirectional (e.g., mixed Latin and Arabic) and vertical (e.g., Asian). This article is about the CSS writing-mode property.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CSSStyleDeclaration.ZIndex
member.summary: The z-index CSS property specifies the z-order of an element and its descendants. When elements overlap, z-order determines which one covers the other. An element with a larger z-index generally covers an element with a lower one.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.CSSStyleDeclaration.GetPropertyPriority(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the optional priority, "important". Example: priString= styleObj.getPropertyPriority('color')

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.CSSStyleDeclaration.GetPropertyValue(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the property value. Example: valString= styleObj.getPropertyValue('color')

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.CSSStyleDeclaration.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a property name. Example: nameString= styleObj.item(0) Alternative: nameString= styleObj[0]

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.CSSStyleDeclaration.RemoveProperty(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the value deleted. Example: valString= styleObj.removeProperty('color')

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.CSSStyleDeclaration.SetProperty(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: No return. Example: styleObj.setProperty('color', 'red', 'important')

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.CSSStyleDeclaration.SetProperty(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: No return. Example: styleObj.setProperty('color', 'red', 'important')

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.CSSStyleSheet
member.summary: An object implementing the CSSStyleSheet interface represents a single CSS style sheet.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CSSStyleSheet.CssRules
member.summary: Returns a CSSRuleList of the CSS rules in the style sheet.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CSSStyleSheet.OwnerRule
member.summary: If this style sheet is imported into the document using an @import rule, the ownerRule property will return that CSSImportRule, otherwise it returns null.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.CSSStyleSheet.DeleteRule(System.Int32)
member.summary: Deletes a rule from the style sheet.
member.param: is a number representing the position of the rule.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.CSSStyleSheet.InsertRule(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Inserts a new style rule into the current style sheet.
member.param: is a DOMString containing the rule to be inserted (selector and declaration).
is a unsigned int representing the position to be inserted.
member.returns: The index within the style sheet's rule collection of the newly inserted rule.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CSSValue.CSS_CUSTOM
member.summary: The value is a custom value.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CSSValue.CSS_INHERIT
member.summary: The value is inherited and the cssText contains "inherit".

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CSSValue.CSS_PRIMITIVE_VALUE
member.summary: The value is a primitive value and an instance of the CSSPrimitiveValue interface can be obtained by using binding-specific casting methods on this instance of the CSSValue interface.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CSSValue.CSS_VALUE_LIST
member.summary: The value is a CSSValue list and an instance of the CSSValueList interface can be obtained by using binding-specific casting methods on this instance of the CSSValue interface.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CSSValue.CssText
member.summary: A string representation of the current value.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CSSValue.CssValueType
member.summary: A code defining the type

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.Auto
member.summary: The browser determines the cursor to display based on the current context. E.g. equivalent to text when hovering text.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.Default
member.summary: Default cursor, typically an arrow.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.None
member.summary: No cursor is rendered.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.ContextMenu
member.summary: A context menu is available under the cursor. Only IE 10 and up have implemented this on Windows

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.Help
member.summary: Indicating help is available.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.Pointer
member.summary: E.g. used when hovering over links, typically a hand.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.Progress
member.summary: The program is busy in the background but the user can still interact with the interface (unlike for wait).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.Wait
member.summary: The program is busy (sometimes an hourglass or a watch).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.Cell
member.summary: Indicating that cells can be selected.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.CrossHair
member.summary: Cross cursor, often used to indicate selection in a bitmap.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.Text
member.summary: Indicating text can be selected, typically an I-beam.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.VerticalText
member.summary: Indicating that vertical text can be selected, typically a sideways I-beam.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.Alias
member.summary: Indicating an alias or shortcut is to be created.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.Copy
member.summary: Indicating that something can be copied.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.Move
member.summary: The hovered object may be moved.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.NoDrop
member.summary: Cursor showing that a drop is not allowed at the current location.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.NotAllowed
member.summary: Cursor showing that something cannot be done.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.AllScroll
member.summary: Cursor showing that something can be scrolled in any direction (panned).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.ColResize
member.summary: The item/column can be resized horizontally. Often rendered as arrows pointing left and right with a vertical bar separating.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.RowResize
member.summary: The item/row can be resized vertically. Often rendered as arrows pointing up and down with a horizontal bar separating them.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.NorthResize
member.summary: Some edge is to be moved.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.EastResize
member.summary: Some edge is to be moved.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.SouthResize
member.summary: Some edge is to be moved.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.WestResize
member.summary: Some edge is to be moved.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.NorthEastResize
member.summary: Some edge is to be moved.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.NorthWestResize
member.summary: Some edge is to be moved.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.SouthEastResize
member.summary: Some edge is to be moved.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.SouthWestResize
member.summary: Some edge is to be moved.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.EastWestResize
member.summary: Indicates a bidirectional resize cursor.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.NorthSouthResize
member.summary: Indicates a bidirectional resize cursor.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.NorthEastSouthWestResize
member.summary: Indicates a bidirectional resize cursor.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.NorthWestSouthEastResize
member.summary: Indicates a bidirectional resize cursor.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.ZoomIn
member.summary: Indicates that something can be zoomed (magnified) in or out.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.ZoomOut
member.summary: Indicates that something can be zoomed (magnified) in or out.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.Grab
member.summary: Indicates that something can be grabbed (dragged to be moved).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Cursor.Grabbing
member.summary: Indicates that something can be grabbed (dragged to be moved).

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.Direction
member.summary: Set the direction CSS property to match the direction of the text: rtl for Hebrew or Arabic text and ltr for other scripts. This is typically done as part of the document (e.g., using the dir attribute in HTML) rather than through direct use of CSS.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Direction.Ltr
member.summary: The initial value of direction (that is, if not otherwise specified). Text and other elements go from left to right.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Direction.Rtl
member.summary: Text and other elements go from right to left

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.Display
member.summary: The display CSS property specifies the type of rendering box used for an element. In HTML, default display property values are taken from behaviors described in the HTML specifications or from the browser/user default stylesheet. The default value in XML is inline.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Display.None
member.summary: Turns off the display of an element (it has no effect on layout); all descendant elements also have their display turned off. The document is rendered as though the element did not exist. To render an element box's dimensions, yet have its contents be invisible, see the visibility property.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Display.Inline
member.summary: The element generates one or more inline element boxes.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Display.Block
member.summary: The element generates a block element box.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Display.ListItem
member.summary: The element generates a block box for the content and a separate list-item inline box.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Display.InlineBlock
member.summary: The element generates a block element box that will be flowed with surrounding content as if it were a single inline box (behaving much like a replaced element would)

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Display.InlineTable
member.summary: The inline-table value does not have a direct mapping in HTML. It behaves like a <table> HTML element, but as an inline box, rather than a block-level box. Inside the table box is a block-level context.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Display.Table
member.summary: Behaves like the <table> HTML element. It defines a block-level box.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Display.TableCaption
member.summary: Behaves like the <caption> HTML element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Display.TableCell
member.summary: Behaves like the <td> HTML element

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Display.TableColumn
member.summary: These elements behave like the corresponding <col> HTML elements.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Display.TableColumnGroup
member.summary: These elements behave like the corresponding <colgroup> HTML elements.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Display.TableFooterGroup
member.summary: These elements behave like the corresponding <tfoot> HTML elements

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Display.TableHeaderGroup
member.summary: These elements behave like the corresponding <thead> HTML elements

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Display.TableRow
member.summary: Behaves like the <tr> HTML element

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Display.TableRowGroup
member.summary: These elements behave like the corresponding <tbody> HTML elements

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Display.Flex
member.summary: The element behaves like a block element and lays out its content according to the flexbox model.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Display.InlineFlex
member.summary: The element behaves like an inline element and lays out its content according to the flexbox model.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Display.Grid
member.summary: The element behaves like a block element and lay out its content according to the grid model.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Display.InlineGrid
member.summary: The element behaves like an inline element and lay out its content according to the grid model.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.DominantBaseline.Auto
member.summary: If this property occurs on a block or inline-block element, then the user agent behavior depends on the value of the 'script' property. If the value of the script property is 'auto', the 'auto' value is equivalent to 'alphabetic' for horizontal 'writing-mode' values and 'central' for vertical 'writing-mode' values. If the value of the script property is other than 'auto', the 'auto' value is equivalent to 'use-script'

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.DominantBaseline.UseScript
member.summary: The dominant baseline-identifier is set using the computed value of the 'script' property. The 'writing-mode' value, whether horizontal or vertical is used to select the baseline-table that correspond to that baseline-identifier.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.DominantBaseline.NoChange
member.summary: The dominant baseline-identifier, the baseline-table and the baseline-table font-size remain the same as that of the parent.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.DominantBaseline.ResetSize
member.summary: The dominant baseline-identifier and the baseline table remain the same, but the baseline-table font-size is changed to the value of the 'font-size' property on this element. This re-scales the baseline table for the current 'font-size'.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.DominantBaseline.Alphabetic
member.summary: The dominant baseline-identifier is set to the 'alphabetic' baseline.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.DominantBaseline.Hanging
member.summary: The dominant baseline-identifier is set to the 'hanging' baseline.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.DominantBaseline.Ideographic
member.summary: The dominant baseline-identifier is set to the 'ideographic' baseline.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.DominantBaseline.Mathematical
member.summary: The dominant baseline-identifier is set to the 'mathematical' baseline.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.DominantBaseline.Central
member.summary: The dominant baseline-identifier is set to be 'central'. The derived baseline-table is constructed from the defined baselines in a baseline-table in the nominal font.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.DominantBaseline.Middle
member.summary: The dominant baseline-identifier is set to be 'middle'. The derived baseline-table is constructed from the defined baselines in a baseline-table in the nominal font.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.DominantBaseline.TextAfterEdge
member.summary: The dominant baseline-identifier is set to be 'text-after-edge'. The derived baseline-table is constructed from the defined baselines in a baseline-table in the nominal font.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.DominantBaseline.TextBeforeEdge
member.summary: The dominant baseline-identifier is set to be 'text-before-edge'. The derived baseline-table is constructed from the defined baselines in a baseline-table in the nominal font.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.EmptyCells
member.summary: The empty-cells CSS property specifies how user agents should render borders and backgrounds around cells that have no visible content.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.EmptyCells.Show
member.summary: Is a keyword indicating that borders and backgrounds should be drawn like in a normal cells.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.EmptyCells.Hide
member.summary: Is a keyword indicating that no border or backgrounds should be drawn.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FlexDirection.Row
member.summary: The flex container's main-axis is defined to be the same as the text direction. The main-start and main-end points are the same as the content direction.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FlexDirection.RowReverse
member.summary: Behaves the same as row but the main-start and main-end points are permuted.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FlexDirection.Column
member.summary: The flex container's main-axis is the same as the block-axis. The main-start and main-end points are the same as the before and after points of the writing-mode.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FlexDirection.ColumnReverse
member.summary: Behaves the same as column but the main-start and main-end are permuted.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.FlexWrap
member.summary: The CSS flex-wrap property specifies whether the children are forced into a single line or if the items can be flowed on multiple lines.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FlexWrap.NoWrap
member.summary: The flex items are laid out in a single line which may cause the flex container to overflow. The cross-start is either equivalent to start or before depending flex-direction value.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FlexWrap.Wrap
member.summary: The flex items break into multiple lines. The cross-start is either equivalent to start or before depending flex-direction value and the cross-end is the opposite of the specified cross-start.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FlexWrap.WrapReverse
member.summary: Behaves the same as wrap but cross-start and cross-end are permuted.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.Float
member.summary: The float CSS property specifies that an element should be taken from the normal flow and placed along the left or right side of its container, where text and inline elements will wrap around it. A floating element is one where the computed value of float is not none.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Float.None
member.summary: Is a keyword indicating that the element must not float.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Float.Left
member.summary: Is a keyword indicating that the element must float on the left side of its containing block.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Float.Right
member.summary: Is a keyword indicating that the element must float on the right side of its containing block.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.FontKerning
member.summary: The font-kerning property allows contextual adjustment of inter-glyph spacing, i.e. the spaces between the characters in text. This property controls metric kerning - that utilizes adjustment data contained in the font.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontKerning.None
member.summary: Specifies kerning is not applied

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontKerning.Normal
member.summary: Specifies kerning is applied. Fonts that do not include kerning data are unaffected by this setting.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontKerning.Auto
member.summary: Used to specify kerning is at the discretion of the user agent.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.FontStretch
member.summary: The font-stretch CSS property selects a normal, condensed, or expanded face from a font.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontStretch.Normal
member.summary: Specifies a normal font face.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontStretch.SemiCondensed
member.summary: Specifies a font face more condensed than normal, with ultra-condensed as the most condensed.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontStretch.Condensed
member.summary: Specifies a font face more condensed than normal, with ultra-condensed as the most condensed.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontStretch.ExtraCondensed
member.summary: Specifies a font face more condensed than normal, with ultra-condensed as the most condensed.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontStretch.UltraCondensed
member.summary: Specifies a font face more condensed than normal, with ultra-condensed as the most condensed.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontStretch.SemiExpanded
member.summary: Specifies a font face more expanded than normal, with ultra-expanded as the most expanded.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontStretch.Expanded
member.summary: Specifies a font face more expanded than normal, with ultra-expanded as the most expanded.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontStretch.ExtraExpanded
member.summary: Specifies a font face more expanded than normal, with ultra-expanded as the most expanded.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontStretch.UltraExpanded
member.summary: Specifies a font face more expanded than normal, with ultra-expanded as the most expanded.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.FontStyle
member.summary: The font-style CSS property allows italic or oblique faces to be selected within a font-family.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontStyle.Normal
member.summary: Selects a font that is classified as normal within a font-family

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontStyle.Italic
member.summary: Selects a font that is labeled italic, if that is not available, one labeled oblique

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontStyle.Oblique
member.summary: Selects a font that is labeled oblique

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.FontSynthesis
member.summary: This value specifies whether the user agent is allowed to synthesize bold or oblique font faces when a font family lacks bold or italic faces.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontSynthesis.None
member.summary: user agent is not allowed to synthesize bold or oblique font when not available.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontSynthesis.Weight
member.summary: user agent is only allowed to synthesize bold font when not available but not oblique.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontSynthesis.Style
member.summary: user agent is only allowed to synthesize oblique font when not available but not bold.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontSynthesis.WeightStyle
member.summary: user agent is allowed to synthesize both bold and oblique.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.FontVariant
member.summary: The font-variant CSS property selects a normal, or small-caps face from a font family. Setting font-variant is also possible by using the font shorthand.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontVariant.Normal
member.summary: Specifies a normal font face.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontVariant.SmallCaps
member.summary: Specifies a font that is labeled as a small-caps font. If a small-caps font is not available, Mozilla (Firefox) and other browsers will simulate a small-caps font, i.e. by taking a normal font and replacing the lowercase letters by scaled uppercase characters.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.FontVariantCaps
member.summary: The font-variant-caps property allows the selection of alternate glyphs used for small or petite capitals or for titling. These glyphs are specifically designed to blend well with the surrounding normal glyphs, to maintain the weight and readability which suffers when text is simply resized to fit this purpose.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontVariantCaps.Normal
member.summary: None of the features are enabled.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontVariantCaps.SmallCaps
member.summary: Enables display of small capitals (OpenType feature: smcp). Small-caps glyphs typically use the form of uppercase letters but are reduced to the size of lowercase letters.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontVariantCaps.AllSmallCaps
member.summary: Enables display of small capitals for both upper and lowercase letters (OpenType features: c2sc, smcp).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontVariantCaps.PetiteCaps
member.summary: Enables display of petite capitals (OpenType feature: pcap).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontVariantCaps.AllPetiteCaps
member.summary: Enables display of petite capitals for both upper and lowercase letters (OpenType features: c2pc, pcap).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontVariantCaps.Unicase
member.summary: Enables display of mixture of small capitals for uppercase letters with normal lowercase letters (OpenType feature: unic).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontVariantCaps.TitlingCaps
member.summary: Enables display of titling capitals (OpenType feature: titl). Uppercase letter glyphs are often designed for use with lowercase letters. When used in all uppercase titling sequences they can appear too strong.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.FontVariantLigatures
member.summary: font-variant-ligatures is a CSS property to control ligatures in text.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontVariantLigatures.Normal
member.summary: A value of ânormalâ specifies that common default features are enabled, as described in detail in the next section. For OpenType fonts, common ligatures and contextual forms are on by default, discretionary and historical ligatures are not.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontVariantLigatures.None
member.summary: Specifies that all types of ligatures and contextual forms covered by this property are explicitly disabled. In situations where ligatures are not considered necessary, this may improve the speed of text rendering.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontVariantLigatures.CommonLigatures
member.summary: Enables display of common ligatures (OpenType features: liga, clig). For OpenType fonts, common ligatures are enabled by default.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontVariantLigatures.NoCommonLigatures
member.summary: Disables display of common ligatures (OpenType features: liga, clig).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontVariantLigatures.DiscretionaryLigatures
member.summary: Enables display of discretionary ligatures (OpenType feature: dlig). Which ligatures are discretionary or optional is decided by the type designer, so authors will need to refer to the documentation of a given font to understand which ligatures are considered discretionary.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontVariantLigatures.NoDiscretionaryLigatures
member.summary: Disables display of discretionary ligatures (OpenType feature: dlig).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontVariantLigatures.HistoricalLigatures
member.summary: Enables display of historical ligatures (OpenType feature: hlig).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontVariantLigatures.NoHistoricalLigatures
member.summary: Disables display of historical ligatures (OpenType feature: hlig).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontVariantLigatures.Contextual
member.summary: Enables display of contextual alternates (OpenType feature: calt). Although not strictly a ligature feature, like ligatures this feature is commonly used to harmonize the shapes of glyphs with the surrounding context. For OpenType fonts, this feature is on by default.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontVariantLigatures.NoContextual
member.summary: Disables display of contextual alternates (OpenType feature: calt).

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.FontVariantPosition
member.summary: The font-variant-position property is used to enable typographic subscript and superscript glyphs. These are alternate glyphs designed within the same em-box as default glyphs and are intended to be laid out on the same baseline as the default glyphs, with no resizing or repositioning of the baseline. They are explicitly designed to match the surrounding text and to be more readable without affecting the line height.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontVariantPosition.Normal
member.summary: None of the features are enabled.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontVariantPosition.Sub
member.summary: Enables display of subscript variants (OpenType feature: subs).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.FontVariantPosition.Super
member.summary: Enables display of superscript variants (OpenType feature: sups).

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.GridAutoFlow
member.summary: Automatically places grid elements into the grid layout if an explicit location is not designated. Designates the direction of the the flow and whether rows or columns must be added to accommodate the element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.GridAutoFlow.None
member.summary: Causes auto-placed grid items to be placed according to the grid-auto-position property, rather than using the auto-placement algorithm.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.GridAutoFlow.Rows
member.summary: Fills each row in turn, adding new rows as necessary.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.GridAutoFlow.Columns
member.summary: Fills each column in turn, adding new columns as necessary.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.GridAutoFlow.Dense
member.summary: Uses a "dense" packing algorithm approach to fill in holes in the grid as smaller items appear.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.GridAutoFlow.Sparse
member.summary: Permanently skips cells that are not filled with the current item. The default auto-pacement algorithm packing approach.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.HTMLColor
member.summary: HTML Colors

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.Hyphens
member.summary: The hyphens CSS property tells the browser how to go about splitting words to improve the layout of text when line-wrapping.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Hyphens.None
member.summary: Words are not broken at line breaks, even if characters inside the words suggest line break points. Lines will only wrap at whitespace.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Hyphens.Manual
member.summary: Words are broken for line-wrapping only where characters inside the word suggest line break opportunities. See Suggesting line break opportunities for details.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Hyphens.Auto
member.summary: The browser is free to automatically break words at appropriate hyphenation points, following whatever rules it chooses to use. Suggested line break opportunities, as covered in Suggesting line break opportunities, should be preferred over automatically selecting break points whenever possible.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.ImageRendering
member.summary: The image-rendering CSS property provides a hint to the user agent about how to handle its image rendering.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.ImageRendering.Auto
member.summary: Default value, the image should be scaled with an algorithm that maximizes the appearance of the image. In particular, scaling algorithms that "smooth" colors are acceptable, such as bilinear interpolation. This is intended for images such as photos. Since version 1.9 (Firefox 3.0), Gecko uses bilinear resampling (high quality).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.ImageRendering.Pixelated
member.summary: When scaling the image up, the "nearest neighbor" or similar algorithm must be used, so that the image appears to be simply composed of very large pixels. When scaling down, this is the same as 'auto'.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.ImeMode
member.summary: The ime-mode CSS property controls the state of the input method editor for text fields.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.ImeMode.Auto
member.summary: No change is made to the current input method editor state. This is the default.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.ImeMode.Normal
member.summary: The IME state should be normal; this value can be used in a user style sheet to override the page setting. This value is not supported by Internet Explorer.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.ImeMode.Active
member.summary: The input method editor is initially active; text entry is performed using it unless the user specifically dismisses it. Not supported on Linux.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.ImeMode.Inactive
member.summary: The input method editor is initially inactive, but the user may activate it if they wish. Not supported on Linux.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.ImeMode.Disabled
member.summary: The input method editor is disabled and may not be activated by the user.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.JustifyContent
member.summary: The CSS justify-content property defines how a browser distributes available space between and around elements when aligning flex items in the main-axis of the current line.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.JustifyContent.FlexStart
member.summary: The flex items are packed starting from the main-start. Margins of the first flex item is flushed with the main-start edge of the line and each following flex item is flushed with the preceding.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.JustifyContent.FlexEnd
member.summary: The flex items are packed starting from the main-end. The margin edge of the last flex item is flushed with the main-end edge of the line and each preceding flex item is flushed with the following.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.JustifyContent.Center
member.summary: The flex items are packed toward the center of the line. The flex items are flushed with each other and aligned in the center of the line. Space between the main-start edge of the line and first item and between main-end and the last item of the line is the same.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.JustifyContent.SpaceBetween
member.summary: Flex items are evenly distributed along the line. The spacing is done such as the space between two adjacent items is the same. Main-start edge and main-end edge are flushed with respectively first and last flex item edges.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.JustifyContent.SpaceAround
member.summary: Flex items are evenly distributed so that the space between two adjacent items is the same. The empty space before the first and after the last items equals half of the space between two adjacent items.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.ListStylePosition
member.summary: The list-style-position CSS property specifies the position of the marker box in the principal block box. It is often more convenient to use the shortcut list-style.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.ListStylePosition.Outside
member.summary: The marker box is outside the principal block box.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.ListStylePosition.Inside
member.summary: The marker box is the first inline box in the principal block box, after which the element's content flows.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.ListStyleType
member.summary: The list-style-type CSS property specifies appearance of a list item element. As it is the only one who defaults to display:list-item, this is usually a <li> element, but can be any element with this display value.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.MaskType
member.summary: The CSS mask-type properties defines if a SVG <mask> element is a luminance or an alpha mask.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.MaskType.Luminance
member.summary: Is a keyword indicating that the associated <mask> is a luminance mask, that is that its relative luminance values must be used when applying it.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.MaskType.Alpha
member.summary: Is a keyword indicating that the associated <mask> is an alpha mask, that is that its alpha channel values must be used when applying it.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.ObjectFit
member.summary: The âobject-fitâ property specifies how the contents of a replaced element should be fitted to the box established by its used height and width.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.ObjectFit.Fill
member.summary: The replaced content is sized to fill the element's content box: the object's concrete object size is the element's used width and height.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.ObjectFit.Contain
member.summary: The replaced content is sized to maintain its aspect ratio while fitting within the element's content box: its concrete object size is resolved as a contain constraint against the element's used width and height.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.ObjectFit.Cover
member.summary: The replaced content is sized to maintain its aspect ratio while filling the element's entire content box: its concrete object size is resolved as a cover constraint against the element's used width and height.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.ObjectFit.None
member.summary: The replaced content is not resized to fit inside the element's content box: determine the object's concrete object size using the default sizing algorithm with no specified size, and a default object size equal to the replaced element's used width and height.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.ObjectFit.ScaleDown
member.summary: The replaced content is not resized to fit inside the element's content box: determine the object's concrete object size using the default sizing algorithm with no specified size, and a default object size equal to the replaced element's used width and height.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.Overflow
member.summary: The overflow CSS property specifies whether to clip content, render scroll bars or display overflow content of a block-level element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Overflow.Visible
member.summary: Default value. Content is not clipped, it may be rendered outside the content box.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Overflow.Hidden
member.summary: The content is clipped and no scrollbars are provided.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Overflow.Scroll
member.summary: The content is clipped and desktop browsers use scrollbars, whether or not any content is clipped. This avoids any problem with scrollbars appearing and disappearing in a dynamic environment. Printers may print overflowing content.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Overflow.Auto
member.summary: Depends on the user agent. Desktop browsers like Firefox provide scrollbars if content overflows.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.OverflowWrap
member.summary: The word-wrap CSS property is used to specify whether or not the browser may break lines within words in order to prevent overflow (in other words, force wrapping) when an otherwise unbreakable string is too long to fit in its containing box.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.OverflowWrap.Normal
member.summary: Indicates that lines may only break at normal word break points.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.OverflowWrap.BreakWord
member.summary: Indicates that normally unbreakable words may be broken at arbitrary points if there are no otherwise acceptable break points in the line.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.PageBreak
member.summary: The page-break-after CSS property adjusts page breaks after/before the current element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.PageBreak.Auto
member.summary: Initial value. Automatic page breaks (neither forced nor forbidden).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.PageBreak.Always
member.summary: Always force page breaks after the element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.PageBreak.Avoid
member.summary: Avoid page breaks after the element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.PageBreak.Left
member.summary: Force page breaks after the element so that the next page is formatted as a left page.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.PageBreak.Right
member.summary: Force page breaks after the element so that the next page is formatted as a right page.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.PageBreakInside
member.summary: The page-break-inside CSS property adjusts page breaks inside the current element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.PageBreakInside.Auto
member.summary: Initial value. Automatic page breaks (neither forced nor forbidden).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.PageBreakInside.Avoid
member.summary: Avoid page breaks after the element.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.PointerEvents
member.summary: The CSS property pointer-events allows authors to control under what circumstances (if any) a particular graphic element can become the target of mouse events. When this property is unspecified, the same characteristics of the visiblePainted value apply to SVG content.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.PointerEvents.Auto
member.summary: The element behaves as it would if the pointer-events property was not specified. In SVG content, this value and the value visiblePainted have the same effect.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.PointerEvents.None
member.summary: The element is never the target of mouse events; however, mouse events may target its descendant elements if those descendants have pointer-events set to some other value. In these circumstances, mouse events will trigger event listeners on this parent element as appropriate on their way to/from the descendant during the event capture/bubble phases.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.PointerEvents.VisiblePainted
member.summary: SVG only. The element can only be the target of a mouse event when the visibility property is set to visible and when the mouse cursor is over the interior (i.e., 'fill') of the element and the fill property is set to a value other than none, or when the mouse cursor is over the perimeter (i.e., 'stroke') of the element and the stroke property is set to a value other than none.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.PointerEvents.VisibleFill
member.summary: SVG only. The element can only be the target of a mouse event when the visibility property is set to visible and when the mouse cursor is over the interior (i.e., fill) of the element. The value of the fill property does not effect event processing.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.PointerEvents.VisibleStroke
member.summary: SVG only. The element can only be the target of a mouse event when the visibility property is set to visible and when the mouse cursor is over the perimeter (i.e., stroke) of the element. The value of the stroke property does not effect event processing.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.PointerEvents.Visible
member.summary: SVG only. The element can be the target of a mouse event when the visibility property is set to visible and the mouse cursor is over either the interior (i.e., fill) or the perimeter (i.e., stroke) of the element. The values of the fill and stroke do not effect event processing.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.PointerEvents.Painted
member.summary: SVG only. The element can only be the target of a mouse event when the mouse cursor is over the interior (i.e., 'fill') of the element and the fill property is set to a value other than none, or when the mouse cursor is over the perimeter (i.e., 'stroke') of the element and the stroke property is set to a value other than none. The value of the visibility property does not effect event processing.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.PointerEvents.Fill
member.summary: SVG only. The element can only be the target of a mouse event when the pointer is over the interior (i.e., fill) of the element. The values of the fill and visibility properties do not effect event processing.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.PointerEvents.Stroke
member.summary: SVG only. The element can only be the target of a mouse event when the pointer is over the perimeter (i.e., stroke) of the element. The values of the stroke and visibility properties do not effect event processing.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.PointerEvents.All
member.summary: SVG only. The element can only be the target of a mouse event when the pointer is over the interior (i.e., fill) or the perimeter (i.e., stroke) of the element. The values of the fill, stroke and visibility properties do not effect event processing.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.Position
member.summary: The position CSS property chooses alternative rules for positioning elements, designed to be useful for scripted animation effects.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Position.Static
member.summary: This keyword let the element use the normal behavior, that is it is laid out in its current position in the flow. The top, right, bottom, and left properties do not apply.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Position.Relative
member.summary: This keyword lays out all elements as though the element were not positioned, and then adjust the element's position, without changing layout (and thus leaving a gap for the element where it would have been had it not been positioned). The effect of position:relative on table-*-group, table-row, table-column, table-cell, and table-caption elements is undefined.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Position.Absolute
member.summary: Do not leave space for the element. Instead, position it at a specified position relative to its closest positioned ancestor or to the containing block. Absolutely positioned boxes can have margins, they do not collapse with any other margins.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Position.Fixed
member.summary: Do not leave space for the element. Instead, position it at a specified position relative to the screen's viewport and doesn't move when scrolled. When printing, position it at that fixed position on every page.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Position.Sticky
member.summary: The box position is calculated according to the normal flow (this is called the position in normal flow). Then the box is offset relative to its flow root and containing block and in all cases, including table elements, does not affect the position of any following boxes. When a box B is stickily positioned, the position of the following box is calculated as though B were not offset. The effect of âposition: stickyâ on table elements is the same as for âposition: relativeâ.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.Resize
member.summary: The resize CSS property lets you control the resizability of an element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Resize.None
member.summary: The element offers no user-controllable method for resizing the element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Resize.Both
member.summary: The element displays a mechanism for allowing the user to resize the element, which may be resized both horizontally and vertically.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Resize.Horizontal
member.summary: The element displays a mechanism for allowing the user to resize the element, which may only be resized horizontally.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Resize.Vertical
member.summary: The element displays a mechanism for allowing the user to resize the element, which may only be resized vertically.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.StyleSheet
member.summary: An object implementing the StyleSheet interface represents a single style sheet. CSS style sheets will further implement the more specialized CSSStyleSheet interface.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.StyleSheet.Disabled
member.summary: Is a Boolean representing whether the current stylesheet has been applied or not.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.StyleSheet.Href
member.summary: Returns a DOMString representing the location of the stylesheet.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.StyleSheet.ParentStyleSheet
member.summary: Returns a StyleSheet including this one, if any; returns null if there aren't any.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.StyleSheet.Title
member.summary: Returns a DOMString representing the advisory title of the current style sheet.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.StyleSheet.Type
member.summary: Returns a DOMString representing the style sheet language for this style sheet.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.StyleSheetList
member.summary: The StyleSheetList interface provides the abstraction of an ordered collection of style sheets. The items in the StyleSheetList are accessible via an integral index, starting from 0.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.TableLayout
member.summary: The table-layout CSS property defines the algorithm to be used to layout the table cells, rows, and columns.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TableLayout.Auto
member.summary: An automatic table layout algorithm is commonly used by most browsers for table layout. The width of the table and its cells depends on the content thereof.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TableLayout.Fixed
member.summary: Table and column widths are set by the widths of table and col elements or by the width of the first row of cells. Cells in subsequent rows do not affect column widths.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.TextAlign
member.summary: The text-align CSS property describes how inline content like text is aligned in its parent block element. text-align does not control the alignment of block elements itself, only their inline content.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextAlign.Start
member.summary: The same as left if direction is left-to-right and right if direction is right-to-left.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextAlign.End
member.summary: The same as right if direction is left-to-right and left if direction is right-to-left.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextAlign.Left
member.summary: The inline contents are aligned to the left edge of the line box.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextAlign.Right
member.summary: The inline contents are aligned to the right edge of the line box.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextAlign.Center
member.summary: The inline contents are centered within the line box.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextAlign.Justify
member.summary: The text is justified. Text should line up their left and right edges to the left and right content edges of the paragraph.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextAlign.MatchParent
member.summary: Similar to inherit with the difference that the value start and end are calculated according the parent's direction and are replaced by the adequate left or right value.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.TextDecoration
member.summary: The text-decoration CSS property is used to set the text formatting to underline, overline, line-through or blink.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextDecoration.None
member.summary: Produces no text decoration.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextDecoration.Underline
member.summary: Each line of text is underlined.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextDecoration.Overline
member.summary: Each line of text has a line above it.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextDecoration.LineThrough
member.summary: Each line of text has a line through the middle.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.TextDecorationLine
member.summary: The text-decoration-line CSS property sets what kind of line decorations are added to an element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextDecorationLine.none
member.summary: Produces no text decoration.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextDecorationLine.Underline
member.summary: Each line of text is underlined.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextDecorationLine.Overline
member.summary: Each line of text has a line above it.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextDecorationLine.LineThrough
member.summary: Each line of text has a line through the middle.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextDecorationLine.Blink
member.summary: The text blinks (alternates between visible and invisible). Conforming user agents may simply not blink the text. This value is deprecated in favor of Animations.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.TextDecorationStyle
member.summary: The text-decoration-style CSS property defines the style of the lines specified by text-decoration-line. The style applies to all lines, there is no way to define different style for each of the line defined by text-decoration-line.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextDecorationStyle.Solid
member.summary: Draws a single line

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextDecorationStyle.Double
member.summary: Draws a double line

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextDecorationStyle.Dotted
member.summary: Draws a dotted line

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextDecorationStyle.Dashed
member.summary: Draws a dashed line

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextDecorationStyle.Wavy
member.summary: Draws a wavy line

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.TextOverflow
member.summary: The text-overflow CSS property determines how overflowed content that is not displayed is signaled to the users. It can be clipped, or display an ellipsis ('â¦', U+2026 HORIZONTAL ELLIPSIS) or a Web author-defined string.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextOverflow.Clip
member.summary: This keyword value indicates to truncate the text at the limit of the content area, therefore the truncation can happen in the middle of a character. To truncate at the transition between two characters, the empty string value ('') must be used. The value clip is the default for this property.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextOverflow.Ellipsis
member.summary: This keyword value indicates to display an ellipsis ('â¦', U+2026 HORIZONTAL ELLIPSIS) to represent clipped text. The ellipsis is displayed inside the content area, decreasing the amount of text displayed. If there is not enough space to display the ellipsis, it is clipped.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.TextRendering
member.summary: The text-rendering CSS property provides information to the rendering engine about what to optimize for when rendering text.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextRendering.Auto
member.summary: The browser makes educated guesses about when to optimize for speed, legibility, and geometric precision while drawing text. For differences in how this value is interpreted by the browser, see the compatibility table.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextRendering.OptimizeSpeed
member.summary: The browser emphasizes rendering speed over legibility and geometric precision when drawing text. It disables kerning and ligatures.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextRendering.OptimizeLegibility
member.summary: The browser emphasizes legibility over rendering speed and geometric precision. This enables kerning and optional ligatures.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextRendering.GeometricPrecision
member.summary: The browser emphasizes geometric precision over rendering speed and legibility. Certain aspects of fontsâsuch as kerningâdon't scale linearly, so geometricPrecision can make text using those fonts look good.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.TextTransform
member.summary: The text-transform CSS property specifies how to capitalize an element's text. It can be used to make text appear in all-uppercase or all-lowercase, or with each word capitalized.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextTransform.Capitalize
member.summary: Is a keyword forcing the first letter of each word to be converted to uppercase.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextTransform.UpperCase
member.summary: Is a keyword forcing all characters to be converted to uppercase.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextTransform.LowerCase
member.summary: Is a keyword forcing all characters to be converted to lowercase.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextTransform.None
member.summary: Is a keyword preventing the case of all characters to be changed.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextTransform.FullWidth
member.summary: Is a keyword forcing the writing of a character, mainly ideograms and latin scripts inside a square, allowing them to be aligned in the usual East Asian scripts (like Chinese or Japanese).

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.TextUnderlinePosition
member.summary: The CSS text-underline-position property specifies the position of the underline which is set using the text-decoration property underline value.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextUnderlinePosition.Auto
member.summary: This keyword allows the browser to use an algorithm to choose between under and alphabetic.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextUnderlinePosition.Under
member.summary: This keyword forces the line to be set below the alphabetic baseline, at a position where it won't cross any descender. This is useful to prevent chemical or mathematical formulas, which make a large use of subscripts, to be illegible.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextUnderlinePosition.Left
member.summary: In vertical writing-modes, this keyword forces the line to be placed on the left of the characters. In horizontal writing-modes, it is a synonym of under.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TextUnderlinePosition.Right
member.summary: In vertical writing-modes, this keyword forces the line to be placed on the right of the characters. In horizontal writing-modes, it is a synonym of under.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.TimingFunction
member.summary: The CSS animation-timing-function property specifies how a CSS animation should progress over the duration of each cycle.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.TouchAction
member.summary: Determines whether touch input may trigger default behavior supplied by the user agent, such as panning or zooming.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TouchAction.Auto
member.summary: The user agent MAY determine any permitted touch behaviors, such as panning and zooming manipulations of the viewport, for touches that begin on the element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TouchAction.None
member.summary: Touches that begin on the element MUST NOT trigger default touch behaviors.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TouchAction.PanX
member.summary: The user agent MAY consider touches that begin on the element only for the purposes of horizontally scrolling the element's nearest ancestor with horizontally scrollable content.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TouchAction.PanY
member.summary: The user agent MAY consider touches that begin on the element only for the purposes of vertically scrolling the element's nearest ancestor with vertically scrollable content.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.TransformStyle
member.summary: The transform-style CSS property determines if the children of the element are positioned in the 3D-space or are flattened in the plane of the element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TransformStyle.Preserve3D
member.summary: Indicates that the children of the element should be positioned in the 3D-space.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TransformStyle.Flat
member.summary: Indicates that the children of the element are lying in the plane of the element itself.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.UnicodeBidi
member.summary: The unicode-bidi CSS property together with the direction property relates to the handling of bidirectional text in a document.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.UnicodeBidi.Normal
member.summary: The element does not offer a additional level of embedding with respect to the bidirectional algorithm. For inline elements implicit reordering works across element boundaries.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.UnicodeBidi.Embed
member.summary: If the element is inline, this value opens an additional level of embedding with respect to the bidirectional algorithm. The direction of this embedding level is given by the direction property.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.UnicodeBidi.BidiOverride
member.summary: For inline elements this creates an override. For block container elements this creates an override for inline-level descendants not within another block container element. This means that inside the element, reordering is strictly in sequence according to the direction property; the implicit part of the bidirectional algorithm is ignored.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.UnicodeBidi.Isolate
member.summary: This keyword indicates that the element's container directionality should be calculated without considering the content of this element. The element is therefore isolated from its siblings. When applying its bidirectional-resolution algorithm, its container element treats it as one or several U+FFFC Object Replacement Character, i.e. like an image.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.UnicodeBidi.IsolateOverride
member.summary: This keyword applies the isolation behavior of the isolate keyword to the surrounding content and the override behavior of the bidi-override keyword to the inner content.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.UnicodeBidi.PlainText
member.summary: This keyword makes the elements directionality calculated without considering its parent bidirectional state or the value of the direction property. The directionality is calculated using the P2 and P3 rules of the Unicode Bidirectional Algorithm. This value allows to display data which has already formatted using a tool following the Unicode Bidirectional Algorithm.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.VerticalAlign
member.summary: The vertical-align CSS property specifies the vertical alignment of an inline or table-cell box.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.VerticalAlign.Baseline
member.summary: Aligns the baseline of the element with the baseline of its parent. The baseline of some replaced elements, like textarea is not specified by the HTML specification, meaning that their behavior with this keyword may change from one browser to the other.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.VerticalAlign.Sub
member.summary: Aligns the baseline of the element with the subscript-baseline of its parent.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.VerticalAlign.Super
member.summary: Aligns the baseline of the element with the superscript-baseline of its parent.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.VerticalAlign.TextTop
member.summary: Aligns the top of the element with the top of the parent element's font.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.VerticalAlign.TextBottom
member.summary: Aligns the bottom of the element with the bottom of the parent element's font.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.VerticalAlign.Middle
member.summary: Aligns the middle of the element with the middle of lowercase letters in the parent.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.VerticalAlign.Top
member.summary: Align the top of the element and its descendants with the top of the entire line.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.VerticalAlign.Bottom
member.summary: Align the bottom of the element and its descendants with the bottom of the entire line.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Visibility.Visible
member.summary: Default value, the box is visible.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Visibility.Hidden
member.summary: The box is invisible (fully transparent, nothing is drawn), but still affects layout. Descendants of the element will be visible if they have visibility:visible (this doesn't work in IE up to version 7).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Visibility.Collapse
member.summary: For table rows, columns, column groups, and row groups the row(s) or column(s) are hidden and the space they would have occupied is removed (as if display: none were applied to the column/row of the table). However, the size of other rows and columns is still calculated as though the cells in the collapsed row(s) or column(s) are present. This was designed for fast removal of a row/column from a table without having to recalculate widths and heights for every portion of the table. For XUL elements, the computed size of the element is always zero, regardless of other styles that would normally affect the size, although margins still take effect. For other elements, collapse is treated the same as hidden.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.WhiteSpace
member.summary: The white-space CSS property is used to to describe how whitespace inside the element is handled.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WhiteSpace.Normal
member.summary: Sequences of whitespace are collapsed. Newline characters in the source are handled as other whitespace. Breaks lines as necessary to fill line boxes.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WhiteSpace.NoWrap
member.summary: Collapses whitespace as for normal, but suppresses line breaks (text wrapping) within text.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WhiteSpace.Pre
member.summary: Sequences of whitespace are preserved, lines are only broken at newline characters in the source and at br elements.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WhiteSpace.PreWrap
member.summary: Sequences of whitespace are preserved. Lines are broken at newline characters, at br, and as necessary to fill line boxes.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WhiteSpace.PreLine
member.summary:
Sequences of whitespace are collapsed. Lines are broken at newline characters, at
, and as necessary to fill line boxes.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.WordBreak
member.summary: The word-break CSS property is used to specify how (or if) to break lines within words.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WordBreak.Normal
member.summary: Use the default line break rule.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WordBreak.BreakAll
member.summary: Word breaks may be inserted between any character for non-CJK (Chinese/Japanese/Korean) text.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WordBreak.KeepAll
member.summary: Don't allow word breaks for CJK text. Non-CJK text behavior is same as normal.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.WordWrap
member.summary: The word-wrap CSS property is used to specify whether or not the browser may break lines within words in order to prevent overflow (in other words, force wrapping) when an otherwise unbreakable string is too long to fit in its containing box.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WordWrap.Normal
member.summary: Indicates that lines may only break at normal word break points.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WordWrap.BreakAll
member.summary: Indicates that normally unbreakable words may be broken at arbitrary points if there are no otherwise acceptable break points in the line.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.WritingMode
member.summary: CSS Writing Modes Level 3 defines CSS features to support various international script modes, such as left-to-right (e.g., Latin and Indic), right-to-left (e.g., Hebrew and Arabic), bidirectional (e.g., mixed Latin and Arabic) and vertical (e.g., Asian). This article is about the CSS writing-mode property.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WritingMode.HorizontalTB
member.summary: Indicates that lines may only break at normal word break points.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WritingMode.RL_TB
member.summary: Content flows horizontally from right to left, vertically from top to bottom. The next horizontal line is positioned below the previous line.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WritingMode.VerticalLR
member.summary: Content flows vertically from top to bottom, horizontally from left to right. The next vertical line is positioned to the right of the previous line. For SVG1 documents only, use the deprecated value tb-lr.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WritingMode.VerticalRL
member.summary: Content flows vertically from top to bottom, horizontally from right to left. The next vertical line is positioned to the left of the previous line. For SVG1 documents only, use the deprecated value tb or tb-rl.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WritingMode.BT_RL
member.summary: Content flows vertically from bottom to top, horizontally right to left. The next vertical line is positioned to the left of the previous line.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WritingMode.BT_LR
member.summary: Content flows vertically from bottom to top, horizontally left to right. The next vertical line is positioned to the right of the previous line.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WritingMode.LR_BT
member.summary: Content flows horizontally from left to right, vertically from bottom to top. The next horizontal line is positioned above the previous line.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WritingMode.RL_BT
member.summary: Content flows horizontally from right to left, vertically from bottom to top. The next horizontal line is positioned above the previous line.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.Document
member.summary: Each web page loaded in the browser has its own document object. The Document interface serves as an entry point to the web page's content (the DOM tree, including elements such as body and table) and provides functionality global to the document (such as obtaining the page's URL and creating new elements in the document).

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.AddEventListener(System.String,System.Delegate)
member.summary: The method registers the specified listener on the EventTarget it's called on. The event target may be an Element in a document, the Document itself, a Window, or any other object that supports events.
member.param: A string representing the event type to listen for.
The object that receives a notification when an event of the specified type occurs. This must be an object implementing the EventListener interface, or simply a JavaScript function.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.DispatchEvent(Bridge.Html5.Event)
member.summary: Dispatches the specified event to the current element. To create an event object use the createEvent method in Firefox, Opera, Google Chrome, Safari and Internet Explorer from version 9. After the new event is created, initialize it first (for details, see the page for the createEvent method). When the event is initialized, it is ready for dispatching.
member.param: Required. Reference to an event object to be dispatched.
member.returns: Boolean that indicates whether the default action of the event was not canceled.

member.summary: Removes the event listener previously registered with EventTarget.addEventListener.
member.param: A string representing the event type being removed.
The listener parameter indicates the EventListener function to be removed.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.RemoveEventListener(Bridge.Html5.EventType,Bridge.Html5.IEventListener,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes the event listener previously registered with EventTarget.addEventListener.
member.param: A string representing the event type being removed.
The listener parameter indicates the EventListener function to be removed.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.BaseURI
member.summary: Returns a DOMString representing the base URL. The concept of base URL changes from one language to another; in HTML, it corresponds to the protocol, the domain name and the directory structure, that is all until the last '/'.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.ChildNodes
member.summary: Returns a live NodeList containing all the children of this node. NodeList being live means that if the children of the Node change, the NodeList object is automatically updated.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.FirstChild
member.summary: Returns a Node representing the first direct child node of the node, or null if the node has no child.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.LastChild
member.summary: Returns a Node representing the last direct child node of the node, or null if the node has no child.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.NextSibling
member.summary: Returns a Node representing the next node in the tree, or null if there isn't such node.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.NodeName
member.summary: Returns a DOMString containing the name of the Node. The structure of the name will differ with the name type. E.g. An HTMLElement will contain the name of the corresponding tag, like 'audio' for an HTMLAudioElement, a Text node will have the '#text' string, or a Document node will have the '#document' string.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.NodeType
member.summary: Returns an unsigned short representing the type of the node.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.NodeValue
member.summary: Is a DOMString representing the value of an object. For most Node type, this returns null and any set operation is ignored. For nodes of type TEXT_NODE (Text objects), COMMENT_NODE (Comment objects), and PROCESSING_INSTRUCTION_NODE (ProcessingInstruction objects), the value corresponds to the text data contained in the object.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.OwnerDocument
member.summary: Returns the Document that this node belongs to. If no document is associated with it, returns null.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.ParentNode
member.summary: Returns a Node that is the parent of this node. If there is no such node, like if this node is the top of the tree or if doesn't participate in a tree, this property returns null.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.ParentElement
member.summary: Returns an Element that is the parent of this node. If the node has no parent, or if that parent is not an Element, this property returns null.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.PreviousSibling
member.summary: Returns a Node representing the previous node in the tree, or null if there isn't such node.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.TextContent
member.summary: Is a DOMString representing the textual content of an element and all its descendants.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.AppendChild(Bridge.Html5.Node)
member.summary: Adds a node to the end of the list of children of a specified parent node. If the node already exists it is removed from current parent node, then added to new parent node.
member.param: child is the node to append underneath element. Also returned.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.CloneNode
member.summary: Returns a duplicate of the node on which this method was called.
member.returns: The new node that will be a clone of this node

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.CloneNode(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a duplicate of the node on which this method was called.
member.param: true if the children of the node should also be cloned, or false to clone only the specified node.
member.returns: The new node that will be a clone of this node

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.CompareDocumentPosition(Bridge.Html5.Node)
member.summary: Compares the position of the current node against another node in any other document.
member.param: is the node that's being compared against.
member.returns: The return value is computed as the relationship that otherNode has with node.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.Contains(Bridge.Html5.Node)
member.summary: Indicates whether a node is a descendant of a given node.
member.param: is the node that's being compared against.
member.returns: The return value is true if otherNode is a descendant of node, or node itself. Otherwise the return value is false.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.HasChildNodes
member.summary: returns a Boolean value indicating whether the current Node has child nodes or not.
member.returns: Boolean value indicating whether the current Node has child nodes or not

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.InsertBefore(Bridge.Html5.Node,Bridge.Html5.Node)
member.summary: Inserts the specified node before a reference element as a child of the current node.
member.param: The node to insert.
The node before which newElement is inserted.
member.returns: The node being inserted, that is newElement

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.IsDefaultNamespace(System.String)
member.summary: Accepts a namespace URI as an argument and returns true if the namespace is the default namespace on the given node or false if not.
member.param: string representing the namespace against which the element will be checked.
member.returns: holds the return value true or false.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.IsEqualNode(Bridge.Html5.Node)
member.summary: Tests whether two nodes are equal.
member.param: The node to compare equality with.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.Normalize
member.summary: Clean up all the text nodes under this element (merge adjacent, remove empty).

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.RemoveChild(Bridge.Html5.Node)
member.summary: Removes a child node from the DOM. Returns removed node.
member.param: child node to be removed from the DOM.
member.returns: Reference to the removed child node

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.ReplaceChild(Bridge.Html5.Node,Bridge.Html5.Node)
member.summary: Replaces one child node of the specified element with another.
member.param: new node to replace oldChild. If it already exists in the DOM, it is first removed.
the existing child to be replaced.
member.returns: the replaced node. This is the same node as oldChild.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.ChildElementCount
member.summary: The number of child nodes that are elements.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.CharacterSet
member.summary: Returns the character encoding of the current document.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.CompatMode
member.summary: Indicates whether the document is rendered in Quirks mode or Strict mode.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.ContentType
member.summary: Returns the MIME type that the document is being rendered as. This may come from HTTP headers or other sources of MIME information, and might be affected by automatic type conversions performed by either the browser or extensions.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.Doctype
member.summary: Returns the Document Type Declaration (DTD) associated with current document.

member.summary: Returns the Element that is the root element of the document (for example, the <html> element for HTML documents).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.DocumentURI
member.summary: Returns the document location as string.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.Implementation
member.summary: Returns a DOMImplementation object associated with the current document.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.LastStyleSheetSet
member.summary: Returns the last enabled style sheet set; this property's value changes whenever the document.selectedStyleSheetSet property is changed.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.PreferredStyleSheetSet
member.summary: Returns the preferred style sheet set as set by the page author.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.SelectedStyleSheetSet
member.summary: Indicates the name of the style sheet set that's currently in use.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.StyleSheets
member.summary: The Document.styleSheets read-only property returns a StyleSheetList of StyleSheet objects for stylesheets explicitly linked into or embedded in a document.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.StyleSheetSets
member.summary: Returns a live list of all of the currently-available style sheet sets.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.ActiveElement
member.summary: Returns the currently focused element, that is, the element that will get keystroke events if the user types any.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.AlinkColor
member.summary: Returns or sets the color of an active link in the document body. A link is active during the time between mousedown and mouseup events.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.Anchors
member.summary: Returns a list of all of the anchors in the document.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.Applets
member.summary: Returns an ordered list of the applets within a document.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.BgColor
member.summary: Gets/sets the background color of the current document.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.Body
member.summary: Returns the body or frameset node of the current document, or null if no such element exists.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.Cookie
member.summary: Get and set the cookies associated with the current document.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.DefaultView
member.summary: In browsers returns the window object associated with the document or null if none available.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.DesignMode
member.summary: Gets/sets the ability to edit the whole document.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.Dir
member.summary: Gets/sets directionality (rtl/ltr) of the document.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.Domain
member.summary: Gets/sets the domain portion of the origin of the current document, as used by the same origin policy.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.Embeds
member.summary: Returns a list of the embedded OBJECTS within the current document.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.FgColor
member.summary: Gets/sets the foreground color, or text color, of the current document.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.Forms
member.summary: Returns a list of the form elements within the current document.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.Head
member.summary: Returns the head element of the current document. If there are more than one head elements, the first one is returned.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.Images
member.summary: Returns a list of the images in the current document.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.LastModified
member.summary: Returns a string containing the date and time on which the current document was last modified.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.LinkColor
member.summary: Gets/sets the color of hyperlinks in the document.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.Links
member.summary: Returns a list of all the hyperlinks in the document.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.Location
member.summary: The Document.location read-only property returns a Location object, which contains information about the URL of the document and provides methods for changing that URL and load another URL.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.Plugins
member.summary: Returns an HTMLCollection object containing one or more HTMLEmbedElements or null which represent the embed elements in the current document.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.ReadyState
member.summary: Returns loading status of the document.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.Referrer
member.summary: Returns the URI of the page that linked to this page.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.Scripts
member.summary: Returns all the script elements on the document.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.Title
member.summary: Returns the title of the current document.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.URL
member.summary: Returns a string containing the URL of the current document.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.VlinkColor

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Document.OnReadyStateChange
