member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.AdoptNode(Bridge.Html5.Node)
member.summary: Adopts a node from an external document. The node and its subtree is removed from the document it's in (if any), and its ownerDocument is changed to the current document. The node can then be inserted into the current document.
member.param: the node from another document to be adopted.
member.returns: the adopted node that can be used in the current document. The new node's parentNode is null, since it has not yet been inserted into the document tree.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.CaretPositionFromPoint(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: This method is used to retrieve the caret position in a document based on two coordinates. A CaretPosition is returned, containing the found DOM node and the character offset in that node.
member.param: Horizontal point on the page at where to determine the caret position.
Vertical point on the page at where to determine the caret position.
member.returns: A CaretPosition. Null, if x or y are negative or greater than the viewport.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.CaretRangeFromPoint(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: This method is used to retrieve the caret position in a document based on two coordinates. A Range is returned, containing the found DOM node and the character offset in that node.
member.param: Horizontal point on the page at where to determine the caret position.
Vertical point on the page at where to determine the caret position.
member.returns: A Range. Null, if x or y are negative or greater than the viewport.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.CreateElement(System.String)
member.summary: In an HTML document creates the specified HTML element or HTMLUnknownElement if the element is not known. In a XUL document creates the specified XUL element. In other documents creates an element with a null namespaceURI.
member.param: tagName is a string that specifies the type of element to be created. The nodeName of the created element is initialized with the value of tagName. Don't use qualified names (like "html:a") with this method.
member.returns: created element object

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.CreateElement``1(System.String)
member.summary: In an HTML document creates the specified HTML element or HTMLUnknownElement if the element is not known. In a XUL document creates the specified XUL element. In other documents creates an element with a null namespaceURI.
member.param: tagName is a string that specifies the type of element to be created. The nodeName of the created element is initialized with the value of tagName. Don't use qualified names (like "html:a") with this method.
member.returns: created element object

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.CreateElementNS(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an element with the specified namespace URI and qualified name.
member.param: a string that specifies the namespace URI to associate with the element. The namespaceURI property of the created element is initialized with the value of namespaceURI. (see section below for "Valid Namespace URI's")
a string that specifies the type of element to be created. The nodeName property of the created element is initialized with the value of qualifiedName
member.returns: the created element.

a string that specifies the type of element to be created. The nodeName property of the created element is initialized with the value of qualifiedName
member.returns: the created element.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.CreateEvent(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an event of the type specified. The returned object should be first initialized and can then be passed to element.dispatchEvent.
member.param: type is a string that represents the type of event to be created. Possible event types include "UIEvents", "MouseEvents", "MutationEvents", and "HTMLEvents".
member.returns: the created Event object.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.CreateEvent``1(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an event of the type specified. The returned object should be first initialized and can then be passed to element.dispatchEvent.
member.param: type is a string that represents the type of event to be created. Possible event types include "UIEvents", "MouseEvents", "MutationEvents", and "HTMLEvents".
member.returns: the created Event object.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.CreateNodeIterator(Bridge.Html5.Node)
member.summary: Returns a new NodeIterator object.
member.param: The root node at which to begin the NodeIterator's traversal.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.CreateNodeIterator(Bridge.Html5.Node,Bridge.Html5.NodeFilter)
member.summary: Returns a new NodeIterator object.
member.param: The root node at which to begin the NodeIterator's traversal.
Bitwise OR'd list of Filter specification constants from the NodeFilter DOM interface, indicating which nodes to iterate over.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.CreateNodeIterator(Bridge.Html5.Node,Bridge.Html5.NodeFilter,Bridge.Html5.INodeFilter)
member.summary: Returns a new NodeIterator object.
member.param: The root node at which to begin the NodeIterator's traversal.
Bitwise OR'd list of Filter specification constants from the NodeFilter DOM interface, indicating which nodes to iterate over.

An object implementing the NodeFilter interface; its acceptNode() method will be called for each node in the subtree based at root which is accepted as included by the whatToShow flag to determine whether or not to include it in the list of iterable nodes (a simple callback function may also be used instead). The method should return one of NodeFilter.FILTER_ACCEPT, NodeFilter.FILTER_REJECT, or NodeFilter.FILTER_SKIP.

member.summary: Creates a new ProcessingInstruction object.

string containing the data to be added to the data within the node.

member.summary: Returns a new Range object.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.CreateTextNode(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new Text node.
member.param: string containing the data to be put in the text node.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.CreateTreeWalker(Bridge.Html5.Node)
member.summary: The Document.createTreeWalker() creator method returns a newly created TreeWalker object.
member.param: Is the root Node of this TreeWalker traversal. Typically this will be an element owned by the document.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.CreateTreeWalker(Bridge.Html5.Node,Bridge.Html5.NodeFilter)
member.summary: The Document.createTreeWalker() creator method returns a newly created TreeWalker object.
member.param: Is the root Node of this TreeWalker traversal. Typically this will be an element owned by the document.

Is an optionale unsigned int representing a bitmask created by combining the constant properties of NodeFilter. It is a convenient way of filtering for certain types of node. It defaults to 0xFFFFFFFF representing the SHOW_ALL constant.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.CreateTreeWalker(Bridge.Html5.Node,Bridge.Html5.NodeFilter,Bridge.Html5.INodeFilter)
member.summary: The Document.createTreeWalker() creator method returns a newly created TreeWalker object.
member.param: Is the root Node of this TreeWalker traversal. Typically this will be an element owned by the document.

Is an optionale unsigned int representing a bitmask created by combining the constant properties of NodeFilter. It is a convenient way of filtering for certain types of node. It defaults to 0xFFFFFFFF representing the SHOW_ALL constant.
Is an optional NodeFilter, that is an object with a method acceptNode, which is called by the TreeWalker to determine whether or not to accept a node that has passed the whatToShow check.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.ElementFromPoint(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the element from the document whose elementFromPoint method is being called which is the topmost element which lies under the given point. To get an element, specify the point via coordinates, in CSS pixels, relative to the upper-left-most point in the window or frame containing the document.
member.param: x and y specify the coordinates to check, in CSS pixels relative to the upper-left corner of the document's containing window or frame.
x and y specify the coordinates to check, in CSS pixels relative to the upper-left corner of the document's containing window or frame.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.EnableStyleSheetsForSet(System.String)
member.summary: Enables the style sheets matching the specified name in the current style sheet set, and disables all other style sheets (except those without a title, which are always enabled).
member.param: The name of the style sheets to enable. All style sheets with a title that match this name will be enabled, while all others that have a title will be disabled. Specify an empty string for the name parameter to disable all alternate and preferred style sheets (but not the persistent style sheets; that is, those with no title attribute).

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.ExitPointerLock
member.summary: The exitPointerLock asynchronously releases a pointer lock previously requested through Element.requestPointerLock. To track the success or failure of the request, it is necessary to listen for the pointerlockchange and pointerlockerror events.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.GetElementsByClassName(System.String)
member.summary: Returns an array-like object of all child elements which have all of the given class names. When called on the document object, the complete document is searched, including the root node. You may also call getElementsByClassName() on any element; it will return only elements which are descendants of the specified root element with the given class names.
member.param: string representing the list of class names to match; class names are separated by whitespace
member.returns: HTMLCollection of found elements.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.GetElementsByTagName(System.String)
member.summary: Returns an HTMLCollection of elements with the given tag name. The complete document is searched, including the root node. The returned HTMLCollection is live, meaning that it updates itself automatically to stay in sync with the DOM tree without having to call document.getElementsByTagName() again.
member.param: a string representing the name of the elements. The special string "*" represents all elements.
member.returns: a live HTMLCollection of found elements in the order they appear in the tree.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.GetElementsByTagNameNS(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a list of elements with the given tag name belonging to the given namespace. The complete document is searched, including the root node.
member.param: the namespace URI of elements to look for.
the local name of elements to look for or the special value "*", which matches all elements
member.returns: live NodeList of found elements in the order they appear in the tree.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.ImportNode(Bridge.Html5.Node)
member.summary: Creates a copy of a node from an external document that can be inserted into the current document.
member.param: The node from another document to be imported.
member.returns: The new node that is imported into the document. The new node's parentNode is null, since it has not yet been inserted into the document tree.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.ImportNode(Bridge.Html5.Node,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a copy of a node from an external document that can be inserted into the current document.
member.param: The node from another document to be imported.
A boolean, indicating whether the descendants of the imported node need to be imported.
member.returns: The new node that is imported into the document. The new node's parentNode is null, since it has not yet been inserted into the document tree.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.ReleaseCapture
member.summary: Releases mouse capture if it's currently enabled on an element within this document. Enabling mouse capture on an element is done by calling element.setCapture().

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.GetElementById(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a reference to the element by its ID.
member.param: id is a case-sensitive string representing the unique ID of the element being sought.
member.returns: element is a reference to an Element object, or null if an element with the specified ID is not in the document.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.GetElementById``1(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a reference to the element by its ID.
member.param: id is a case-sensitive string representing the unique ID of the element being sought.
member.returns: element is a reference to an Element object, or null if an element with the specified ID is not in the document.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.QuerySelector(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the first element within the document (using depth-first pre-order traversal of the document's nodes) that matches the specified group of selectors.
member.param: selectors is a string containing one or more CSS selectors separated by commas.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.QuerySelector``1(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the first element within the document (using depth-first pre-order traversal of the document's nodes) that matches the specified group of selectors.
member.param: selectors is a string containing one or more CSS selectors separated by commas.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.QuerySelectorAll(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a list of the elements within the document (using depth-first pre-order traversal of the document's nodes) that match the specified group of selectors. The object returned is a NodeList.
member.param: selectors is a string containing one or more CSS selectors separated by commas.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.Close
member.summary: Closes a document stream for writing.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.ExecCommand(System.String)
member.summary: When an HTML document has been switched to designMode, the document object exposes the execCommand method which allows one to run commands to manipulate the contents of the editable region. Most commands affect the document's selection (bold, italics, etc), while others insert new elements (adding a link) or affect an entire line (indenting). When using contentEditable, calling execCommand will affect the currently active editable element.
member.param: the name of the command

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.ExecCommand(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: When an HTML document has been switched to designMode, the document object exposes the execCommand method which allows one to run commands to manipulate the contents of the editable region. Most commands affect the document's selection (bold, italics, etc), while others insert new elements (adding a link) or affect an entire line (indenting). When using contentEditable, calling execCommand will affect the currently active editable element.
member.param: the name of the command
whether the default user interface should be shown. This is not implemented in Mozilla.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.ExecCommand(System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: When an HTML document has been switched to designMode, the document object exposes the execCommand method which allows one to run commands to manipulate the contents of the editable region. Most commands affect the document's selection (bold, italics, etc), while others insert new elements (adding a link) or affect an entire line (indenting). When using contentEditable, calling execCommand will affect the currently active editable element.
member.param: the name of the command
whether the default user interface should be shown. This is not implemented in Mozilla.
some commands (such as insertimage) require an extra value argument (the image's url). Pass an argument of null if no argument is needed.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.GetElementsByName(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a list of elements with a given name in the (X)HTML document.
member.param: name is the value of the name attribute of the element.
member.returns: elements is an HTMLCollection of elements.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.GetSelection
member.summary: The DOM getSelection() method is available on the Window and Document interfaces.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.HasFocus
member.summary: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the document or any element inside the document has focus. This method can be used to determine whether the active element in a document has focus.
member.returns: false if the active element in the document has no focus; true if the active element in the document has focus.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Document.Open

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.DocumentInstance
member.summary: Each web page loaded in the browser has its own document object. The Document interface serves as an entry point to the web page's content (the DOM tree, including elements such as body and table) and provides functionality global to the document (such as obtaining the page's URL and creating new elements in the document).

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.DocumentInstance.AdoptNode(Bridge.Html5.Node)
member.summary: Adopts a node from an external document. The node and its subtree is removed from the document it's in (if any), and its ownerDocument is changed to the current document. The node can then be inserted into the current document.
member.param: the node from another document to be adopted.
member.returns: the adopted node that can be used in the current document. The new node's parentNode is null, since it has not yet been inserted into the document tree.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.DocumentInstance.CaretPositionFromPoint(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: This method is used to retrieve the caret position in a document based on two coordinates. A CaretPosition is returned, containing the found DOM node and the character offset in that node.
member.param: Horizontal point on the page at where to determine the caret position.
Vertical point on the page at where to determine the caret position.
member.returns: A CaretPosition. Null, if x or y are negative or greater than the viewport.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.DocumentInstance.CaretRangeFromPoint(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: This method is used to retrieve the caret position in a document based on two coordinates. A Range is returned, containing the found DOM node and the character offset in that node.
member.param: Horizontal point on the page at where to determine the caret position.
Vertical point on the page at where to determine the caret position.
member.returns: A Range. Null, if x or y are negative or greater than the viewport.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.DocumentInstance.CreateElement(System.String)
member.summary: In an HTML document creates the specified HTML element or HTMLUnknownElement if the element is not known. In a XUL document creates the specified XUL element. In other documents creates an element with a null namespaceURI.
member.param: tagName is a string that specifies the type of element to be created. The nodeName of the created element is initialized with the value of tagName. Don't use qualified names (like "html:a") with this method.
member.returns: created element object

member.returns: created element object

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.DocumentInstance.CreateNodeIterator(Bridge.Html5.Node,Bridge.Html5.NodeFilter)
member.summary: Returns a new NodeIterator object.
member.param: The root node at which to begin the NodeIterator's traversal.
Bitwise OR'd list of Filter specification constants from the NodeFilter DOM interface, indicating which nodes to iterate over.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.DocumentInstance.CreateNodeIterator(Bridge.Html5.Node,Bridge.Html5.NodeFilter,Bridge.Html5.INodeFilter)
member.summary: Returns a new NodeIterator object.
member.param: The root node at which to begin the NodeIterator's traversal.
Bitwise OR'd list of Filter specification constants from the NodeFilter DOM interface, indicating which nodes to iterate over.

An object implementing the NodeFilter interface; its acceptNode() method will be called for each node in the subtree based at root which is accepted as included by the whatToShow flag to determine whether or not to include it in the list of iterable nodes (a simple callback function may also be used instead). The method should return one of NodeFilter.FILTER_ACCEPT, NodeFilter.FILTER_REJECT, or NodeFilter.FILTER_SKIP.

member.param: Is the root Node of this TreeWalker traversal. Typically this will be an element owned by the document.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.DocumentInstance.CreateTreeWalker(Bridge.Html5.Node,Bridge.Html5.NodeFilter)
member.summary: The Document.createTreeWalker() creator method returns a newly created TreeWalker object.
member.param: Is the root Node of this TreeWalker traversal. Typically this will be an element owned by the document.

Is an optionale unsigned long representing a bitmask created by combining the constant properties of NodeFilter. It is a convenient way of filtering for certain types of node. It defaults to 0xFFFFFFFF representing the SHOW_ALL constant.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.DocumentInstance.CreateTreeWalker(Bridge.Html5.Node,Bridge.Html5.NodeFilter,Bridge.Html5.INodeFilter)
member.summary: The Document.createTreeWalker() creator method returns a newly created TreeWalker object.
member.param: Is the root Node of this TreeWalker traversal. Typically this will be an element owned by the document.

Is an optionale unsigned long representing a bitmask created by combining the constant properties of NodeFilter. It is a convenient way of filtering for certain types of node. It defaults to 0xFFFFFFFF representing the SHOW_ALL constant.
Is an optional NodeFilter, that is an object with a method acceptNode, which is called by the TreeWalker to determine whether or not to accept a node that has passed the whatToShow check.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.DocumentInstance.ElementFromPoint(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the element from the document whose elementFromPoint method is being called which is the topmost element which lies under the given point. To get an element, specify the point via coordinates, in CSS pixels, relative to the upper-left-most point in the window or frame containing the document.
member.param: x and y specify the coordinates to check, in CSS pixels relative to the upper-left corner of the document's containing window or frame.
x and y specify the coordinates to check, in CSS pixels relative to the upper-left corner of the document's containing window or frame.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.DocumentInstance.EnableStyleSheetsForSet(System.String)
member.summary: Enables the style sheets matching the specified name in the current style sheet set, and disables all other style sheets (except those without a title, which are always enabled).
member.param: The name of the style sheets to enable. All style sheets with a title that match this name will be enabled, while all others that have a title will be disabled. Specify an empty string for the name parameter to disable all alternate and preferred style sheets (but not the persistent style sheets; that is, those with no title attribute).

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.DocumentInstance.ExitPointerLock
member.summary: The exitPointerLock asynchronously releases a pointer lock previously requested through Element.requestPointerLock. To track the success or failure of the request, it is necessary to listen for the pointerlockchange and pointerlockerror events.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.DocumentInstance.GetElementsByClassName(System.String)
member.summary: Returns an array-like object of all child elements which have all of the given class names. When called on the document object, the complete document is searched, including the root node. You may also call getElementsByClassName() on any element; it will return only elements which are descendants of the specified root element with the given class names.
member.param: string representing the list of class names to match; class names are separated by whitespace
member.returns: HTMLCollection of found elements.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.DocumentInstance.GetElementsByTagName(System.String)
member.summary: Returns an HTMLCollection of elements with the given tag name. The complete document is searched, including the root node. The returned HTMLCollection is live, meaning that it updates itself automatically to stay in sync with the DOM tree without having to call document.getElementsByTagName() again.
member.param: a string representing the name of the elements. The special string "*" represents all elements.
member.returns: a live HTMLCollection of found elements in the order they appear in the tree.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.DocumentInstance.GetElementsByTagNameNS(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a list of elements with the given tag name belonging to the given namespace. The complete document is searched, including the root node.
member.param: the namespace URI of elements to look for.
the local name of elements to look for or the special value "*", which matches all elements
member.returns: live NodeList of found elements in the order they appear in the tree.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.DocumentInstance.ImportNode(Bridge.Html5.Node)
member.summary: Creates a copy of a node from an external document that can be inserted into the current document.
member.param: The node from another document to be imported.
member.returns: The new node that is imported into the document. The new node's parentNode is null, since it has not yet been inserted into the document tree.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.DocumentInstance.ImportNode(Bridge.Html5.Node,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a copy of a node from an external document that can be inserted into the current document.
member.param: The node from another document to be imported.
A boolean, indicating whether the descendants of the imported node need to be imported.
member.returns: The new node that is imported into the document. The new node's parentNode is null, since it has not yet been inserted into the document tree.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.DocumentInstance.ReleaseCapture
member.summary: Releases mouse capture if it's currently enabled on an element within this document. Enabling mouse capture on an element is done by calling element.setCapture().

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.DocumentInstance.QuerySelector``1(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the first element within the document (using depth-first pre-order traversal of the document's nodes) that matches the specified group of selectors.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.DocumentInstance.QuerySelectorAll(System.String)

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.DocumentInstance.Close
member.summary: Closes a document stream for writing.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.DocumentInstance.ExecCommand(System.String)
member.summary: When an HTML document has been switched to designMode, the document object exposes the execCommand method which allows one to run commands to manipulate the contents of the editable region. Most commands affect the document's selection (bold, italics, etc), while others insert new elements (adding a link) or affect an entire line (indenting). When using contentEditable, calling execCommand will affect the currently active editable element.
member.param: the name of the command

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.DocumentInstance.ExecCommand(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: When an HTML document has been switched to designMode, the document object exposes the execCommand method which allows one to run commands to manipulate the contents of the editable region. Most commands affect the document's selection (bold, italics, etc), while others insert new elements (adding a link) or affect an entire line (indenting). When using contentEditable, calling execCommand will affect the currently active editable element.
member.param: the name of the command
whether the default user interface should be shown. This is not implemented in Mozilla.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.DocumentInstance.ExecCommand(System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: When an HTML document has been switched to designMode, the document object exposes the execCommand method which allows one to run commands to manipulate the contents of the editable region. Most commands affect the document's selection (bold, italics, etc), while others insert new elements (adding a link) or affect an entire line (indenting). When using contentEditable, calling execCommand will affect the currently active editable element.
member.param: the name of the command
whether the default user interface should be shown. This is not implemented in Mozilla.
some commands (such as insertimage) require an extra value argument (the image's url). Pass an argument of null if no argument is needed.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.DOMImplementation.CreateDocumentType(System.String,System.String,System.String)

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.DOMImplementation.HasFeature(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The DOMImplementation.hasFeature() method returns a Boolean flag indicating if a given feature is supported. The different implementation fairly diverged in what kind of features was reported. The latest version of the spec settled to force this method to always return true, except for SVG features, where the functionnality was accurate and in use.
member.param: Is a DOMString representing the feature name.
Is a DOMString representing the version of the specification defining the feature.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.HTMLAudioElement
member.summary: The HTMLAudioElement interface provides access to the properties of <audio> elements, as well as methods to manipulate them. It derives from the HTMLMediaElement interface. The HTML <audio> element is used to embed sound content in documents. It may contain several audio sources, represented using the src attribute or the <source> element; the browser will choose the most suitable one.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLAudioElement.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor for audio elements. The preload property of the returned object is set to auto and the src property is set to the argument value. The browser begins asynchronously selecting the resource before returning the object.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLAudioElement.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor for audio elements. The preload property of the returned object is set to auto and the src property is set to the argument value. The browser begins asynchronously selecting the resource before returning the object.
member.param: The src property of the constructed HTMLAudioElement.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLBodyElement.Background
member.summary: Color of active hyperlinks.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLBodyElement.Link
member.summary: Color of unvisited links.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLBodyElement.OnAfterPrint
member.summary: Reflects the onafterprint HTML attribute value for a function to call after the user has printed the document.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLBodyElement.OnBeforePrint
member.summary: Reflects the onbeforeprint HTML attribute value for a function to call when the user has requested printing the document.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLBodyElement.OnBeforeUnload
member.summary: Reflects the onbeforeunload HTML attribute value for a function to call when the document is about to be unloaded.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLBodyElement.OnBlur
member.summary: Exposes the window.onblur event handler to call when the window loses focus. Note: This handler is triggered when the event reaches the window, not the body element. Use addEventListener() to attach an event listener to the body element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLBodyElement.OnError
member.summary: Exposes the window.onerror event handler to call when the document fails to load properly. Note: This handler is triggered when the event reaches the window, not the body element. Use addEventListener() to attach an event listener to the body element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLBodyElement.OnFocus
member.summary: Exposes the window.onfocus event handler to call when the window gains focus. Note: This handler is triggered when the event reaches the window, not the body element. Use addEventListener() to attach an event listener to the body element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLBodyElement.OnHashChange
member.summary: Reflects the onhashchange HTML attribute value for a function to call when the fragment identifier in the address of the document changes.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLBodyElement.OnLoad
member.summary: Exposes the window.onload event handler to call when the window gains focus. Note: This handler is triggered when the event reaches the window, not the body element. Use addEventListener() to attach an event listener to the body element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLBodyElement.OnMessage
member.summary: Reflects the onmessage HTML attribute value for a function to call when the document receives a message.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLBodyElement.OnOffline

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.HTMLMediaElement`1
member.summary: The HTMLMediaElement interface has special properties and methods (beyond the properties and methods available for all children of HTMLElement), that are common to all media-related objects. This interface is inherited by HTMLVideoElement and HTMLAudioElement.
member.typeparam: The CurrentTarget type of all MediaElement's events

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLMediaElement`1.AutoPlay
member.summary: Reflects the autoplay HTML attribute, indicating whether playback should automatically begin as soon as enough media is available to do so without interruption.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLMediaElement`1.Buffered
member.summary: The ranges of the media source that the browser has buffered (if any) at the moment the buffered property is accessed. The returned TimeRanges object is normalized.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLMediaElement`1.Controls
member.summary: Reflects the controls HTML attribute, indicating whether user interface items for controlling the resource should be displayed.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLMediaElement`1.CrossOrigin
member.summary: The CORS setting for this image element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLMediaElement`1.CurrentSrc
member.summary: The absolute URL of the chosen media resource (if, for example, the server selects a media file based on the resolution of the user's display), or an empty string if the networkState is EMPTY.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLMediaElement`1.CurrentTime
member.summary: The current playback time, in seconds. Setting this value seeks the media to the new time.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLMediaElement`1.DefaultMuted
member.summary: Reflects the muted HTML attribute, indicating whether the media element's audio output should be muted by default. This property has no dynamic effect, to mute and unmute the audio output, use the muted property.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLMediaElement`1.DefaultPlaybackRate
member.summary: The default playback rate for the media. 1.0 is "normal speed," values lower than 1.0 make the media play slower than normal, higher values make it play faster. The value 0.0 is invalid and throws a NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR exception.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLMediaElement`1.Duration
member.summary: The length of the media in seconds, or zero if no media data is available. If the media data is available but the length is unknown, this value is NaN. If the media is streamed and has no predefined length, the value is Inf.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLMediaElement`1.Ended
member.summary: Indicates whether the media element has ended playback.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLMediaElement`1.Error
member.summary: The MediaError object for the most recent error, or null if there has not been an error.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLMediaElement`1.Loop
member.summary: Reflects the loop HTML attribute, indicating whether the media element should start over when it reaches the end.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLMediaElement`1.MediaGroup
member.summary: Reflects the mediagroup HTML attribute, indicating the name of the group of elements it belongs to. A group of media elements shares a common controller.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLMediaElement`1.Muted
member.summary: True if the audio is muted, and false otherwise.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLMediaElement`1.NetworkState
member.summary: The current state of fetching the media over the network. NETWORK_EMPTY 0 There is no data yet. The readyState is also HAVE_NOTHING. NETWORK_IDLE 1 NETWORK_LOADING 2 The media is loading. NETWORK_NO_SOURCE 3

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLMediaElement`1.Paused
member.summary: Indicates whether the media element is paused.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLMediaElement`1.PlaybackRate
member.summary: The current rate at which the media is being played back. This is used to implement user controls for fast forward, slow motion, and so forth. The normal playback rate is multiplied by this value to obtain the current rate, so a value of 1.0 indicates normal speed. If the playbackRate is negative, the media is played backwards. The audio is muted when the media plays backwards or if the fast forward or slow motion is outside a useful range (E.g. Gecko mute the sound outside the range 0.25 and 5.0). The pitch of the audio is corrected by default and is the same for every speed. Some navigators implement the non-standard preservespitch property to control this.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLMediaElement`1.Played
member.summary: The ranges of the media source that the browser has played, if any.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLMediaElement`1.Preload
member.summary: Reflects the preload HTML attribute, indicating what data should be preloaded, if any. It may have one of the following values: none: hints that either the author thinks that the user won't need to consult that video or that the server wants to minimize its traffic; in others terms this hint indicates that the video should not be cached. metadata: hints that though the author thinks that the user won't need to consult that video, fetching the metadata (e.g. length) is reasonable. auto: hints that the user needs have priority; in others terms this hint indicated that, if needed, the whole video could be downloaded, even if the user is not expected to use it. the empty string: which is a synonym of the auto value.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLMediaElement`1.ReadyState
member.summary: The readiness state of the media. HAVE_NOTHING 0 No information is available about the media resource. HAVE_METADATA 1 Enough of the media resource has been retrieved that the metadata attributes are initialized. Seeking will no longer raise an exception. HAVE_CURRENT_DATA 2 Data is available for the current playback position, but not enough to actually play more than one frame. HAVE_FUTURE_DATA 3 Data for the current playback position as well as for at least a little bit of time into the future is available (in other words, at least two frames of video, for example). HAVE_ENOUGH_DATA 4 Enough data is availableâand the download rate is high enoughâthat the media can be played through to the end without interruption.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLMediaElement`1.Seekable
member.summary: The time ranges that the user is able to seek to, if any.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLMediaElement`1.Seeking
member.summary: Indicates whether the media is in the process of seeking to a new position.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLMediaElement`1.Src
member.summary: Reflects the src HTML attribute, containing the URL of a media resource to use.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLMediaElement`1.TextTracks
member.summary: Represents the list of TextTrack objects contained in the element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLMediaElement`1.Volume
member.summary: The audio volume, from 0.0 (silent) to 1.0 (loudest).

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLMediaElement`1.CanPlayType(System.String)
member.summary:
Determines whether the specified media type can be played back. Returns:
probably : if the specified type appears to be playable. maybe : if it's impossible to tell whether the type is playable without playing it. The empty string : if the specified type definitely cannot be played.
member.param: The media type
member.returns: The string representing that the specified type may be played or not

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLMediaElement`1.FastSeek(System.Double)
member.summary: Directly seek to the given time.
member.param: The time to seek

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLMediaElement`1.Load
member.summary: Begins loading the media content from the server.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLMediaElement`1.Pause
member.summary: Pauses the media playback.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLMediaElement`1.Play
member.summary: Begins playback of the media. If you have changed the src attribute of the media element since the page was loaded, you must call load() before play(), otherwise the original media plays again.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.MediaElement
member.summary: The non-generic MediaElement class. Events' CurrentTarget has the MediaElement type.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.TimeRanges
member.summary: The TimeRanges interface is used to represent a set of time ranges, primarily for the purpose of tracking which portions of media have been buffered when loading it for use by the <audio> and <video> elements. A TimeRanges object includes one or more ranges of time, each specified by a starting and ending time offset. You reference each time range by using the start() and end() methods, passing the index number of the time range you want to retrieve. The term "normalized TimeRanges object" indicates that ranges in such an object are ordered, don't overlap, aren't empty, and don't touch (adjacent ranges are folded into one bigger range).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TimeRanges.Length
member.summary: The number of time ranges represented by the time range object.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.TimeRanges.Start(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the time offset at which a specified time range begins. A DOMException thrown if the specified index doesn't correspond to an existing range.
member.param: The range number to return the starting time for.
member.returns: Returns the time offset at which a specified time range begins.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.TimeRanges.End(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the time offset at which a specified time range ends. A DOMException thrown if the specified index doesn't correspond to an existing range.
member.param: The range number to return the ending time for.
member.returns: Returns the time offset at which a specified time range ends.

member.summary: The HTMLObjectElement interface provides special properties and methods (beyond those on the HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating the layout and presentation of <object> element, representing external resources. The HTML <object> Element (or HTML Embedded Object Element) represents an external resource, which can be treated as an image, a nested browsing context, or a resource to be handled by a plugin.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLOListElement.Start

It can have the following values: '1' meaning that decimal numbers are used: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, â¦ 'a' meaning that the lowercase latin alphabet is used: a, b, c, d, e, â¦ 'A' meaning that the uppercase latin alphabet is used: A, B, C, D, E, â¦ 'i' meaning that the lowercase latin numerals are used: i, ii, iii, iv, v, â¦ 'I' meaning that the uppercase latin numerals are used: I, II, III, IV, V, â¦

member.summary: The HTMLOptionElement interface represents <option> elements and inherits all classes and methods of the HTMLElement interface.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLOptionElement.DefaultSelected
member.summary: Contains the initial value of the selected HTML attribute, indicating whether the option is selected by default or not.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLOptionElement.Disable
member.summary: Reflects the value of the disabled HTML attribute, which indicates that the option is unavailable to be selected. An option can also be disabled if it is a child of an <optgroup> element that is disabled.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLOptionElement.Form
member.summary: If the option is a descendent of a <select> element, then this property has the same value as the form property of the corresponding HTMLSelectElement object; otherwise, it is null.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLOptionElement.Index
member.summary: The position of the option within the list of options it belongs to, in tree-order. If the option is not part of a list of options, like when it is part of the <datalist> element, the value is 0.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLOptionElement.Label
member.summary: Reflects the value of the label HTML attribute, which provides a label for the option. If this attribute isn't specifically set, reading it returns the element's text content.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLOptionElement.Selected
member.summary: Indicates whether the option is currently selected.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLOptionElement.Text
member.summary: Contains the text content of the element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLOptionElement.Value
member.summary: Reflects the value of the value HTML attribute, if it exists; otherwise reflects value of the Node.textContent property.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLOutputElement.DefaultValue
member.summary: The default value of the element, initially the empty string.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLOutputElement.Form

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLOutputElement.HtmlFor

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLOutputElement.Name

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLOutputElement.Type

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLOutputElement.ValidationMessage
member.summary: A localized message that describes the validation constraints that the control does not satisfy (if any). This is the empty string if the control is not a candidate for constraint validation (willValidate is false), or it satisfies its constraints.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLOutputElement.Validity
member.summary: The validity states that this element is in.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLOutputElement.WillValidate
member.summary: The behavior of this property is subject to an open specification bug (https://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=10912), as some browser maker are not happy with what is specified. It is unclear which will be the final the outcome of this. The standard behavior is to always return false because output objects are never candidates for constraint validation. The proposed new behavior, implemented in Firefox since Gecko 2.0 is to use this property to indicate whether the element is a candidate for constraint validation. It is false if any conditions bar it from constraint validation (See bug 604673 (https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=604673)).

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLOutputElement.CheckValidity
member.summary: The behavior of this property is subject to an open specification bug (https://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=10912), as some browser maker are not happy with what is specified. It is unclear which will be the final the outcome of this. The standard behavior is to always return true because output objects are never candidates for constraint validation. The proposed new behavior, implemented in Firefox since Gecko 2.0 is to return false if the element is a candidate for constraint validation, and it does not satisfy its constraints. In this case, it also fires an "invalid" event at the element. It returns true if the element is not a candidate for constraint validation, or if it satisfies its constraints (See bug 604673 (https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=604673)).

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLOutputElement.SetCustomValidity(System.String)
member.summary: Sets a custom validity message for the element. If this message is not the empty string, then the element is suffering from a custom validity error, and does not validate.
member.param: The custom validity message

Only one form element in a document can have the autofocus attribute. It cannot be applied if the type attribute is set to hidden (that is, you cannot automatically set focus to a hidden control).

member.summary: Reflects the autofocus HTML attribute, indicating that the form control should have input focus when the page loads.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLProgressElement.Position

T:Bridge.Html5.HTMLScriptElement
member.summary: HTML script elements expose the HTMLScriptElement interface, which provides special properties and methods (beyond the regular HTMLElement object interface they also have available to them by inheritance) for manipulating the layout and presentation of <script> elements.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLScriptElement.Async
member.summary: The async and defer attributes are boolean attributes that indicate how the script should be executed. The defer and async attributes must not be specified if the src attribute is not present. There are three possible modes that can be selected using these attributes. If the async attribute is present, then the script will be executed asynchronously, as soon as it is available. If the async attribute is not present but the defer attribute is present, then the script is executed when the page has finished parsing. If neither attribute is present, then the script is fetched and executed immediately, before the user agent continues parsing the page. Note: The exact processing details for these attributes are, for mostly historical reasons, somewhat non-trivial, involving a number of aspects of HTML. The implementation requirements are therefore by necessity scattered throughout the specification. These algorithms describe the core of this processing, but these algorithms reference and are referenced by the parsing rules for <script> start and end tags in HTML, in foreign content, and in XML, the rules for the document.write() method, the handling of scripting, etc. The defer attribute may be specified even if the async attribute is specified, to cause legacy Web browsers that only support defer (and not async) to fall back to the defer behavior instead of the synchronous blocking behavior that is the default.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLScriptElement.Charset
member.summary: Represents the character encoding of the external script resource. It reflects the charset attribute.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLScriptElement.CrossOrigin
member.summary: Is a DOMString that corresponds to the CORS setting for this script element. See CORS settings attributes for details. It controls, for scripts that are obtained from other origins, whether error information will be exposed.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLScriptElement.Defer
member.summary: The async and defer attributes are boolean attributes that indicate how the script should be executed. The defer and async attributes must not be specified if the src attribute is not present. There are three possible modes that can be selected using these attributes. If the async attribute is present, then the script will be executed asynchronously, as soon as it is available. If the async attribute is not present but the defer attribute is present, then the script is executed when the page has finished parsing. If neither attribute is present, then the script is fetched and executed immediately, before the user agent continues parsing the page. Note: The exact processing details for these attributes are, for mostly historical reasons, somewhat non-trivial, involving a number of aspects of HTML. The implementation requirements are therefore by necessity scattered throughout the specification. These algorithms describe the core of this processing, but these algorithms reference and are referenced by the parsing rules for <script> start and end tags in HTML, in foreign content, and in XML, the rules for the document.write() method, the handling of scripting, etc. The defer attribute may be specified even if the async attribute is specified, to cause legacy Web browsers that only support defer (and not async) to fall back to the defer behavior instead of the synchronous blocking behavior that is the default.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLScriptElement.Text
member.summary: The IDL attribute text must return a concatenation of the contents of all the Text nodes that are children of the <script> element (ignoring any other nodes such as comments or elements), in tree order. On setting, it must act the same way as the textContent IDL attribute. Note: When inserted using the document.write() method, <script> elements execute (typically synchronously), but when inserted using innerHTML and outerHTML attributes, they do not execute at all.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLScriptElement.Type
member.summary: Represents the MIME type of the script. It reflects the type attribute.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLScriptElement.Src
member.summary: Represents gives the address of the external script resource to use. It reflects the src attribute.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.HTMLSelectElement
member.summary: HTML <select> elements share all of the properties and methods of other HTML elements described in the element section. They also have the specialized interface HTMLSelectElement.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLSelectElement.AutoFocus
member.summary: Reflects the autofocus HTML attribute, which indicates whether the control should have input focus when the page loads, unless the user overrides it, for example by typing in a different control. Only one form-associated element in a document can have this attribute specified.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLSelectElement.Disabled
member.summary: Reflects the disabled HTML attribute, which indicates whether the control is disabled. If it is disabled, it does not accept clicks.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLSelectElement.Form
member.summary: The form that this element is associated with. If this element is a descendant of a form element, then this attribute is the ID of that form element. If the element is not a descendant of a form element, then: HTML5 The attribute can be the ID of any form element in the same document. HTML 4 The attribute is null.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLSelectElement.Labels
member.summary: A list of label elements associated with this select element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLSelectElement.Length
member.summary: The number of <option> elements in this select element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLSelectElement.Multiple
member.summary: Reflects the multiple HTML attribute, whichindicates whether multiple items can be selected.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLSelectElement.Name
member.summary: Reflects the name HTML attribute, containing the name of this control used by servers and DOM search functions.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLSelectElement.Options
member.summary: The set of <option> elements contained by this element. Read only.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLSelectElement.Required
member.summary: Reflects the required HTML attribute, which indicates whether the user is required to select a value before submitting the form.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLSelectElement.SelectedIndex
member.summary: The index of the first selected <option> element. The value -1 is returned if no element is selected.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLSelectElement.SelectedOptions
member.summary: The set of options that are selected.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLSelectElement.Size
member.summary: Reflects the size HTML attribute, which contains the number of visible items in the control. The default is 1, HTML5 unless multiple is true, in which case it is 4.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLSelectElement.Src
member.summary: Reflects the src HTML attribute, which specifies a URI for the location of an image to display on the graphical submit button, if the value of type is image; otherwise it is ignored.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLSelectElement.Type
member.summary: The form control's type. When multiple is true, it returns select-multiple; otherwise, it returns select-one. Read only.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLSelectElement.ValidationMessage
member.summary: A localized message that describes the validation constraints that the control does not satisfy (if any). This attribute is the empty string if the control is not a candidate for constraint validation (willValidate is false), or it satisfies its constraints. Read only.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLSelectElement.Validity
member.summary: The validity states that this control is in. Read only.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLSelectElement.Value
member.summary: The value of this form control, that is, of the first selected option.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLSelectElement.WillValidate
member.summary: Indicates whether the button is a candidate for constraint validation. It is false if any conditions bar it from constraint validation. Read only.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLSelectElement.Add(Bridge.Html5.HTMLElement)
member.summary: Adds an element to the collection of option elements for this select element. An item to add to the collection of options.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLSelectElement.Add(Bridge.Html5.HTMLElement,Bridge.Html5.HTMLElement)
member.summary: Adds an element to the collection of option elements for this select element. An item to add to the collection of options. An item that the new item should be inserted before. If this parameter is null, the new element is appended to the end of the collection.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLSelectElement.Add(Bridge.Html5.HTMLElement,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds an element to the collection of option elements for this select element. An item to add to the collection of options. An index of an item that the new item should be inserted before. If the index does not exist, the new element is appended to the end of the collection.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLSelectElement.CheckValidity
member.summary: Checks whether the element has any constraints and whether it satisfies them. If the element fails its constraints, the browser fires a cancelable invalid event at the element (and returns false).
member.returns: A false value if the select element is a candidate for constraint evaluation and it does not satisfy its constraints. Returns true if the element is not constrained, or if it satisfies its constraints.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLSelectElement.GetItem(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets an item from the options collection for this select element. You can also access an item by specifying the index in array-style brackets or parentheses, without calling this method explicitly. The zero-based index into the collection of the option to get. The node at the specified index, or null if such a node does not exist in the collection.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLSelectElement.NamedItem(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the item in the options collection with the specified name. The name string can match either the id or the name attribute of an option node. You can also access an item by specifying the name in array-style brackets or parentheses, without calling this method explicitly.
member.param: The name of the option to get.
member.returns: - An OptionElement, if there is exactly one match. - null if there are no matches. - An OptionsCollection in tree order of nodes whose name or id attributes match the specified name.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLSelectElement.Remove(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the element at the specified index from the options collection for this select element. The zero-based index of the option element to remove from the collection.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLSelectElement.SetCustomValidity(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the custom validity message for the selection element to the specified message. Use the empty string to indicate that the element does not have a custom validity error.
member.param: The string to use for the custom validity message.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.HTMLStyleElement
member.summary: The HTMLStyleElement interface represents a <style> element. It inherits properties and methods from its parent, HTMLElement, and from LinkStyle. This interface doesn't allow to manipulate the CSS it contains (in most case). To manipulate CSS, see Using dynamic styling information for an overview of the objects used to manipulate specified CSS properties using the DOM.

member.summary: Is a DOMString representing the intended destination medium for style information.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLStyleElement.Type
