member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLStyleElement.Sheet
member.summary: Returns the StyleSheet object associated with the given element, or null if there is none

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableCaptionElement
member.summary: The HTMLTableCaptionElement interface special properties (beyond the regular HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating table caption elements.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableCellElement`1
member.summary: The HTMLTableCellElement interface provides special properties and methods (beyond the regular HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating the layout and presentation of table cells, either header or data cells, in an HTML document. The HTML elements implementing this interface: <th> and <td>.
member.typeparam: The CurrentTarget type of all TableCellElement's events

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableCellElement`1.ColSpan
member.summary: Is an unsigned long that represents the number of columns this cell must span. It reflects the colspan attribute.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableCellElement`1.RowSpan
member.summary: Is an unsigned long that represents the number of rows this cell must span. It reflects the rowspan attribute.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableCellElement`1.Headers
member.summary: Is a DOMSettableTokenList describing a list of id of <th> elements that represents headers associated with the cell. It reflects the headers attribute.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableCellElement`1.CellIndex
member.summary: Is a long representing the cell position in the cells collection of the <tr> it belongs to. If the cell doesn't belong to a <tr>, it returns -1.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.TableCellElement
member.summary: The non-generic TableCellElement class. Events' CurrentTarget has the TableCellElement type.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableColElement
member.summary: The HTMLTableColElement interface provides special properties (beyond the HTMLElement interface it also has available to it inheritance) for manipulating single or grouped table column elements. The HTML element implementing this interface: <col> and <colgroup>.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableColElement.Span
member.summary: Reflects the span HTML attribute, indicating the number of columns to apply this object's attributes to. Must be a positive integer.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.TableColumnType
member.summary: Specifies the type of a table column. It can be a single <col> or a group <colgroup> column.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TableColumnType.Single
member.summary: <col></col>

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TableColumnType.Group
member.summary: <colgroup></colgroup>

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableElement
member.summary: The HTMLTableElement interface provides special properties and methods (beyond the regular HTMLElement object interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating the layout and presentation of tables in an HTML document.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableElement.Caption
member.summary: Is an HTMLTableCaptionElement representing the first <caption> that is a child of the element, or null if none is found. When set, if the object doesn't represent a <caption>, a DOMException with the HierarchyRequestError name is thrown. If a correct object is given, it is inserted in the tree as the first child of this element and the first <caption> that is a child of this element is removed from the tree, if any.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableElement.THead
member.summary: Is an HTMLTableSectionElement representing the first <thead> that is a child of the element, or null if none is found. When set, if the object doesn't represent a <thead>, a DOMException with the HierarchyRequestError name is thrown. If a correct object is given, it is inserted in the tree immediately before the first element that is neither a <caption>, nor a <colgroup>, or as the last child if there is no such element, and the first <thead> that is a child of this element is removed from the tree, if any.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableElement.TFoot
member.summary: Is an HTMLTableSectionElement representing the first <tfoot> that is a child of the element, or null if none is found. When set, if the object doesn't represent a <tfoot>, a DOMException with the HierarchyRequestError name is thrown. If a correct object is given, it is inserted in the tree immediately before the first element that is neither a <caption>, a <colgroup>, nor a <thead>, or as the last child if there is no such element, and the first <tfoot> that is a child of this element is removed from the tree, if any.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableElement.Rows
member.summary: Returns a live HTMLCollection containing all the rows of the element, that is all <tr> that are a child of the element, or a child or one of its <thead>, <tbody> and <tfoot> children. The rows members of a <thead> appear first, in tree order, and those members of a <tbody> last, also in tree order. The HTMLCollection is live and is automatically updated when the HTMLTableElement changes.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableElement.TBodies
member.summary: Returns a live HTMLCollection containing all the <tbody> of the element. The HTMLCollection is live and is automatically updated when the HTMLTableElement changes.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableElement.CreateTHead
member.summary: Returns an HTMLElement representing the first <thead> that is a child of the element. If none is found, a new one is created and inserted in the tree immediately before the first element that is neither a <caption>, nor a <colgroup>, or as the last child if there is no such element.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableElement.DeleteTHead
member.summary: Removes the first <thead> that is a child of the element.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableElement.CreateTFoot
member.summary: Returns an HTMLElement representing the first <tfoot> that is a child of the element. If none is found, a new one is created and inserted in the tree immediately before the first element that is neither a <caption>, a <colgroup>, nor a <thead>, or as the last child if there is no such element.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableElement.DeleteTFoot
member.summary: Removes the first <tfoot> that is a child of the element.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableElement.CreateCaption
member.summary: Returns an HTMLElement representing the first <caption> that is a child of the element. If none is found, a new one is created and inserted in the tree as the first child of the <table> element.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableElement.DeleteCaption
member.summary: Removes the first <caption> that is a child of the element.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableElement.InsertRow(System.Int32)
member.summary: Inserts a new row in the table and returns a reference to the row. If index is -1 or equal to the number of rows, the row is appended as the last row. If index is greater than the number of rows, an IndexSizeError exception will result. If index is omitted it defaults to -1. If a table has multiple tbody elements, by default, the new row is inserted into the last tbody.
member.param: The row index of the new row. Defaults to -1.
member.returns: Returns the TableRowElement representing the new row of the table.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableElement.DeleteRow(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the row corresponding to the index given in parameter. If the index value is -1 the last row is removed; if it smaller than -1 or greater than the amount of rows in the collection, a DOMException with the value IndexSizeError is raised.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableHeaderCellElement
member.summary: The HTMLTableHeaderCellElement interface provides special properties and methods (beyond the regular HTMLTableCellElement and HTMLElement interfaces it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating the layout and presentation of table header cells in an HTML document.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableHeaderCellElement.Abbr
member.summary: Is a DOMString containing a name used to refer to this cell in other context. It reflects the abbr attribute.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableHeaderCellElement.Scope
member.summary: Is a DOMString representing an enumerated value indicating which cells the header cell applies to. It reflects the scope attribute and has one of the following values: "row", "col", "colgroup", or "rowgroup". If the attribute is in the auto state, or if an invalid value is set for the attribute, scope will be returns the empty string, "".

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.TableHeaderCellScope
member.summary: The scope attribute specifies whether a header cell is a header for a column, row, or group of columns or rows.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TableHeaderCellScope.Col
member.summary: Specifies that the cell is a header for a column

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TableHeaderCellScope.Row
member.summary: Specifies that the cell is a header for a row

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TableHeaderCellScope.ColGroup
member.summary: Specifies that the cell is a header for a group of columns

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TableHeaderCellScope.RowGroup
member.summary: Specifies that the cell is a header for a group of rows

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableDataCellElement
member.summary: The HTMLTableDataCellElement interface provides special properties and methods (beyond the regular HTMLTableCellElement and HTMLElement interfaces it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating the layout and presentation of table data cells in an HTML document.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableRowElement
member.summary: The HTMLTableRowElement interface provides special properties and methods (beyond the HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating the layout and presentation of rows in an HTML table.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableRowElement.Cells
member.summary: Returns a live HTMLCollection containing the cells in the row. The HTMLCollection is live and is automatically updated when cells are added or removed.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableRowElement.RowIndex
member.summary: Returns a long value which gives the logical position of the row within the entire table. If the row is not part of a table, returns -1.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableRowElement.SectionRowIndex
member.summary: Returns a long value which gives the logical position of the row within the table section it belongs to. If the row is not part of a section, returns -1.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableRowElement.DeleteCell(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the cell at the given position in the row. If the given position is greater (or equal as it starts at zero) than the amount of cells in the row, or is smaller than 0, it raises a DOMException with the IndexSizeError value. The position of the cell in the row

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableRowElement.InsertCell(System.Int32)
member.summary: Inserts a new cell into a table row and returns a reference to the cell. If index is -1 or equal to the number of cells, the cell is appended as the last cell in the row. If index is greater than the number of cells, an IndexSizeError exception will result. If index is omitted it defaults to -1. The cell index of the new cell. Defaults to -1. Returns the TableDataCellElement representing the new cell of the row.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableSectionElement
member.summary: The HTMLTableSectionElement interface provides special properties and methods (beyond the HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating the layout and presentation of sections, that is headers, footers and bodies, in an HTML table. The HTML elements implementing this interface: <tfoot>, <thead>, and <tbody>.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableSectionElement.Rows
member.summary: Returns a live HTMLCollection containing the rows in the section. The HTMLCollection is live and is automatically updated when rows are added or removed.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableSectionElement.DeleteRow(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the cell at the given position in the section. If the given position is greater (or equal as it starts at zero) than the amount of rows in the section, or is smaller than 0, it raises a DOMException with the IndexSizeError value.
member.param: The position of the row to delete

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTableSectionElement.InsertRow(System.Int32)
member.summary: Inserts a new row just before the given position in the section. If the given position is -1, it appends the row to the end of section. If the given position is greater (or equal as it starts at zero) than the amount of rows in the section, or is smaller than -1, it raises a DOMException with the IndexSizeError value.
member.param: The possition of a new row to insert
member.returns: Returns a TableRowElement object that represents a new row added to a table element.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.TableSectionType
member.summary: Specifies the type of a table section. It can be a footer <tfoot>, a header <thead> or a body <tbody> section.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TableSectionType.Body
member.summary: <tbody></tbody>

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TableSectionType.Footer
member.summary: <tfoot></tfoot>

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TableSectionType.Header
member.summary: <thead></thead>

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTextAreaElement
member.summary: The HTMLTextAreaElement interface, which provides special properties and methods (beyond the regular HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating the layout and presentation of <textarea> elements.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTextAreaElement.AutoFocus
member.summary: Reflects the autofocus HTML attribute, which specifies that a form control should have input focus when the page loads, unless the user overrides it, for example by typing in a different control. Only one form element in a document can have the autofocus attribute. It cannot be applied if the type attribute is set to hidden (that is, you cannot automatically set focus to a hidden control).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTextAreaElement.Cols
member.summary: Reflects the cols HTML attribute, indicating the visible width of the text area.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTextAreaElement.DefaultValue
member.summary: The default value as originally specified in HTML that created this object.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTextAreaElement.Disabled
member.summary: Reflects the disabled HTML attribute, indicating that the control is not available for interaction. The input values will not be submitted with the form. See also readonly

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTextAreaElement.Form
member.summary: The containing form element, if this element is in a form. If this element is not contained in a form element: HTML5 this can be the id attribute of any <form> element in the same document. Even if the attribute is set on <input>, this property will be null, if it isn't the id of a <form> element. HTML 4 this must be null.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTextAreaElement.MaxLength
member.summary: Reflects the maxlength HTML attribute, containing the maximum length of text (in Unicode code points) that the value can be changed to. The constraint is evaluated only when the value is changed

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTextAreaElement.Name
member.summary: Reflects the name HTML attribute, containing a name that identifies the element when submitting the form.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTextAreaElement.Placeholder
member.summary: Reflects the placeholder HTML attribute, containing a hint to the user of what can be entered in the control. The placeholder text must not contain carriage returns or line-feeds. This attribute applies when the value of the type attribute is text, search, tel, url or email; otherwise it is ignored.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTextAreaElement.ReadOnly
member.summary: Reflects the readonly HTML attribute, indicating that the user cannot modify the value of the control. HTML5This is ignored if the value of the type attribute is hidden, range, color, checkbox, radio, file, or a button type.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTextAreaElement.Required
member.summary: Reflects the required HTML attribute, indicating that the user must fill in a value before submitting a form.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTextAreaElement.Rows
member.summary: Reflects the rows HTML attribute, indicating the number of visible text lines for the control.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTextAreaElement.SelectionDirection
member.summary: The direction in which selection occurred. This is "forward" if selection was performed in the start-to-end direction of the current locale, or "backward" for the opposite direction. This can also be "none" if the direction is unknown."

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTextAreaElement.SelectionEnd
member.summary: The index of the end of selected text.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTextAreaElement.SelectionStart
member.summary: The index of the beginning of selected text. When nothing is selected, this is also the caret position inside of the input element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTextAreaElement.Type
member.summary: The string textarea.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTextAreaElement.ValidationMessage
member.summary: A localized message that describes the validation constraints that the control does not satisfy (if any). This is the empty string if the control is not a candidate for constraint validation (willvalidate is false), or it satisfies its constraints.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTextAreaElement.Validity
member.summary: The validity state that this element is in.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTextAreaElement.Value
member.summary: The raw value contained in the control.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTextAreaElement.WillValidate
member.summary: Indicates whether the element is a candidate for constraint validation. It is false if any conditions bar it from constraint validation.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTextAreaElement.Wrap
member.summary: Reflects the wrap HTML attribute, indicating how the control wraps text. If this attribute is not specified, soft is its default value.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTextAreaElement.CheckValidity
member.summary: Returns false if the button is a candidate for constraint validation, and it does not satisfy its constraints. In this case, it also fires an invalid event at the control. It returns true if the control is not a candidate for constraint validation, or if it satisfies its constraints.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTextAreaElement.Select
member.summary: Selects the contents of the control.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTextAreaElement.SetCustomValidity(System.String)
member.summary: Sets a custom validity message for the element. If this message is not the empty string, then the element is suffering from a custom validity error, and does not validate.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTextAreaElement.SetSelectionRange(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Selects a range of text in the element (but does not focus it). The optional selectionDirection parameter may be "forward" or "backward" to establish the direction in which selection was set, or "none" if the direction is unknown or not relevant. The default is "none". Specifying a selectionDirection parameter sets the value of the selectionDirection property.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTextAreaElement.SetSelectionRange(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Selects a range of text in the element (but does not focus it). The optional selectionDirection parameter may be "forward" or "backward" to establish the direction in which selection was set, or "none" if the direction is unknown or not relevant. The default is "none". Specifying a selectionDirection parameter sets the value of the selectionDirection property.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTextAreaElement.SetRangeText(System.String)
member.summary: Replaces a range of text with the new text. Supported input types: text, search, url, tel, password.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTextAreaElement.SetRangeText(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Replaces a range of text with the new text. Supported input types: text, search, url, tel, password.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTextAreaElement.SetRangeText(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Replaces a range of text with the new text. Supported input types: text, search, url, tel, password.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.Wrap
member.summary: Indicates how the control wraps text.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Wrap.Hard
member.summary: The browser automatically inserts line breaks (CR+LF) so that each line has no more than the width of the control; the cols attribute must be specified.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Wrap.Soft
member.summary: The browser ensures that all line breaks in the value consist of a CR+LF pair, but does not insert any additional line breaks.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.HTMLSpanElement
member.summary: The HTMLSpanElement interface represents a <span> element and derives from the HTMLElement interface, but without implementing any additional properties or methods.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.HTMLDivElement
member.summary: The HTMLDivElement interface provides special properties (beyond the regular HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating div elements.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.HTMLFormElement
member.summary: The HTMLFormElement interface provides methods to create and modify <form> elements; it inherits from properties and methods of the HTMLElement interface.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLFormElement.AcceptCharset
member.summary: Reflects the accept-charset HTML attribute, containing a list of character encodings that the server accepts.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLFormElement.Action
member.summary: Reflects the action HTML attribute, containing the URI of a program that processes the information submitted by the form.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLFormElement.AutoComplete
member.summary: Reflects the autocomplete HTML attribute, containing a string that indicates whether the controls in this form can have their values automatically populated by the browser.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLFormElement.Elements
member.summary: All the form controls belonging to this form element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLFormElement.Encoding
member.summary: The HTMLFormElement.enctype property represents the content type of the form element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLFormElement.Enctype
member.summary: Reflects the enctype HTML attribute, indicating the type of content that is used to transmit the form to the server. Only specified values can be set.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLFormElement.Length
member.summary: The number of controls in the form.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLFormElement.Method
member.summary: Reflects the method HTML attribute, indicating the HTTP method used to submit the form. Only specified values can be set.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLFormElement.Name
member.summary: Reflects the name HTML attribute, containing the name of the form.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLFormElement.NoValidate
member.summary: Reflects the novalidate HTML attribute, indicating that the form should not be validated.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLFormElement.Target
member.summary: Reflects the target HTML attribute, indicating where to display the results received from submitting the form.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLFormElement.CheckValidity
member.summary: Returns true if all controls that are subject to constraint validation satisfy their constraints, or false if some controls do not satisfy their constraints. Fires an event named invalid at any control that does not satisfy its constraints; such controls are considered invalid if the event is not canceled.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLFormElement.Submit
member.summary: Submits the form to the server.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLFormElement.Reset
member.summary: Resets the forms to its initial state.

member.name: P:Bridge.Html5.HTMLFormElement.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the item in the elements collection at the specified index, or null if there is no item at that index. You can also specify the index in array-style brackets or parentheses after the form object name, without calling this method explicitly.

member.name: P:Bridge.Html5.HTMLFormElement.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the item or list of items in elements collection whose name or id match the specified name, or null if no items match. You can also specify the name in array-style brackets or parentheses after the form object name, without calling this method explicitly.
member.param: The name to match the Elements' name and id
member.returns: An Element or an HTMLCollection

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLFormElement.GetItem(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the item in the elements collection at the specified index, or null if there is no item at that index. You can also specify the index in array-style brackets or parentheses after the form object name, without calling this method explicitly.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLFormElement.NamedItem(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the item or list of items in elements collection whose name or id match the specified name, or null if no items match. You can also specify the name in array-style brackets or parentheses after the form object name, without calling this method explicitly.
member.param: The name to match the Elements' name and id
member.returns: An Element or an HTMLCollection

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.HTMLAnchorElement
member.summary: The HTMLAnchorElement interface represents hyperlink elements and provides special properties and methods (beyond those of the regular HTMLElement object interface they also have available to them by inheritance) for manipulating the layout and presentation of such elements.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLAnchorElement.Charset
member.summary: Is a DOMString representing the character encoding of the linked resource.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLAnchorElement.Coords
member.summary: Is a DOMString representing a comma-separated list of coordinates.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLAnchorElement.Download
member.summary: Is a DOMString indicating that the linked resource is intended to be downloaded rather than displayed in the browser. The value represent the proposed name of the file. If the name is not a valid filename of the underlying OS, browser will adapt it. The value is a URL with a scheme like http:, file:, data: or even blob: (created with URL.createObjectURL).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLAnchorElement.Hash
member.summary: Is a DOMString that reflects the href HTML attribute, containing a valid URL of a linked resource.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLAnchorElement.Host
member.summary: Is a DOMString representing the hostname and port (if it's not the default port) in the referenced URL.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLAnchorElement.Hostname
member.summary: Is a DOMString representing the hostname in the referenced URL.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLAnchorElement.Href
member.summary: Is a DOMString that reflects the href HTML attribute, containing a valid URL of a linked resource.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLAnchorElement.Hreflang
member.summary: Is a DOMString that reflects the hreflang HTML attribute, indicating the language of the linked resource.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLAnchorElement.Media
member.summary: Is a DOMString that reflects the media HTML attribute, indicating the intended media for the linked resource.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLAnchorElement.Name
member.summary: Is a DOMString representing the anchor name.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLAnchorElement.Password
member.summary: Is a DOMString containing the password specified before the domain name.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLAnchorElement.Origin
member.summary: Returns a DOMString containing the origin of the URL, that is its scheme, its domain and its port.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLAnchorElement.Pathname
member.summary: Is a DOMString representing the path name component, if any, of the referenced URL.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLAnchorElement.Port
member.summary: Is a DOMString representing the port component, if any, of the referenced URL.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLAnchorElement.Protocol
member.summary: Is a DOMString representing the protocol component, including trailing colon (':'), of the referenced URL.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLAnchorElement.Rel
member.summary: Is a DOMString that reflects the rel HTML attribute, specifying the relationship of the target object to the link object.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLAnchorElement.RelList
member.summary: Returns a DOMTokenList that reflects the rel HTML attribute, as a list of tokens.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLAnchorElement.Rev
member.summary: Is a DOMString representing that the rev HTML attribute, specifying the relationship of the link object to the target object

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLAnchorElement.Search
member.summary: Is a DOMString representing tThe search element, including leading question mark ('?'), if any, of the referenced URL.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLAnchorElement.SearchParams
member.summary: The URLUtils.searchParams property is a URLSearchParams containing the query/search parameters of the URL.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLAnchorElement.Shape

member.summary: Is a DOMString that reflects the target HTML attribute, indicating where to display the linked resource.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLAnchorElement.Text
member.summary: Is a DOMString being a synonym for the Node.textContent property.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLAnchorElement.Type
member.summary: Is a DOMString that reflects the type HTML attribute, indicating the MIME type of the linked resource.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLAnchorElement.Username

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.HTMLButtonElement
member.summary: The HTMLButtonElement interface provides properties and methods (beyond the button object interface it also has available to them by inheritance) for manipulating the layout and presentation of button elements.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLButtonElement.AutoFocus
member.summary: The control should have input focus when the page loads, unless the user overrides it, for example by typing in a different control. Only one form-associated element in a document can have this attribute specified.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLButtonElement.Disabled
member.summary: The control is disabled, meaning that it does not accept any clicks.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLButtonElement.Form
member.summary: The form that this button is associated with. If the button is a descendant of a form element, then this attribute is the ID of that form element. If the button is not a descendant of a form element, then the attribute can be the ID of any form element in the same document it is related to, or the null value if none matches.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLButtonElement.FormAction
member.summary: The URI of a resource that processes information submitted by the button. If specified, this attribute overrides the action attribute of the <form> element that owns this element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLButtonElement.FormEncType
member.summary: The type of content that is used to submit the form to the server. If specified, this attribute overrides the enctype attribute of the <form> element that owns this element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLButtonElement.FormMethod
member.summary: The HTTP method that the browser uses to submit the form. If specified, this attribute overrides the method attribute of the <form> element that owns this element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLButtonElement.FormNoValidate
member.summary: Indicates that the form is not to be validated when it is submitted. If specified, this attribute overrides the enctype attribute of the <form> element that owns this element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLButtonElement.FormTarget
member.summary: A name or keyword indicating where to display the response that is received after submitting the form. If specified, this attribute overrides the target attribute of the <form> element that owns this element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLButtonElement.Labels
member.summary: A list of <label> elements that are labels for this button.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLButtonElement.Name
member.summary: The name of the object when submitted with a form. HTML5 If specified, it must not be the empty string.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLButtonElement.Type
member.summary: Indicates the behavior of the button.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLButtonElement.ValidationMessage
member.summary: A localized message that describes the validation constraints that the control does not satisfy (if any). This attribute is the empty string if the control is not a candidate for constraint validation (willValidate is false), or it satisfies its constraints.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLButtonElement.Validity
member.summary: The validity states that this button is in.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLButtonElement.Value
member.summary: The current form control value of the button.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLButtonElement.WillValidate
member.summary: Indicates whether the button is a candidate for constraint validation. It is false if any conditions bar it from constraint validation.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement
member.summary: The HTMLInputElement interface provides special properties and methods (beyond the regular HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating the layout and presentation of input elements.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.Accept
member.summary: If the value of the type attribute is file, this attribute indicates the types of files that the server accepts; otherwise it is ignored. The value must be a comma-separated list of unique content type specifiers: A file extension starting with the STOP character (U+002E). (E.g.: ".jpg,.png,.doc") A valid MIME type with no extensions audio/* representing sound files HTML5 video/* representing video files HTML5 image/* representing image files HTML5

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.Alt
member.summary: Reflects the alt HTML attribute, containing alternative text to use when type is image.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.AutoComplete
member.summary: Reflects the autocomplete HTML attribute, indicating whether the value of the control can be automatically completed by the browser. Ignored if the value of the type attribute is hidden, checkbox, radio, file, or a button type (button, submit, reset, image).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.AutoFocus
member.summary: Reflects the autofocus HTML attribute, which specifies that a form control should have input focus when the page loads, unless the user overrides it, for example by typing in a different control. Only one form element in a document can have the autofocus attribute. It cannot be applied if the type attribute is set to hidden (that is, you cannot automatically set focus to a hidden control).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.AutoSave
member.summary: This attribute should be defined as a unique value. If the value of the type attribute is search, previous search term values will persist in the dropdown across page load.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.Checked
member.summary: The current state of the element when type is checkbox or radio.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.DefaultChecked
member.summary: The default state of a radio button or checkbox as originally specified in HTML that created this object.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.DefaultValue
member.summary: The default value as originally specified in HTML that created this object.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.Disabled
member.summary: Reflects the disabled HTML attribute, indicating that the control is not available for interaction. The input values will not be submitted with the form. See also readonly

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.Files
member.summary: A list of selected files.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.Form
member.summary: The containing form element, if this element is in a form. If this element is not contained in a form element: HTML5 this can be the id attribute of any <form> element in the same document. Even if the attribute is set on <input>, this property will be null, if it isn't the id of a <form> element. HTML 4 this must be null.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.FormAction
member.summary: Reflects the formaction HTML attribute, containing the URI of a program that processes information submitted by the element. If specified, this attribute overrides the action attribute of the <form> element that owns this element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.FormEncType
member.summary: Reflects the formenctype HTML attribute, containing the type of content that is used to submit the form to the server. If specified, this attribute overrides the enctype attribute of the <form> element that owns this element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.FormMethod
member.summary: Reflects the formmethod HTML attribute, containing the HTTP method that the browser uses to submit the form. If specified, this attribute overrides the method attribute of the <form> element that owns this element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.FormNoValidate
member.summary: Reflects the formnovalidate HTML attribute, indicating that the form is not to be validated when it is submitted. If specified, this attribute overrides the novalidate attribute of the <form> element that owns this element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.FormTarget
member.summary: Reflects the formtarget HTML attribute, containing a name or keyword indicating where to display the response that is received after submitting the form. If specified, this attribute overrides the target attribute of the form element that owns this element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.Height
member.summary: Reflects the height HTML attribute, which defines the height of the image displayed for the button, if the value of type is image.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.Indeterminate
member.summary: Indicates that a checkbox is neither on nor off.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.Labels
member.summary: A list of <label> elements that are labels for this element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.List
member.summary: Identifies a list of pre-defined options to suggest to the user. The value must be the id of a <datalist> element in the same document. The browser displays only options that are valid values for this input element. This attribute is ignored when the type attribute's value is hidden, checkbox, radio, file, or a button type.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.Max
member.summary: Reflects the max HTML attribute, containing the maximum (numeric or date-time) value for this item, which must not be less than its minimum (min attribute) value.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.MaxLength
member.summary: Reflects the maxlength HTML attribute, containing the maximum length of text (in Unicode code points) that the value can be changed to. The constraint is evaluated only when the value is changed

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.Min
member.summary: Reflects the min HTML attribute, containing the minimum (numeric or date-time) value for this item, which must not be greater than its maximum (max attribute) value.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.Multiple
member.summary: Reflects the multiple HTML attribute, indicating whether more than one value is possible (e.g., multiple files).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.Name
member.summary: Reflects the name HTML attribute, containing a name that identifies the element when submitting the form.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.Pattern
member.summary: Reflects the pattern HTML attribute, containing a regular expression that the control's value is checked against. The pattern must match the entire value, not just some subset. Use the title attribute to describe the pattern to help the user. This attribute applies when the value of the type attribute is text, search, tel, url or email; otherwise it is ignored.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.Placeholder
member.summary: Reflects the placeholder HTML attribute, containing a hint to the user of what can be entered in the control. The placeholder text must not contain carriage returns or line-feeds. This attribute applies when the value of the type attribute is text, search, tel, url or email; otherwise it is ignored.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.ReadOnly
member.summary: Reflects the readonly HTML attribute, indicating that the user cannot modify the value of the control. HTML5This is ignored if the value of the type attribute is hidden, range, color, checkbox, radio, file, or a button type.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.Required
member.summary: Reflects the required HTML attribute, indicating that the user must fill in a value before submitting a form.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.SelectionDirection
member.summary: The direction in which selection occurred. This is "forward" if selection was performed in the start-to-end direction of the current locale, or "backward" for the opposite direction. This can also be "none" if the direction is unknown."

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.SelectionEnd
member.summary: The index of the end of selected text.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.SelectionStart
member.summary: The index of the beginning of selected text. When nothing is selected, this is also the caret position inside of the input element.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.Size
member.summary: Reflects the size HTML attribute, containing size of the control. This value is in pixels unless the value of type is text or password, in which case, it is an integer number of characters. HTML5 Applies only when type is set to text, search, tel, url, email, or password; otherwise it is ignored.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.Src
member.summary: Reflects the src HTML attribute, which specifies a URI for the location of an image to display on the graphical submit button, if the value of type is image; otherwise it is ignored.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.Step
member.summary: Reflects the step HTML attribute, which works with min and max to limit the increments at which a numeric or date-time value can be set. It can be the string any or a positive floating point number. If this is not set to any, the control accepts only values at multiples of the step value greater than the minimum.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.TabIndex
member.summary: The position of the element in the tabbing navigation order for the current document.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.Type
member.summary: Reflects the type HTML attribute, indicating the type of control to display.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.UseMap
member.summary: A client-side image map.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.ValidationMessage
member.summary: A localized message that describes the validation constraints that the control does not satisfy (if any). This is the empty string if the control is not a candidate for constraint validation (willvalidate is false), or it satisfies its constraints.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.Validity
member.summary: The validity state that this element is in.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.Value
member.summary: Current value in the control.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.ValueAsDate
member.summary: The value of the element, interpreted as a date, or null if conversion is not possible.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.ValueAsNumber
member.summary: The value of the element, interpreted as one of the following in order: a time value a number null if conversion is not possible

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.Width
member.summary: Reflects the width HTML attribute, which defines the width of the image displayed for the button, if the value of type is image.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.WillValidate
member.summary: Indicates whether the element is a candidate for constraint validation. It is false if any conditions bar it from constraint validation.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.Blur
member.summary: Removes focus from input; keystrokes will subsequently go nowhere.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.CheckValidity
member.summary: Returns false if the element is a candidate for constraint validation, and it does not satisfy its constraints. In this case, it also fires an invalid event at the element. It returns true if the element is not a candidate for constraint validation, or if it satisfies its constraints.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.Click
member.summary: Simulates a click on the element.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.Focus
member.summary: Focus on input; keystrokes will subsequently go to this element.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.Select
member.summary: Selects the input text in the element, and focuses it so the user can subsequently replace the whole entry.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.SetCustomValidity(System.String)
member.summary: Sets a custom validity message for the element. If this message is not the empty string, then the element is suffering from a custom validity error, and does not validate.
member.param: The custom validity message

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.SetSelectionRange(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Selects a range of text in the element (but does not focus it). The optional selectionDirection parameter may be "forward" or "backward" to establish the direction in which selection was set, or "none" if the direction is unknown or not relevant. The default is "none". Specifying a selectionDirection parameter sets the value of the selectionDirection property.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.SetSelectionRange(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Selects a range of text in the element (but does not focus it). The optional selectionDirection parameter may be "forward" or "backward" to establish the direction in which selection was set, or "none" if the direction is unknown or not relevant. The default is "none". Specifying a selectionDirection parameter sets the value of the selectionDirection property.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.SetRangeText(System.String)
member.summary: Replaces a range of text with the new text. Supported input types: text, search, url, tel, password.

member.summary: Replaces a range of text with the new text. Supported input types: text, search, url, tel, password.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.SetRangeText(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Replaces a range of text with the new text. Supported input types: text, search, url, tel, password.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.StepDown
member.summary: Decrements the value by (step * n), where n defaults to 1 if not specified. Throws an INVALID_STATE_ERR exception: if the method is not applicable to for the current type value. if the element has no step value. if the value cannot be converted to a number. if the resulting value is above the max or below the min.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.StepDown(System.Int32)
member.summary: Decrements the value by (step * n), where n defaults to 1 if not specified. Throws an INVALID_STATE_ERR exception: if the method is not applicable to for the current type value. if the element has no step value. if the value cannot be converted to a number. if the resulting value is above the max or below the min.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.StepUp
member.summary: Increments the value by (step * n), where n defaults to 1 if not specified. Throws an INVALID_STATE_ERR exception: if the method is not applicable to for the current type value. if the element has no step value. if the value cannot be converted to a number. if the resulting value is above the max or below the min.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLInputElement.StepUp(System.Int32)
member.summary: Increments the value by (step * n), where n defaults to 1 if not specified. Throws an INVALID_STATE_ERR exception: if the method is not applicable to for the current type value. if the element has no step value. if the value cannot be converted to a number. if the resulting value is above the max or below the min.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.AutoComplete.Off
member.summary: The user must explicitly enter a value into this field for every use, or the document provides its own auto-completion method; the browser does not automatically complete the entry.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.AutoComplete.On
member.summary: The browser can automatically complete the value based on values that the user has entered during previous uses.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.ButtonType.Submit
member.summary: The button submits the form. This is the default value if the attribute is not specified, HTML5 or if it is dynamically changed to an empty or invalid value.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.ButtonType.Reset
member.summary: The button resets the form.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.ButtonType.Button
member.summary: The button does nothing.

member.summary: The button displays a menu.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.InputType
member.summary: The type of control to display.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.InputType.Button
member.summary: A push button with no default behavior.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.InputType.Checkbox
member.summary: A check box. You must use the value attribute to define the value submitted by this item. Use the checked attribute to indicate whether this item is selected. You can also use the indeterminate attribute to indicate that the checkbox is in an indeterminate state (on most platforms, this draws a horizontal line across the checkbox).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.InputType.Color
member.summary: HTML5 A control for specifying a color. A color picker's UI has no required features other than accepting simple colors as text (more info).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.InputType.Date
member.summary: HTML5 A control for entering a date (year, month, and day, with no time).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.InputType.DateTime
member.summary: HTML5 A control for entering a date and time (hour, minute, second, and fraction of a second) based on UTC time zone.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.InputType.DateTimeLocal
member.summary: HTML5 A control for entering a date and time, with no time zone.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.InputType.Email
member.summary: HTML5 A field for editing an e-mail address. The input value is validated to contain either the empty string or a single valid e-mail address before submitting. The :valid and :invalid CSS pseudo-classes are applied as appropriate.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.InputType.File
member.summary: A control that lets the user select a file. Use the accept attribute to define the types of files that the control can select.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.InputType.Hidden
member.summary: A control that is not displayed, but whose value is submitted to the server.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.InputType.Image
member.summary: A graphical submit button. You must use the src attribute to define the source of the image and the alt attribute to define alternative text. You can use the height and width attributes to define the size of the image in pixels.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.InputType.Month
member.summary: HTML5 A control for entering a month and year, with no time zone.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.InputType.Number
member.summary: HTML5 A control for entering a floating point number.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.InputType.Password
member.summary: A single-line text field whose value is obscured. Use the maxlength attribute to specify the maximum length of the value that can be entered.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.InputType.Radio
member.summary: A radio button. You must use the value attribute to define the value submitted by this item. Use the checked attribute to indicate whether this item is selected by default. Radio buttons that have the same value for the name attribute are in the same "radio button group"; only one radio button in a group can be selected at one time.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.InputType.Range
member.summary: HTML5 A control for entering a number whose exact value is not important.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.InputType.Reset
member.summary: A button that resets the contents of the form to default values.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.InputType.Search
member.summary: HTML5 A single-line text field for entering search strings; line-breaks are automatically removed from the input value.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.InputType.Submit
member.summary: A button that submits the form.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.InputType.Tel
member.summary: HTML5 A control for entering a telephone number; line-breaks are automatically removed from the input value, but no other syntax is enforced. You can use attributes such as pattern and maxlength to restrict values entered in the control. The :valid and :invalid CSS pseudo-classes are applied as appropriate.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.InputType.Text
member.summary: A single-line text field; line-breaks are automatically removed from the input value.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.InputType.Time
member.summary: HTML5 A control for entering a time value with no time zone.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.InputType.Url
member.summary: HTML5 A field for editing a URL. The input value is validated to contain either the empty string or a valid absolute URL before submitting. Line-breaks and leading or trailing whitespace are automatically removed from the input value. You can use attributes such as pattern and maxlength to restrict values entered in the control. The :valid and :invalid CSS pseudo-classes are applied as appropriate.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.InputType.Week
member.summary: HTML5 A control for entering a date consisting of a week-year number and a week number with no time zone.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTrackElement
member.summary: The HTMLTrackElement interface provides access to the properties of <track> elements, as well as methods to manipulate them. The HTML <track> element is used as a child of the media elements â <audio> and <video>. It lets you specify timed text tracks (or time-based data), for example to automaticaly handle subtitles.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTrackElement.Kind
member.summary: Reflects the kind HTML attribute, indicating how the text track is meant to be used. Possible values are: subtitles, captions, descriptions, chapters, metadata. See kind attribute documentation for details.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTrackElement.Src
member.summary: Reflects the src HTML attribute, indicating the address of the text track data.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTrackElement.SrcLang
member.summary: Reflects the srclang HTML attribute, indicating the language of the text track data.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTrackElement.Label
member.summary: Reflects the label HTML attribute, indicating a user-readable title for the track.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTrackElement.Default
member.summary: Reflects the default HTML attribute, indicating that the track is to be enabled if the user's preferences do not indicate that another track would be more appropriate.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTrackElement.ReadyState
member.summary: The readiness state of the track. NONE 0 Indicates that the text track's cues have not been obtained. LOADING 1 Indicates that the text track is loading and there have been no fatal errors encountered so far. Further cues might still be added to the track by the parser. LOADED 2 Indicates that the text track has been loaded with no fatal errors. ERROR 3 Indicates that the text track was enabled, but when the user agent attempted to obtain it, this failed in some way. Some or all of the cues are likely missing and will not be obtained.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLTrackElement.Track
member.summary: The track element's text track data.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.HTMLUListElement
member.summary: The HTMLUListElement interface provides special properties (beyond those defined on the regular HTMLElement interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating unordered list elements. The HTML unordered list element (<ul>) represents an unordered list of items, namely a collection of items that do not have a numerical ordering, and their order in the list is meaningless. Typically, unordered-list items are displayed with a bullet, which can be of several forms, like a dot, a circle or a squared. The bullet style is not defined in the HTML description of the page, but in its associated CSS, using the list-style-type property.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.HTMLUnknownElement
member.summary: The HTMLUnknownElement interface represents an invalid HTML element and derives from the HTMLElement interface, but without implementing any additional properties or methods. Obsolete or non-standard HTML elements implementing this interface: <bgsound>, <blink>, <isindex>, <multicol>, <nextid>, <rb>, <spacer>

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.HTMLCanvasElement
member.summary: The HTMLCanvasElement interface provides properties and methods for manipulating the layout and presentation of canvas elements. The HTMLCanvasElement interface also inherits the properties and methods of the HTMLElement interface. The HTML <canvas> Element can be used to draw graphics via scripting (usually JavaScript). For example, it can be used to draw graphs, make photo compositions or even perform animations. You may (and should) provide alternate content inside the <canvas> block. That content will be rendered both on older browsers that don't support canvas and in browsers with JavaScript disabled.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLCanvasElement.Height
member.summary: Reflects the height HTML attribute, specifying the height of the coordinate space in CSS pixels.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLCanvasElement.Width
member.summary: Reflects the width HTML attribute, specifying the width of the coordinate space in CSS pixels.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLCanvasElement.GetContext(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a drawing context on the canvas, or null if the context ID is not supported. A drawing context lets you draw on the canvas. Calling getContext with "2d" returns a CanvasRenderingContext2D object, whereas calling it with "experimental-webgl" (or "webgl") returns a WebGLRenderingContext object. This context is only available on browsers that implement WebGL.
member.param: The context's id
member.returns: A drawing context. A CanvasRenderingContext2D, IWebGLRenderingContext or IWebGL2RenderingContext object.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLCanvasElement.GetContext(Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasContext2DType)
member.summary: Returns CanvasRenderingContext2D drawing context on the canvas, or null if the context ID is not supported. A drawing context lets you draw on the canvas.
member.param: The context's id
member.returns: A CanvasRenderingContext2D drawing context object.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLCanvasElement.GetContext(Bridge.Html5.CanvasTypes.CanvasContextWebGLType)
member.summary: Returns WebGLRenderingContext drawing context on the canvas, or null if the context ID is not supported. A drawing context lets you draw on the canvas. This context is only available on browsers that implement WebGL (OpenGL ES 2.0).
member.param: The context's id
member.returns: A WebGLRenderingContext drawing context object.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLCanvasElement.ToDataURL
member.summary: Returns a data: URL containing a representation of the image in the format specified by type (defaults to PNG). The returned image is 96dpi. If the height or width of the canvas is 0, "data:," representing the empty string, is returned. If the type requested is not image/png, and the returned value starts with data:image/png, then the requested type is not supported. Chrome supports the image/webp type. If the requested type is image/jpeg or image/webp, then the second argument, if it is between 0.0 and 1.0, is treated as indicating image quality; if the second argument is anything else, the default value for image quality is used. Other arguments are ignored.
member.returns: URL containing a representation of the image

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.HTMLCanvasElement.ToDataURL(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a data: URL containing a representation of the image in the format specified by type (defaults to PNG). The returned image is 96dpi. If the height or width of the canvas is 0, "data:," representing the empty string, is returned. If the type requested is not image/png, and the returned value starts with data:image/png, then the requested type is not supported. Chrome supports the image/webp type. If the requested type is image/jpeg or image/webp, then the second argument, if it is between 0.0 and 1.0, is treated as indicating image quality; if the second argument is anything else, the default value for image quality is used. Other arguments are ignored.
member.param: The format. Defaults to PNG.
member.returns: URL containing a representation of the image

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.IWebGLRenderingContext
member.summary: Implement this interface to use it with canvas.GetContext()

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.HTMLVideoElement
member.summary: The HTMLVideoElement interface provides special properties and methods for manipulating video objects. It also inherits properties and methods of HTMLMediaElement and HTMLElement. The HTML <video> element is used to embed video content. It may contain several video sources, represented using the src attribute or the <source> element; the browser will choose the most suitable one. The list of supported media formats vary from one browser to the other.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLVideoElement.Height
member.summary: Reflects the height HTML attribute, which specifies the height of the display area, in CSS pixels.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLVideoElement.Poster
member.summary: Reflects the poster HTML attribute, which specifies an image to show while no video data is available.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLVideoElement.VideoHeight
member.summary: Returns an unsigned long containing the intrinsic height of the resource in CSS pixels, taking into account the dimensions, aspect ratio, clean aperture, resolution, and so forth, as defined for the format used by the resource. If the element's ready state is HAVE_NOTHING, the value is 0.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLVideoElement.VideoWidth
member.summary: Returns an unsigned long containing the intrinsic width of the resource in CSS pixels, taking into account the dimensions, aspect ratio, clean aperture, resolution, and so forth, as defined for the format used by the resource. If the element's ready state is HAVE_NOTHING, the value is 0.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.HTMLVideoElement.Width
member.summary: Reflects the width HTML attribute, which specifies the width of the display area, in CSS pixels.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.AnimationEvent
member.summary: The AnimationEvent interface represents events providing information related to animations.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.AnimationEvent.AnimationName
member.summary: Is a DOMString containing the value of the animation-name CSS property associated with the transition.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.AnimationEvent.ElapsedTime
member.summary: Is a float giving the amount of time the animation has been running, in seconds, when this event fired, excluding any time the animation was paused. For an "animationstart" event, elapsedTime is 0.0 unless there was a negative value for animation-delay, in which case the event will be fired with elapsedTime containing (-1 * delay).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.AnimationEvent.PseudoElement
member.summary: Is a DOMString, starting with '::', containing the name of the pseudo-element the animation runs on. If the animation doesn't run on a pseudo-element but on the element, an empty string: ''.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.AnimationEvent`1
member.summary: A generic version of the AnimationEvent class. The type parameter is a type of CurrentTarget.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.AnimationEvent`1.CurrentTarget
member.summary: Identifies the current target for the event, as the event traverses the DOM. It always refers to the element the event handler has been attached to as opposed to event.target which identifies the element on which the event occurred. On Internet Explorer 6 through 8, the event model is different. Event listeners are attached with the non-standard element.attachEvent method. In this model, there is no equivalent to event.currentTarget and this is the global object.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.AnimationEvent`1.Target
member.summary: This property of event objects is the object the event was dispatched on. It is different than event.currentTarget when the event handler is called in bubbling or capturing phase of the event. On IE6-8, the event model is different. Event listeners are attached with the non-standard element.attachEvent method. In this model, the event object is not passed as an argument to the event handler function but is the window.event object. This object has an srcElement property which has the same semantics than event.target.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.CompositionEvent
member.summary: The DOM CompositionEvent represents events that occur due to the user indirectly entering text.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CompositionEvent.Data
member.summary: For compositionstart events, this is the currently selected text that will be replaced by the string being composed. This value doesn't change even if content changes the selection range; rather, it indicates the string that was selected when composition started. For compositionupdate, this is the string as it stands currently as editing is ongoing. For compositionend events, this is the string as committed to the editor.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.CompositionEvent.Locale
member.summary: The locale of current input method (for example, the keyboard layout locale if the composition is associated with IME).

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.CompositionEvent`1
member.summary: A generic version of the CompositionEvent class. The type parameter is a type of CurrentTarget.

On Internet Explorer 6 through 8, the event model is different. Event listeners are attached with the non-standard element.attachEvent method. member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.Event
member.summary: The Event interface represents any event of the DOM. It contains common properties and methods to any event.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Event.Bubbles
member.summary: Indicates whether the given event bubbles up through the DOM or not. Only certain events can bubble. Events that do bubble have this property set to true. You can use this property to check if an event is allowed to bubble or not.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Event.Cancelable
member.summary: Indicates whether the event is cancelable or not. Whether an event can be canceled or not is something that's determined when that event is initialized. To cancel an event, call the preventDefault() method on the event. This keeps the implementation from executing the default action that is associated with the event.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Event.CurrentTarget
member.summary: Identifies the current target for the event, as the event traverses the DOM. It always refers to the element the event handler has been attached to as opposed to event.target which identifies the element on which the event occurred. On Internet Explorer 6 through 8, the event model is different. Event listeners are attached with the non-standard element.attachEvent method. In this model, there is no equivalent to event.currentTarget and this is the global object.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Event.DefaultPrevented
member.summary: Returns a boolean indicating whether or not event.preventDefault() was called on the event.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Event.EventPhase
member.summary: Indicates which phase of the event flow is currently being evaluated. Returns an integer value represented by 4 constants: Event.NONE = 0 Event.CAPTURING_PHASE = 1 Event.AT_TARGET = 2 Event.BUBBLING_PHASE = 3

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Event.Target
member.summary: This property of event objects is the object the event was dispatched on. It is different than event.currentTarget when the event handler is called in bubbling or capturing phase of the event. On IE6-8, the event model is different. Event listeners are attached with the non-standard element.attachEvent method. In this model, the event object is not passed as an argument to the event handler function but is the window.event object. This object has an srcElement property which has the same semantics than event.target.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Event.TimeStamp
member.summary: Returns the time (in milliseconds since the epoch) at which the event was created. This property only works if the event system supports it for the particular event.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Event.Type
member.summary: Returns a string containing the type of event.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Event.IsTrusted
member.summary: Indicates whether or not the event was initiated by the browser (after a user click for instance) or by a script (using an event creation method, like event.initEvent)

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Event.PreventDefault
member.summary: Cancels the event if it is cancelable, without stopping further propagation of the event.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Event.StopImmediatePropagation
member.summary: Prevents other listeners of the same event to be called. If several listeners are attached to the same element for the same event type, they are called in order in which they have been added. If during one such call, event.stopImmediatePropagation() is called, no remaining listeners will be called.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Event.StopPropagation
member.summary: Prevents further propagation of the current event.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.Event`1
member.summary: A generic version of the Event class. The type parameter is a type of CurrentTarget.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Event`1.CurrentTarget
member.summary: Identifies the current target for the event, as the event traverses the DOM. It always refers to the element the event handler has been attached to as opposed to event.target which identifies the element on which the event occurred. On Internet Explorer 6 through 8, the event model is different. Event listeners are attached with the non-standard element.attachEvent method. In this model, there is no equivalent to event.currentTarget and this is the global object.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.EventInit.Bubbles
member.summary: Indicates whether the given event bubbles up through the DOM or not. Only certain events can bubble. Events that do bubble have this property set to true. You can use this property to check if an event is allowed to bubble or not.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.EventInit.Cancelable
member.summary: Indicates whether the event is cancelable or not. Whether an event can be canceled or not is something that's determined when that event is initialized. To cancel an event, call the preventDefault() method on the event. This keeps the implementation from executing the default action that is associated with the event.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.EventType
member.summary: These events are defined in official Web specifications, and should be common across browsers. Each event is listed along with the interface representing the object sent to recipients of the event (so you can find information about what data is provided with each event) as well as a link to the specification or specifications that define the event.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.EventType.Abort
