member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.Selection
member.summary: Selection is the class of the object returned by window.getSelection() and other methods. It represents the text selection in the greater page, possibly spanning multiple elements, when the user drags over static text and other parts of the page. For information about text selection in an individual text editing element, see Input, TextArea and document.activeElement which typically return the parent object returned from window.getSelection().

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Selection.AnchorNode
member.summary: Returns the Node in which the selection begins.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Selection.AnchorOffset
member.summary: Returns the number of characters that the selection's anchor is offset within the anchorNode.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Selection.FocusNode
member.summary: Returns the Node in which the selection ends.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Selection.FocusOffset
member.summary: Returns a number representing the offset of the selection's anchor within the focusNode. If focusNode is a text node, this is the number of characters within focusNode preceding the focus. If focusNode is an element, this is the number of child nodes of the focusNode preceding the focus.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Selection.IsCollapsed
member.summary: Returns a Boolean indicating whether the selection's start and end points are at the same position.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Selection.RangeCount
member.summary: Returns the number of ranges in the selection.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Selection.GetRangeAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a range object representing one of the ranges currently selected.
member.param: The zero-based index of the range to return. A negative number or a number greater than or equal to rangeCount will result in an error.
member.returns: The range object that will be returned.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Selection.Collapse(Bridge.Html5.Node,System.Byte)
member.summary: Collapses the current selection to a single point. The document is not modified. If the content is focused and editable, the caret will blink there.
member.param: The caret location will be within this node.
0 - Collapses the selection from the anchor to the beginning of parentNode's text. 1 - Collapses the selection from the anchor to the end of parentNode's text.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Selection.Extend(Bridge.Html5.Node,System.Byte)
member.summary: Moves the focus of the selection to a specified point. The anchor of the selection does not move. The selection will be from the anchor to the new focus regardless of direction.
member.param: The node within which the focus will be moved.
The offset position within parentNode where the focus will be moved to.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Selection.Modify(Bridge.Html5.SelectionAlter,Bridge.Html5.SelectionDirection,Bridge.Html5.SelectionGranularity)
member.summary: Applies a change to the current selection or cursor position, using simple textual commands.
member.param: The type of change to apply. Specify "move" to move the current cursor position or "extend" to extend the current selection.

The direction in which to adjust the current selection. You can specify "forward" or "backward" to adjust in the appropriate direction based on the language at the selection point. If you want to adjust in a specific direction, you can specify "left" or "right".
The distance to adjust the current selection or cursor position.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Selection.CollapseToStart
member.summary: Collapses the selection to the start of the first range in the selection. If the content of the selection is focused and editable, the caret will blink there.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Selection.CollapseToEnd
member.summary: Collapses the selection to the end of the last range in the selection. If the content the selection is in is focused and editable, the caret will blink there.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Selection.SelectAllChildren(Bridge.Html5.Node)
member.summary: Adds all the children of the specified node to the selection. Previous selection is lost.
member.param: All children of parentNode will be selected. parentNode itself is not part of the selection.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Selection.AddRange(Bridge.Html5.Range)
member.summary: Adds a Range to a Selection.
member.param: A Range object that will be added to the Selection.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Selection.RemoveRange(Bridge.Html5.Range)
member.summary: Removes a range from the selection.
member.param: A range object that will be removed to the selection.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Selection.RemoveAllRanges
member.summary: Removes all ranges from the selection, leaving the anchorNode and focusNode properties equal to null and leaving nothing selected.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Selection.DeleteFromDocument
member.summary: Deletes the actual text being represented by a selection object from the document's DOM.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Selection.SelectionLanguageChange(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Modifies the cursor Bidi level after a change in keyboard direction.
member.param: true if the new language is right-to-left or false if the new language is left-to-right.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Selection.ContainsNode(Bridge.Html5.Node,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Indicates if the node is part of the selection.
member.param: The node that is being looked for whether it is part of the selection
When true , containsNode returns true when a part of the node is part of the selection. When false , containsNode only returns true when the entire node is part of the selection.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.SelectionAlter
member.summary: The type of selection change.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.SelectionDirection
member.summary: The direction in which to adjust the current selection.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.SelectionGranularity
member.summary: The distance to adjust the current selection or cursor position.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.TreeWalker
member.summary: The TreeWalker object represents the nodes of a document subtree and a position within them. A TreeWalker can be created using the Document.createTreeWalker() method.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TreeWalker.Root
member.summary: Returns a Node representing the root node as specified when the TreeWalker was created.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TreeWalker.WhatToShow
member.summary: Returns an unsigned long being a bitmask made of constants describing the types of Node that must to be presented. Non-matching nodes are skipped, but their children may be included, if relevant.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TreeWalker.Filter
member.summary: Returns a NodeFilter used to select the relevant nodes.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.TreeWalker.CurrentNode
member.summary: the Node on which the TreeWalker is currently pointing at.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.TreeWalker.ParentNode
member.summary: Moves the current Node to the first visible ancestor node in the document order, and returns the found node. It also moves the current node to this one. If no such node exists, or if it is before that the root node defined at the object construction, returns null and the current node is not changed.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.TreeWalker.FirstChild
member.summary: Moves the current Node to the first visible child of the current node, and returns the found child. It also moves the current node to this child. If no such child exists, returns null and the current node is not changed.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.TreeWalker.LastChild
member.summary: Moves the current Node to the last visible child of the current node, and returns the found child. It also moves the current node to this child. If no such child exists, returns null and the current node is not changed.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.TreeWalker.PreviousSibling
member.summary: Moves the current Node to its previous sibling, if any, and returns the found sibling. I there is no such node, return null and the current node is not changed.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.TreeWalker.NextSibling
member.summary: Moves the current Node to its next sibling, if any, and returns the found sibling. I there is no such node, return null and the current node is not changed.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.TreeWalker.PreviousNode
member.summary: Moves the current Node to the previous visible node in the document order, and returns the found node. It also moves the current node to this one. If no such node exists,or if it is before that the root node defined at the object construction, returns null and the current node is not changed.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.TreeWalker.NextNode
member.summary: Moves the current Node to the next visible node in the document order, and returns the found node. It also moves the current node to this one. If no such node exists, returns null and the current node is not changed.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.ArrayBuffer
member.summary: The ArrayBuffer is a data type that is used to represent a generic, fixed-length binary data buffer. You can't directly manipulate the contents of an ArrayBuffer; instead, you create an ArrayBufferView object which represents the buffer in a specific format, and use that to read and write the contents of the buffer.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.ArrayBuffer.#ctor
member.summary: The empty constuctor

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.ArrayBuffer.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: The constructor accepts as input a byte length for the new buffer, and returns the newly-created ArrayBuffer object.
member.param: The size, in bytes, of the array buffer to create.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.ArrayBuffer.ByteLength
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of the array. This is established when the array is constructed and cannot be changed. Read only.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.ArrayBuffer.Slice(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a new ArrayBuffer whose contents are a copy of this ArrayBuffer's bytes from begin, inclusive, up to end, exclusive. If either begin or end is negative, it refers to an index from the end of the array, as opposed to from the beginning.
member.param: Byte index to start slicing.
member.returns: A new ArrayBuffer object.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.ArrayBuffer.Slice(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a new ArrayBuffer whose contents are a copy of this ArrayBuffer's bytes from begin, inclusive, up to end, exclusive. If either begin or end is negative, it refers to an index from the end of the array, as opposed to from the beginning.
member.param: Byte index to start slicing.
Byte index to end slicing. If end is unspecified, the new ArrayBuffer contains all bytes from begin to the end of this ArrayBuffer.
member.returns: A new ArrayBuffer object.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.ArrayBufferView
member.summary:
ArrayBufferView is a helper type representing any of the following JavaScript TypedArray types:
Int8Array, Uint8Array, Uint8ClampedArray, Int16Array, Uint16Array, Int32Array, Uint32Array, Float32Array, Float64Array or DataView.
This is a helper type to simplify the specification, it isn't an interface and there are no objects implementing it.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.DataView
member.summary: An ArrayBuffer is a useful object for representing an arbitrary chunk of data. In many cases, such data will be read from disk or from the network, and will not follow the alignment restrictions that are imposed on the Typed Array Views described earlier. In addition, the data will often be heterogeneous in nature and have a defined byte order. The DataView view provides a low-level interface for reading such data from and writing it to an ArrayBuffer.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.DataView.#ctor(Bridge.Html5.ArrayBuffer)
member.summary: Returns a new DataView object using the passed ArrayBuffer for its storage.
member.param: An existing ArrayBuffer to use as the storage for the new DataView object.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.DataView.#ctor(Bridge.Html5.ArrayBuffer,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a new DataView object using the passed ArrayBuffer for its storage.
member.param: An existing ArrayBuffer to use as the storage for the new DataView object.
The offset, in bytes, to the first byte in the specified buffer for the new view to reference. If not specified, the view of the buffer will start with the first byte.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.DataView.#ctor(Bridge.Html5.ArrayBuffer,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a new DataView object using the passed ArrayBuffer for its storage.
member.param: An existing ArrayBuffer to use as the storage for the new DataView object.
The offset, in bytes, to the first byte in the specified buffer for the new view to reference. If not specified, the view of the buffer will start with the first byte.
The number of elements in the byte array. If unspecified, length of the view will match the buffer's length.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.DataView.Buffer
member.summary: The buffer this view references. Read only.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.DataView.ByteLength
member.summary: The length, in bytes, of the view. Read only.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.DataView.ByteOffset
member.summary: The offset, in bytes, to the first byte of the view within the ArrayBuffer. Read only.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.DataView.GetInt8(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a signed 8-bit integer at the specified byte offset from the start of the view.
member.param: The offset, in byte, from the start of the view where to read the data.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.DataView.GetUint8(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets an unsigned 8-bit integer at the specified byte offset from the start of the view.
member.param: The offset, in byte, from the start of the view where to read the data.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.DataView.GetInt16(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a signed 16-bit integer at the specified byte offset from the start of the view.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.TypedArray.Prototype`2.IndexOf(`1,Bridge.Union{System.Int32,System.UInt32})
member.summary: Returns the first (least) index of an element within the array equal to the specified value, or -1 if none is found.
member.param: Element to locate in the typed array.

The index to start the search at. If the index is greater than or equal to the typed array's length, -1 is returned, which means the typed array will not be searched. If the provided index value is a negative number, it is taken as the offset from the end of the typed array. Note: if the provided index is negative, the typed array is still searched from front to back. If the calculated index is less than 0, then the whole typed array will be searched. Default: 0 (entire typed array is searched).
member.returns: The first index at which a given element can be found in the typed array, or -1 if it is not present.
member.remarks: Most browsers do not support this yet.

member.param: Optional. Specifies a string to separate each element. The separator is converted to a string if necessary. If omitted, the typed array elements are separated with a comma (",").
member.returns: A string containing the elements, separated by "," or the specified separator.
member.remarks: Most browsers do not support this yet.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.TypedArray.Prototype`2.LastIndexOf(`1,Bridge.Union{System.Int32,System.UInt32})
member.summary: Returns the last (greatest) index of an element within the array equal to the specified value, or -1 if none is found.
member.param: Element to locate in the typed array.

The index at which to start searching backwards. Defaults to the typed array's length, i.e. the whole typed array will be searched. If the index is greater than or equal to the length of the typed array, the whole typed array will be searched. If negative, it is taken as the offset from the end of the typed array. Note that even when the index is negative, the typed array is still searched from back to front. If the calculated index is less than 0, -1 is returned, i.e. the typed array will not be searched.
member.returns: The last index at which a given element can be found in the typed array, or -1 if it is not present.
member.remarks: Most browsers do not support this yet.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.TypedArray.Prototype`2.Slice(Bridge.Union{System.Int32,System.UInt32})
member.summary: Extracts a section of an array and returns a new array.
member.param: Zero-based index at which to begin extraction. As a negative index, begin indicates an offset from the end of the sequence. slice(-2) extracts the last two elements in the sequence. If begin is omitted, slice begins from index 0.
member.returns: A shallow copy of elements from the original typed array
member.remarks: Most browsers do not support this yet.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.TypedArray.Prototype`2.Slice(Bridge.Union{System.Int32,System.UInt32},Bridge.Union{System.Int32,System.UInt32})
member.summary: Extracts a section of an array and returns a new array.
member.param: Zero-based index at which to begin extraction. As a negative index, begin indicates an offset from the end of the sequence. slice(-2) extracts the last two elements in the sequence. If begin is omitted, slice begins from index 0.

Zero-based index at which to end extraction. slice() extracts up to but not including end.slice(1,4) extracts the second element up to the fourth element (elements indexed 1, 2, and 3). As a negative index, end indicates an offset from the end of the sequence. slice(2,-1) extracts the third element through the second-to-last element in the sequence. If end is omitted, slice extracts to the end of the sequence (arr.length).
member.returns: A shallow copy of elements from the original typed array
member.remarks: Most browsers do not support this yet.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.TypedArray.Prototype`2.Sort
member.summary: Sorts the elements of an array in place and returns the array.
member.returns: Sorted TypedArray.
member.remarks: Most browsers do not support this yet.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.TypedArray.Prototype`2.Sort(System.Func{`1,`1,System.Int32})
member.summary: Sorts the elements of an array in place and returns the array.
member.remarks:
Most browsers do not support this yet.
If compareFunction is supplied, the array elements are sorted according to the return value of the compare function. If a and b are two elements being compared, then: â¢ If compareFunction(a, b) is less than 0, sort a to a lower index than b, i.e. a comes first. â¢ If compareFunction(a, b) returns 0, leave a and b unchanged with respect to each other, but sorted with respect to all different elements. Note: the ECMAscript standard does not guarantee this behaviour, and thus not all browsers (e.g. Mozilla versions dating back to at least 2003) respect this. â¢ If compareFunction(a, b) is greater than 0, sort b to a lower index than a. â¢ compareFunction(a, b) must always return the same value when given a specific pair of elements a and b as its two arguments. If inconsistent results are returned then the sort order is undefined.
member.returns: Sorted TypedArray.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.ValidityState
member.summary: The ValidityState interface represents the validity states that an element can be in, with respect to constraint validation. Together, they help explain why an element's value fails to validate, if it's not valid.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.ValidityState.CustomError
member.summary: The element's custom validity message has been set to a non-empty string by calling the element's setCustomValidity() method.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.ValidityState.PatternMismatch
member.summary: The value does not match the specified pattern.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.ValidityState.RangeOverflow
member.summary: The value is greater than the maximum specified by the max attribute.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.ValidityState.RangeUnderflow
member.summary: The value is less than the minimum specified by the min attribute.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.ValidityState.StepMismatch
member.summary: The value does not fit the rules determined by the step attribute (that is, it's not evenly divisible by the step value).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.ValidityState.TooLong
member.summary: The value exceeds the specified maxlength for HTMLInputElement or HTMLTextAreaElement objects.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.ValidityState.TypeMismatch
member.summary: The value is not in the required syntax (when type is email or url).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.ValidityState.Valid
member.summary: The element meets all constraint validations, and is therefore considered to be valid.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.ValidityState.ValueMissing
member.summary: The element has a required attribute, but no value.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.Global
member.summary: The global object represents an object ontaining a DOM document;

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.Closed
member.summary: This read-only property indicates whether the referenced window is closed or not.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.DialogArguments
member.summary: Gets the arguments passed to the window (if it's a dialog box) at the time window.showModalDialog() was called.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.Document
member.summary: Returns a reference to the document that the window contains.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.FrameElement
member.summary: Returns the element (such as <iframe> or <object>) in which the window is embedded, or null if the window is top-level.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.Frames
member.summary: Returns the window itself, which is an array-like object, listing the direct sub-frames of the current window.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.History
member.summary: Returns a reference to the history objectt, which provides an interface for manipulating the browser session history (pages visited in the tab or frame that the current page is loaded in).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.InnerHeight
member.summary: Height (in pixels) of the browser window viewport including, if rendered, the horizontal scrollbar.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.InnerWidth
member.summary: Width (in pixels) of the browser window viewport including, if rendered, the vertical scrollbar.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.Length
member.summary: Returns the number of frames in the window.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.Location
member.summary: The Window.location read-only property returns a Location object with information about the current location of the document.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.Locationbar
member.summary: Returns the locationbar object, whose visibility can be checked.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.LocalStorage
member.summary: Returns a reference to the local storage object used to store data that may only be accessed by the origin that created it.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.Menubar
member.summary: Returns the menubar object, whose visibility can be toggled in the window.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.Name
member.summary: Gets/sets the name of the window. The name of the window is used primarily for setting targets for hyperlinks and forms. Windows do not need to have names.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.Navigator
member.summary: The Window.navigator read-only property returns a reference to the Navigator object, which can be queried for information about the application running the script.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.Opener
member.summary: Returns a reference to the window that opened this current window.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.OuterHeight
member.summary: Gets the height of the outside of the browser window.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.OuterWidth
member.summary: Gets the width of the outside of the browser window.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.PageXOffset
member.summary: An alias for window.scrollX.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.PageYOffset
member.summary: An alias for window.scrollY.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.Parent
member.summary: Returns a reference to the parent of the current window or subframe.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.Performance
member.summary: Provides a hosting area for performance related attributes.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.ReturnValue
member.summary: The return value to be returned to the function that called window.showModalDialog() to display the window as a modal dialog.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.Screen
member.summary: Returns a reference to the screen object associated with the window. The screen object is a special object for inspecting properties of the screen on which the current window is being rendered.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.ScreenX
member.summary: Returns the horizontal distance of the left border of the user's browser from the left side of the screen.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.ScreenY
member.summary: Returns the vertical distance of the top border of the user's browser from the top side of the screen.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.Scrollbars
member.summary: Returns the scrollbars object, whose visibility can be toggled in the window.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.ScrollX
member.summary: Returns the number of pixels that the document has already been scrolled horizontally.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.ScrollY
member.summary: Returns the number of pixels that the document has already been scrolled vertically.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.Self
member.summary: Returns an object reference to the window object itself.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.SessionStorage
member.summary: A storage object for storing data within a single page session.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.Status
member.summary: Gets/sets the text in the statusbar at the bottom of the browser.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.Statusbar
member.summary: Returns the statusbar object, whose visibility can be toggled in the window.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Global.Top
member.summary: Returns a reference to the topmost window in the window hierarchy. This property is read only.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.AddEventListener(System.String,System.Delegate)
member.summary: The method registers the specified listener on the EventTarget it's called on. The event target may be an Element in a document, the Document itself, a Window, or any other object that supports events.
member.param: A string representing the event type to listen for.
The object that receives a notification when an event of the specified type occurs. This must be an object implementing the EventListener interface, or simply a JavaScript function.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.Alert
member.summary: The Window.alert() method displays an alert dialog with the optional specified content and an OK button.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.Alert(System.String)
member.summary: The Window.alert() method displays an alert dialog with the optional specified content and an OK button.
member.param: message is an optional string of text you want to display in the alert dialog, or, alternatively, an object that is converted into a string and displayed.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.Atob(System.String)
member.summary: The Window.atob()decodes a string of data which has been encoded using base-64 encoding. You can use the window.btoa() method to encode and transmit data which may otherwise cause communication problems, then transmit it and use the window.atob() method to decode the data again. For example, you can encode, transmit, and decode control characters such as ASCII values 0 through 31.
member.param: encoded string

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.Back
member.summary: Returns the window to the previous item in the history.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.Blur
member.summary: Shifts focus away from the window.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.Btoa(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a base-64 encoded ASCII string from a "string" of binary data. You can use this method to encode data which may otherwise cause communication problems, transmit it, then use the window.atob method to decode the data again. For example, you can encode control characters such as ASCII values 0 through 31.
member.param: String to encode

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.CancelAnimationFrame(System.Int32)
member.summary: Cancels an animation frame request previously scheduled through a call to window.requestAnimationFrame().
member.param: The ID value returned by the call to window.requestAnimationFrame() that requested the callback.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.ClearInterval(System.Int32)
member.summary: Cancels repeated action which was set up using setInterval.
member.param: intervalID is the identifier of the repeated action you want to cancel. This ID is returned from setInterval().

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.ClearTimeout(System.Int32)
member.summary: Clears the delay set by window.setTimeout().
member.param: timeoutID is the ID of the timeout you wish to clear, as returned by window.setTimeout().

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.Close
member.summary: Closes the current window, or a referenced window. This method is only allowed to be called for windows that were opened by a script using the window.open method. If the window was not opened by a script, the following error appears in the JavaScript Console: Scripts may not close windows that were not opened by script.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.Confirm
member.summary: The Window.confirm() method displays a modal dialog with an optional message and two buttons, OK and Cancel.
member.returns: result is a boolean value indicating whether OK or Cancel was selected (true means OK).

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.Confirm(System.String)
member.summary: The Window.confirm() method displays a modal dialog with an optional message and two buttons, OK and Cancel.
member.param: message is the optional string to be displayed in the dialog.
member.returns: result is a boolean value indicating whether OK or Cancel was selected (true means OK).

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.DispatchEvent(Bridge.Html5.Event)
member.summary: Dispatches the specified event to the current element. To create an event object use the createEvent method in Firefox, Opera, Google Chrome, Safari and Internet Explorer from version 9. After the new event is created, initialize it first (for details, see the page for the createEvent method). When the event is initialized, it is ready for dispatching.
member.param: Required. Reference to an event object to be dispatched.
member.returns: Boolean that indicates whether the default action of the event was not canceled.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.Dump(System.String)
member.summary: Prints messages to the (native) console.
member.param: message is the string message to log.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.Focus
member.summary: Makes a request to bring the window to the front. It may fail due to user settings and the window isn't guaranteed to be frontmost before this method returns.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.Forward
member.summary: Moves the window one document forward in the history.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.GetComputedStyle(Bridge.Html5.HTMLElement)
member.summary: The Window.getComputedStyle() method gives the values of all the CSS properties of an element after applying the active stylesheets and resolving any basic computation those values may contain
member.param: The Element for which to get the computed style.
member.returns: The returned style is a CSSStyleDeclaration object.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.GetComputedStyle(Bridge.Html5.HTMLElement,System.String)
member.summary: The Window.getComputedStyle() method gives the values of all the CSS properties of an element after applying the active stylesheets and resolving any basic computation those values may contain
member.param: The Element for which to get the computed style.
A string specifying the pseudo-element to match. Must be omitted (or null) for regular elements.
member.returns: The returned style is a CSSStyleDeclaration object.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.GetDefaultComputedStyle(Bridge.Html5.HTMLElement)
member.summary: getDefaultComputedStyle() gives the default computed values of all the CSS properties of an element, ignoring author styling. That is, only user-agent and user styles are taken into account.
member.param: The Element for which to get the computed style.
member.returns: The returned style is a CSSStyleDeclaration object.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.GetDefaultComputedStyle(Bridge.Html5.HTMLElement,System.String)
member.summary: getDefaultComputedStyle() gives the default computed values of all the CSS properties of an element, ignoring author styling. That is, only user-agent and user styles are taken into account.
member.param: The Element for which to get the computed style.
A string specifying the pseudo-element to match. Must be null (or not specified) for regular elements.
member.returns: The returned style is a CSSStyleDeclaration object.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.GetSelection
member.summary: Returns a selection object representing the range of text selected by the user.
member.returns: selection is a Selection object. When cast to string, either by adding empty quotes "" or using .toString, this object is the text selected.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.Home
member.summary: Returns the window to the home page.

member.summary: Returns a new MediaQueryList object representing the parsed results of the specified media query string.
member.param: string representing the media query for which to return a new MediaQueryList object.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.MoveBy(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the current window by a specified amount.
member.param: the amount of pixels to move the window horizontally.
the amount of pixels to move the window vertically.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.RequestAnimationFrame(System.Delegate)
member.summary: The window.requestAnimationFrame() method tells the browser that you wish to perform an animation and requests that the browser call a specified function to update an animation before the next repaint. The method takes as an argument a callback to be invoked before the repaint.
member.param: A parameter specifying a function to call when it's time to update your animation for the next repaint. The callback has one single argument, a DOMHighResTimeStamp, which indicates the current time for when requestAnimationFrame starts to fire callbacks.
member.returns: requestID is a long integer value that uniquely identifies the entry in the callback list. This is a non-zero value, but you may not make any other assumptions about its value. You can pass this value to window.cancelAnimationFrame() to cancel the refresh callback request.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.RequestAnimationFrame(System.Action{System.Double})
member.summary: The window.requestAnimationFrame() method tells the browser that you wish to perform an animation and requests that the browser call a specified function to update an animation before the next repaint. The method takes as an argument a callback to be invoked before the repaint.
member.param: A parameter specifying a function to call when it's time to update your animation for the next repaint. The callback has one single argument, a DOMHighResTimeStamp, which indicates the current time for when requestAnimationFrame starts to fire callbacks.
member.returns: requestID is a long integer value that uniquely identifies the entry in the callback list. This is a non-zero value, but you may not make any other assumptions about its value. You can pass this value to window.cancelAnimationFrame() to cancel the refresh callback request.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.Open
member.summary: The URL to be loaded in the newly opened window. strUrl can be an HTML document on the web, image file or any resource supported by the browser.
member.returns: A reference to the newly created window. If the call failed, it will be null. The reference can be used to access properties and methods of the new window provided it complies with Same origin policy security requirements.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.Open(System.String)
member.summary: The URL to be loaded in the newly opened window. strUrl can be an HTML document on the web, image file or any resource supported by the browser.
member.param: The URL to be loaded in the newly opened window. strUrl can be an HTML document on the web, image file or any resource supported by the browser.
member.returns: A reference to the newly created window. If the call failed, it will be null. The reference can be used to access properties and methods of the new window provided it complies with Same origin policy security requirements.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.Open(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The URL to be loaded in the newly opened window. strUrl can be an HTML document on the web, image file or any resource supported by the browser.
member.param: The URL to be loaded in the newly opened window. strUrl can be an HTML document on the web, image file or any resource supported by the browser.

A string name for the new window. The name can be used as the target of links and forms using the target attribute of an <a> or <form> element. The name should not contain any blank space. Note that strWindowName does not specify the title of the new window.
member.returns: A reference to the newly created window. If the call failed, it will be null. The reference can be used to access properties and methods of the new window provided it complies with Same origin policy security requirements.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.Open(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The URL to be loaded in the newly opened window. strUrl can be an HTML document on the web, image file or any resource supported by the browser.
member.param: The URL to be loaded in the newly opened window. strUrl can be an HTML document on the web, image file or any resource supported by the browser.

A string name for the new window. The name can be used as the target of links and forms using the target attribute of an <a> or <form> element. The name should not contain any blank space. Note that strWindowName does not specify the title of the new window.
Optional parameter listing the features (size, position, scrollbars, etc.) of the new window. The string must not contain any blank space, each feature name and value must be separated by a comma.
member.returns: A reference to the newly created window. If the call failed, it will be null. The reference can be used to access properties and methods of the new window provided it complies with Same origin policy security requirements.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.OpenDialog
member.summary: window.openDialog is an extension to window.open. It behaves the same, except that it can optionally take one or more parameters past windowFeatures, and windowFeatures itself is treated a little differently.
member.returns: A reference to the newly created window. If the call failed, it will be null. The reference can be used to access properties and methods of the new window provided it complies with Same origin policy security requirements.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.OpenDialog(System.String)
member.summary: window.openDialog is an extension to window.open. It behaves the same, except that it can optionally take one or more parameters past windowFeatures, and windowFeatures itself is treated a little differently.
member.param: The URL to be loaded in the newly opened window. strUrl can be an HTML document on the web, image file or any resource supported by the browser.
member.returns: A reference to the newly created window. If the call failed, it will be null. The reference can be used to access properties and methods of the new window provided it complies with Same origin policy security requirements.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.OpenDialog(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: window.openDialog is an extension to window.open. It behaves the same, except that it can optionally take one or more parameters past windowFeatures, and windowFeatures itself is treated a little differently.
member.param: The URL to be loaded in the newly opened window. strUrl can be an HTML document on the web, image file or any resource supported by the browser.

A string name for the new window. The name can be used as the target of links and forms using the target attribute of an <a> or <form> element. The name should not contain any blank space. Note that strWindowName does not specify the title of the new window.
member.returns: A reference to the newly created window. If the call failed, it will be null. The reference can be used to access properties and methods of the new window provided it complies with Same origin policy security requirements.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.OpenDialog(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: window.openDialog is an extension to window.open. It behaves the same, except that it can optionally take one or more parameters past windowFeatures, and windowFeatures itself is treated a little differently.
member.param: The URL to be loaded in the newly opened window. strUrl can be an HTML document on the web, image file or any resource supported by the browser.

A string name for the new window. The name can be used as the target of links and forms using the target attribute of an <a> or <form> element. The name should not contain any blank space. Note that strWindowName does not specify the title of the new window.
Optional parameter listing the features (size, position, scrollbars, etc.) of the new window. The string must not contain any blank space, each feature name and value must be separated by a comma.
member.returns: A reference to the newly created window. If the call failed, it will be null. The reference can be used to access properties and methods of the new window provided it complies with Same origin policy security requirements.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Global.OpenDialog(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Object[])

Optional parameter listing the features (size, position, scrollbars, etc.) of the new window. The string must not contain any blank space, each feature name and value must be separated by a comma.

This string is used to indicate sub-protocol, so that a single server can implement multiple WebSocket sub-protocols (for example, you might want one server to be able to handle different types of interactions depending on the specified protocol).

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.WebSocket.#ctor(System.String,System.String[])
member.param: The URL to which to connect; this should be the URL to which the WebSocket server will respond.

These strings are used to indicate sub-protocols, so that a single server can implement multiple WebSocket sub-protocols (for example, you might want one server to be able to handle different types of interactions depending on the specified protocol).

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.WebSocket.Close
member.summary: Closes the WebSocket connection or connection attempt, if any. If the connection is already closed, this method does nothing.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.WebSocket.Close(Bridge.Html5.CloseEvent.StatusCode)
member.summary: Closes the WebSocket connection or connection attempt, if any. If the connection is already closed, this method does nothing.
member.param: A numeric value indicating the status code explaining why the connection is being closed.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.WebSocket.Close(Bridge.Html5.CloseEvent.StatusCode,System.String)
member.summary: Closes the WebSocket connection or connection attempt, if any. If the connection is already closed, this method does nothing.
member.param: A numeric value indicating the status code explaining why the connection is being closed.
A human-readable string explaining why the connection is closing. This string must be no longer than 123 bytes of UTF-8 text (not characters).

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.WebSocket.Send(System.String)
member.summary: Transmits data to the server over the WebSocket connection.
member.param: A text string to send to the server.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.WebSocket.Send(Bridge.Html5.Blob)
member.summary: Transmits data to the server over the WebSocket connection.
member.param: A Blob to send to the server.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.WebSocket.Send(Bridge.Html5.ArrayBuffer)
member.summary: Transmits data to the server over the WebSocket connection.
member.param: An ArrayBuffer to send to the server.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.Window
member.summary: The window object represents a window containing a DOM document; the document property points to the DOM document loaded in that window.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.Closed
member.summary: This read-only property indicates whether the referenced window is closed or not.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.DialogArguments
member.summary: Gets the arguments passed to the window (if it's a dialog box) at the time window.showModalDialog() was called.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.Document
member.summary: Returns a reference to the document that the window contains.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.FrameElement
member.summary: Returns the element (such as <iframe> or <object>) in which the window is embedded, or null if the window is top-level.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.Frames
member.summary: Returns the window itself, which is an array-like object, listing the direct sub-frames of the current window.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.History
member.summary: Returns a reference to the history objectt, which provides an interface for manipulating the browser session history (pages visited in the tab or frame that the current page is loaded in).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.InnerHeight
member.summary: Height (in pixels) of the browser window viewport including, if rendered, the horizontal scrollbar.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.InnerWidth
member.summary: Width (in pixels) of the browser window viewport including, if rendered, the vertical scrollbar.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.Length
member.summary: Returns the number of frames in the window.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.Location
member.summary: The Window.location read-only property returns a Location object with information about the current location of the document.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.Locationbar
member.summary: Returns the locationbar object, whose visibility can be checked.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.LocalStorage
member.summary: Returns a reference to the local storage object used to store data that may only be accessed by the origin that created it.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.Menubar
member.summary: Returns the menubar object, whose visibility can be toggled in the window.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.Name
member.summary: Gets/sets the name of the window. The name of the window is used primarily for setting targets for hyperlinks and forms. Windows do not need to have names.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.Navigator
member.summary: The Window.navigator read-only property returns a reference to the Navigator object, which can be queried for information about the application running the script.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.Opener
member.summary: Returns a reference to the window that opened this current window.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.OuterHeight
member.summary: Gets the height of the outside of the browser window.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.OuterWidth
member.summary: Gets the width of the outside of the browser window.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.PageXOffset
member.summary: An alias for window.scrollX.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.PageYOffset
member.summary: An alias for window.scrollY.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.Parent
member.summary: Returns a reference to the parent of the current window or subframe.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.Performance
member.summary: Provides a hosting area for performance related attributes.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.ReturnValue
member.summary: The return value to be returned to the function that called window.showModalDialog() to display the window as a modal dialog.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.Screen
member.summary: Returns a reference to the screen object associated with the window. The screen object is a special object for inspecting properties of the screen on which the current window is being rendered.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.ScreenX
member.summary: Returns the horizontal distance of the left border of the user's browser from the left side of the screen.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.ScreenY
member.summary: Returns the vertical distance of the top border of the user's browser from the top side of the screen.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.Scrollbars
member.summary: Returns the scrollbars object, whose visibility can be toggled in the window.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.ScrollX
member.summary: Returns the number of pixels that the document has already been scrolled horizontally.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.ScrollY
member.summary: Returns the number of pixels that the document has already been scrolled vertically.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.Self
member.summary: Returns an object reference to the window object itself.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.SessionStorage
member.summary: A storage object for storing data within a single page session.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.Status
member.summary: Gets/sets the text in the statusbar at the bottom of the browser.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.Statusbar
member.summary: Returns the statusbar object, whose visibility can be toggled in the window.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.Window.Top
member.summary: Returns a reference to the topmost window in the window hierarchy. This property is read only.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Window.AddEventListener(System.String,System.Delegate)
member.summary: The method registers the specified listener on the EventTarget it's called on. The event target may be an Element in a document, the Document itself, a Window, or any other object that supports events.
member.param: A string representing the event type to listen for.
The object that receives a notification when an event of the specified type occurs. This must be an object implementing the EventListener interface, or simply a JavaScript function.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Window.Alert
member.summary: The Window.alert() method displays an alert dialog with the optional specified content and an OK button.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Window.Alert(System.String)
member.summary: The Window.alert() method displays an alert dialog with the optional specified content and an OK button.
member.param: message is an optional string of text you want to display in the alert dialog, or, alternatively, an object that is converted into a string and displayed.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Window.Atob(System.String)
member.summary: The Window.atob()decodes a string of data which has been encoded using base-64 encoding. You can use the window.btoa() method to encode and transmit data which may otherwise cause communication problems, then transmit it and use the window.atob() method to decode the data again. For example, you can encode, transmit, and decode control characters such as ASCII values 0 through 31.
member.param: encoded string

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Window.Back
member.summary: Returns the window to the previous item in the history.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Window.Blur
member.summary: Shifts focus away from the window.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Window.Btoa(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a base-64 encoded ASCII string from a "string" of binary data. You can use this method to encode data which may otherwise cause communication problems, transmit it, then use the window.atob method to decode the data again. For example, you can encode control characters such as ASCII values 0 through 31.
member.param: String to encode

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Window.CancelAnimationFrame(System.Int32)
member.summary: Cancels an animation frame request previously scheduled through a call to window.requestAnimationFrame().
member.param: The ID value returned by the call to window.requestAnimationFrame() that requested the callback.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Window.ClearInterval(System.Int32)
member.summary: Cancels repeated action which was set up using setInterval.
member.param: intervalID is the identifier of the repeated action you want to cancel. This ID is returned from setInterval().

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Window.ClearTimeout(System.Int32)
member.summary: Clears the delay set by window.setTimeout().
member.param: timeoutID is the ID of the timeout you wish to clear, as returned by window.setTimeout().

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Window.Close
member.summary: Closes the current window, or a referenced window. This method is only allowed to be called for windows that were opened by a script using the window.open method. If the window was not opened by a script, the following error appears in the JavaScript Console: Scripts may not close windows that were not opened by script.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Window.Confirm
member.summary: The Window.confirm() method displays a modal dialog with an optional message and two buttons, OK and Cancel.
member.returns: result is a boolean value indicating whether OK or Cancel was selected (true means OK).

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Window.Confirm(System.String)
member.summary: The Window.confirm() method displays a modal dialog with an optional message and two buttons, OK and Cancel.
member.param: message is the optional string to be displayed in the dialog.
member.returns: result is a boolean value indicating whether OK or Cancel was selected (true means OK).

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Window.DispatchEvent(Bridge.Html5.Event)
member.summary: Dispatches the specified event to the current element. To create an event object use the createEvent method in Firefox, Opera, Google Chrome, Safari and Internet Explorer from version 9. After the new event is created, initialize it first (for details, see the page for the createEvent method). When the event is initialized, it is ready for dispatching.
member.param: Required. Reference to an event object to be dispatched.
member.returns: Boolean that indicates whether the default action of the event was not canceled.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Window.Dump(System.String)
member.summary: Prints messages to the (native) console.
member.param: message is the string message to log.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Window.Focus
member.summary: Makes a request to bring the window to the front. It may fail due to user settings and the window isn't guaranteed to be frontmost before this method returns.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Window.Forward
member.summary: Moves the window one document forward in the history.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Window.GetComputedStyle(Bridge.Html5.HTMLElement)
member.summary: The Window.getComputedStyle() method gives the values of all the CSS properties of an element after applying the active stylesheets and resolving any basic computation those values may contain
member.param: The Element for which to get the computed style.
member.returns: The returned style is a CSSStyleDeclaration object.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Window.GetComputedStyle(Bridge.Html5.HTMLElement,System.String)
member.summary: The Window.getComputedStyle() method gives the values of all the CSS properties of an element after applying the active stylesheets and resolving any basic computation those values may contain
member.param: The Element for which to get the computed style.
A string specifying the pseudo-element to match. Must be omitted (or null) for regular elements.
member.returns: The returned style is a CSSStyleDeclaration object.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Window.GetDefaultComputedStyle(Bridge.Html5.HTMLElement)
member.summary: getDefaultComputedStyle() gives the default computed values of all the CSS properties of an element, ignoring author styling. That is, only user-agent and user styles are taken into account.
member.param: The Element for which to get the computed style.
member.returns: The returned style is a CSSStyleDeclaration object.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Window.GetDefaultComputedStyle(Bridge.Html5.HTMLElement,System.String)

member.param: The Element for which to get the computed style.
A string specifying the pseudo-element to match. Must be null (or not specified) for regular elements.
member.returns: The returned style is a CSSStyleDeclaration object.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Window.GetSelection

member.returns: selection is a Selection object. When cast to string, either by adding empty quotes "" or using .toString, this object is the text selected.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Window.Home
member.summary: Returns the window to the home page.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Window.MoveBy(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the current window by a specified amount.
member.param: the amount of pixels to move the window horizontally.
the amount of pixels to move the window vertically.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Window.RequestAnimationFrame(System.Delegate)
member.summary: The window.requestAnimationFrame() method tells the browser that you wish to perform an animation and requests that the browser call a specified function to update an animation before the next repaint. The method takes as an argument a callback to be invoked before the repaint.
member.param: A parameter specifying a function to call when it's time to update your animation for the next repaint. The callback has one single argument, a DOMHighResTimeStamp, which indicates the current time for when requestAnimationFrame starts to fire callbacks.
member.returns: requestID is an integer value that uniquely identifies the entry in the callback list. This is a non-zero value, but you may not make any other assumptions about its value. You can pass this value to window.cancelAnimationFrame() to cancel the refresh callback request.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Window.RequestAnimationFrame(System.Action{System.Double})
member.summary: The window.requestAnimationFrame() method tells the browser that you wish to perform an animation and requests that the browser call a specified function to update an animation before the next repaint. The method takes as an argument a callback to be invoked before the repaint.
member.param: A parameter specifying a function to call when it's time to update your animation for the next repaint. The callback has one single argument, a DOMHighResTimeStamp, which indicates the current time for when requestAnimationFrame starts to fire callbacks.
member.returns: requestID is an integer value that uniquely identifies the entry in the callback list. This is a non-zero value, but you may not make any other assumptions about its value. You can pass this value to window.cancelAnimationFrame() to cancel the refresh callback request.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Window.RequestAnimationFrame(System.Action)
member.summary: The window.requestAnimationFrame() method tells the browser that you wish to perform an animation and requests that the browser call a specified function to update an animation before the next repaint. The method takes as an argument a callback to be invoked before the repaint.
member.param: A parameter specifying a function to call when it's time to update your animation for the next repaint. The callback has one single argument, a DOMHighResTimeStamp, which indicates the current time for when requestAnimationFrame starts to fire callbacks.
member.returns: requestID is a int integer value that uniquely identifies the entry in the callback list. This is a non-zero value, but you may not make any other assumptions about its value. You can pass this value to window.cancelAnimationFrame() to cancel the refresh callback request.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Window.Open
member.summary: The URL to be loaded in the newly opened window. strUrl can be an HTML document on the web, image file or any resource supported by the browser.
member.returns: A reference to the newly created window. If the call failed, it will be null. The reference can be used to access properties and methods of the new window provided it complies with Same origin policy security requirements.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Window.Open(System.String)
member.summary: The URL to be loaded in the newly opened window. strUrl can be an HTML document on the web, image file or any resource supported by the browser.
member.param: The URL to be loaded in the newly opened window. strUrl can be an HTML document on the web, image file or any resource supported by the browser.
member.returns: A reference to the newly created window. If the call failed, it will be null. The reference can be used to access properties and methods of the new window provided it complies with Same origin policy security requirements.

member.summary: The URL to be loaded in the newly opened window. strUrl can be an HTML document on the web, image file or any resource supported by the browser.
member.param: The URL to be loaded in the newly opened window. strUrl can be an HTML document on the web, image file or any resource supported by the browser.

A string name for the new window. The name can be used as the target of links and forms using the target attribute of an <a> or <form> element. The name should not contain any blank space. Note that strWindowName does not specify the title of the new window.
member.returns: A reference to the newly created window. If the call failed, it will be null. The reference can be used to access properties and methods of the new window provided it complies with Same origin policy security requirements.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Window.Open(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The URL to be loaded in the newly opened window. strUrl can be an HTML document on the web, image file or any resource supported by the browser.
member.param: The URL to be loaded in the newly opened window. strUrl can be an HTML document on the web, image file or any resource supported by the browser.

A string name for the new window. The name can be used as the target of links and forms using the target attribute of an <a> or <form> element. The name should not contain any blank space. Note that strWindowName does not specify the title of the new window.
Optional parameter listing the features (size, position, scrollbars, etc.) of the new window. The string must not contain any blank space, each feature name and value must be separated by a comma.
member.returns: A reference to the newly created window. If the call failed, it will be null. The reference can be used to access properties and methods of the new window provided it complies with Same origin policy security requirements.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Window.OpenDialog
member.summary: window.openDialog is an extension to window.open. It behaves the same, except that it can optionally take one or more parameters past windowFeatures, and windowFeatures itself is treated a little differently.
member.returns: A reference to the newly created window. If the call failed, it will be null. The reference can be used to access properties and methods of the new window provided it complies with Same origin policy security requirements.

member.param: The value to be tested.

member.summary: The encodeURI() method encodes a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) by replacing each instance of certain characters by one, two, three, or four escape sequences representing the UTF-8 encoding of the character (will only be four escape sequences for characters composed of two "surrogate" characters).
member.param: A complete Uniform Resource Identifier.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.Window.EncodeURIComponent(System.String)
member.summary: The encodeURIComponent() method encodes a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) component by replacing each instance of certain characters by one, two, three, or four escape sequences representing the UTF-8 encoding of the character (will only be four escape sequences for characters composed of two "surrogate" characters).
member.param: A component of a URI.

member.name: T:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance
member.summary: The window object represents a window containing a DOM document; the document property points to the DOM document loaded in that window.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.Closed
member.summary: This read-only property indicates whether the referenced window is closed or not.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.DialogArguments
member.summary: Gets the arguments passed to the window (if it's a dialog box) at the time window.showModalDialog() was called.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.Document
member.summary: Returns a reference to the document that the window contains.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.FrameElement
member.summary: Returns the element (such as <iframe> or <object>) in which the window is embedded, or null if the window is top-level.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.Frames
member.summary: Returns the window itself, which is an array-like object, listing the direct sub-frames of the current window.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.History
member.summary: Returns a reference to the history objectt, which provides an interface for manipulating the browser session history (pages visited in the tab or frame that the current page is loaded in).

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.InnerHeight
member.summary: Height (in pixels) of the browser window viewport including, if rendered, the horizontal scrollbar.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.InnerWidth
member.summary: Width (in pixels) of the browser window viewport including, if rendered, the vertical scrollbar.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.Length
member.summary: Returns the number of frames in the window.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.Location
member.summary: The Window.location read-only property returns a Location object with information about the current location of the document.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.Locationbar
member.summary: Returns the locationbar object, whose visibility can be checked.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.LocalStorage
member.summary: Returns a reference to the local storage object used to store data that may only be accessed by the origin that created it.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.Menubar
member.summary: Returns the menubar object, whose visibility can be toggled in the window.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.Name
member.summary: Gets/sets the name of the window. The name of the window is used primarily for setting targets for hyperlinks and forms. Windows do not need to have names.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.Navigator
member.summary: The Window.navigator read-only property returns a reference to the Navigator object, which can be queried for information about the application running the script.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.Opener
member.summary: Returns a reference to the window that opened this current window.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.OuterHeight
member.summary: Gets the height of the outside of the browser window.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.OuterWidth
member.summary: Gets the width of the outside of the browser window.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.PageXOffset
member.summary: An alias for window.scrollX.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.PageYOffset
member.summary: An alias for window.scrollY.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.Parent
member.summary: Returns a reference to the parent of the current window or subframe.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.Performance
member.summary: Provides a hosting area for performance related attributes.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.ReturnValue
member.summary: The return value to be returned to the function that called window.showModalDialog() to display the window as a modal dialog.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.Screen
member.summary: Returns a reference to the screen object associated with the window. The screen object is a special object for inspecting properties of the screen on which the current window is being rendered.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.ScreenX
member.summary: Returns the horizontal distance of the left border of the user's browser from the left side of the screen.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.ScreenY
member.summary: Returns the vertical distance of the top border of the user's browser from the top side of the screen.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.Scrollbars
member.summary: Returns the scrollbars object, whose visibility can be toggled in the window.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.ScrollX
member.summary: Returns the number of pixels that the document has already been scrolled horizontally.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.ScrollY
member.summary: Returns the number of pixels that the document has already been scrolled vertically.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.Self
member.summary: Returns an object reference to the window object itself.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.SessionStorage
member.summary: A storage object for storing data within a single page session.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.Status
member.summary: Gets/sets the text in the statusbar at the bottom of the browser.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.Statusbar
member.summary: Returns the statusbar object, whose visibility can be toggled in the window.

member.name: F:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.Top
member.summary: Returns a reference to the topmost window in the window hierarchy. This property is read only.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.AddEventListener(System.String,System.Delegate)
member.summary: The method registers the specified listener on the EventTarget it's called on. The event target may be an Element in a document, the Document itself, a Window, or any other object that supports events.
member.param: A string representing the event type to listen for.
The object that receives a notification when an event of the specified type occurs. This must be an object implementing the EventListener interface, or simply a JavaScript function.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.Alert(System.String)
member.summary: The Window.alert() method displays an alert dialog with the optional specified content and an OK button.
member.param: message is an optional string of text you want to display in the alert dialog, or, alternatively, an object that is converted into a string and displayed.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.Atob(System.String)
member.summary: The Window.atob()decodes a string of data which has been encoded using base-64 encoding. You can use the window.btoa() method to encode and transmit data which may otherwise cause communication problems, then transmit it and use the window.atob() method to decode the data again. For example, you can encode, transmit, and decode control characters such as ASCII values 0 through 31.
member.param: encoded string

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.Back
member.summary: Returns the window to the previous item in the history.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.Blur
member.summary: Shifts focus away from the window.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.Btoa(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a base-64 encoded ASCII string from a "string" of binary data. You can use this method to encode data which may otherwise cause communication problems, transmit it, then use the window.atob method to decode the data again. For example, you can encode control characters such as ASCII values 0 through 31.
member.param: String to encode

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.CancelAnimationFrame(System.Int32)
member.summary: Cancels an animation frame request previously scheduled through a call to window.requestAnimationFrame().
member.param: The ID value returned by the call to window.requestAnimationFrame() that requested the callback.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.ClearInterval(System.Int32)
member.summary: Cancels repeated action which was set up using setInterval.
member.param: intervalID is the identifier of the repeated action you want to cancel. This ID is returned from setInterval().

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.ClearTimeout(System.Int32)
member.summary: Clears the delay set by window.setTimeout().
member.param: timeoutID is the ID of the timeout you wish to clear, as returned by window.setTimeout().

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.Close
member.summary: Closes the current window, or a referenced window. This method is only allowed to be called for windows that were opened by a script using the window.open method. If the window was not opened by a script, the following error appears in the JavaScript Console: Scripts may not close windows that were not opened by script.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.Confirm(System.String)
member.summary: The Window.confirm() method displays a modal dialog with an optional message and two buttons, OK and Cancel.
member.param: message is the optional string to be displayed in the dialog.
member.returns: result is a boolean value indicating whether OK or Cancel was selected (true means OK).

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.Confirm
member.summary: The Window.confirm() method displays a modal dialog with an optional message and two buttons, OK and Cancel.
member.returns: result is a boolean value indicating whether OK or Cancel was selected (true means OK).

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.DispatchEvent(Bridge.Html5.Event)
member.summary: Dispatches the specified event to the current element. To create an event object use the createEvent method in Firefox, Opera, Google Chrome, Safari and Internet Explorer from version 9. After the new event is created, initialize it first (for details, see the page for the createEvent method). When the event is initialized, it is ready for dispatching.
member.param: Required. Reference to an event object to be dispatched.
member.returns: Boolean that indicates whether the default action of the event was not canceled.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.Dump(System.String)
member.summary: Prints messages to the (native) console.
member.param: message is the string message to log.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.Focus
member.summary: Makes a request to bring the window to the front. It may fail due to user settings and the window isn't guaranteed to be frontmost before this method returns.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.Forward
member.summary: Moves the window one document forward in the history.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.GetComputedStyle(Bridge.Html5.HTMLElement)
member.summary: The Window.getComputedStyle() method gives the values of all the CSS properties of an element after applying the active stylesheets and resolving any basic computation those values may contain
member.param: The Element for which to get the computed style.
member.returns: The returned style is a CSSStyleDeclaration object.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.GetComputedStyle(Bridge.Html5.HTMLElement,System.String)
member.summary: The Window.getComputedStyle() method gives the values of all the CSS properties of an element after applying the active stylesheets and resolving any basic computation those values may contain
member.param: The Element for which to get the computed style.
A string specifying the pseudo-element to match. Must be omitted (or null) for regular elements.
member.returns: The returned style is a CSSStyleDeclaration object.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.GetDefaultComputedStyle(Bridge.Html5.HTMLElement)
member.summary: getDefaultComputedStyle() gives the default computed values of all the CSS properties of an element, ignoring author styling. That is, only user-agent and user styles are taken into account.
member.param: The Element for which to get the computed style.
member.returns: The returned style is a CSSStyleDeclaration object.

member.name: M:Bridge.Html5.WindowInstance.GetDefaultComputedStyle(Bridge.Html5.HTMLElement,System.String)
